Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and Fun Labor Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BJames4446
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 Days over labor day and it was a very pleasant experience. The staff was very accomodating and pleasant. Housekeeping was excellant! I had 2 grandchildren with me, they were 7 and 1 year old. We had a room, thank goodness, on the 1st floor and right outside our patio door was the minature golf course. It kept them occupied thru the whole stay. Except once the 7 year old fell into one of the water traps..... The pool had live music or DJ's so that was also entertaining and the 7 year old loved the Limbo contest, and the dancing right on the pool deck. She surprised me as I had no clue she knew how to do all those dance steps LOL Guess I need to get with it and the younger generation. We all had a Great Time and I was not disappointed in our stay even after reading all the negative reviews. It is an older hotel but the atmosphere and staff were very accomodating in our experience. I will go back again, hopefully getting the same room would be Great as well!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, comfortable, convenient...breathing taking views”
Reviews.Author: L M
Reviews.Content: This place is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the Atlantic ocean at its best. I am sure it had to do that we stayed here when school started, so the hotel was not at capacity, which was fine with us. Just so you know we are ordinary people with very simple needs. Hawaiian Inn provided us with great rooms (we had two) and we scored front and center views of the rising sun and on occasion the rising ocean tides...the Hawaiian theme is throughout the hotel, from the lobby, the pool area, and equipped with a tiki bar...pool towels were always available on request along with room cleaning service. We are the type that prefer the convenience of a kitchenette and our room did not disappoint. Convenience stores were a stroll away, along with beach shops and typical food fare like IHOP and Pizza-Hut. The price for our stay was great taking everything into account. Daytona's Beach was literally outside of our backyard. Rooms were never short on AC. Areas of improvement would be the bed and pillows - definitely overdue for an upgrade, but not so terrible. Overall we really enjoyed ourselves and we will be back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Billetc
Reviews.Content: Perfect view of ocean. For $90/night, something has to give for the great views! The "give" was the cleanliness, the ill-repair, slow elevator, less than stellar staff. If you want a cheap place with great views, and you can look past service and cleanliness, this place is fine. If you want ocean views, cleanliness, and service, pay more and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “not again!!”
Reviews.Author: duellapaul
Reviews.Content: The pictures do not show what this place is really like. They do not provide cleaning items for the kitchen, nor a bath matt unless you ask. The couches were soo low we could not get out of them without help. I had to adjust the shower water temp at least 5 times in one shower because it either ran too hot or too cold. The sliding glass door handle was broken and even they could not fix it. No lock, no they drilled a hole and put a stop pin inside. Did they not know before this time it was broken? They allowed-at least it looked that way-smoking and alcohol in the inside swimming pool and in glasses. The bar tender was very quick to kick us out when lighteneing started but did not say a word to them. The only good things were the water temp of the inside swimming pool-I like it warm, the info from the person working the gift shop, and the beach itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Place”
Reviews.Author: Ughmeister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in July for three days. I'd heard that some of the units were privately owned and that the quality of the rooms could vary. Our room, 224, however, was quite nice, with everything we needed, except paper towels. It was a suite that overlooked the tiki bar, with a somewhat obstructed view of the ocean. Still, I could check the waves from the balcony, which is important to me, because I surf. The waves out front were up, those days, although the bottom contours of the sandbar weren't producing waves that peeled, at least very often. If anything, I believe the desk clerks who were on duty when we checked were some of the least attentive, distracted representatives I've ever known. They made me feel as if I was keeping them from sort of argument they were having about some bad data that was entered into their reservation system. Their coldness and lack of attention seemed in stark contrast to my slight expectations of the spirit of "aloha" that Hawaii brings to mind. Having been to Hawaii, I can say with certainty that there was absolutely no "aloha" spirit when I checked in. Still, I never had to deal with them again. We didn't drink at the tiki bar and we didn't go to the Ohana show. But, we did enjoy our second floor balcony. Oh, and we had troulbe with the toilet, but a maintenance man came up and fixed it. He was actually professional and friendly. The official surfing area ends right at the south end of the property. During the summer, lifeguards will call you out if you drift past this point. Surfingwise, it's OK, but after it's Florida.

Reviews.Title: “We always have a great time at the Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: Bill L
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at the Hawaiian Inn for nearly 20 years now. We always have a great time there. We enjoy the fact that we don't really have to leave there,except maybe to go enjoy a nice dinner somewhere. We usually eat our morning meal in our room since all rooms have some type of kitchen. We cant pass up lunch at the Tiki bar where the food is great and the prices are fair. we also enjoy the poolside entertainment. Its nice to have something to do while being buy the pool. We usually end our day with a few cocktails at the bar with Tiki bar Dave. He has been there forever and always remembers us. Its nice to see the same staff year after year. I see so many negative reviews on these sights and dont understand it. The Hawaiian is an all around family hotel. If you would like to pay double the price im sure you can find that type of place down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Rachel u
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here this past week. We have stayed here a few times before and I wont stay anywhere else the staff is AMAZING and very helpful. We had a wonderful time. We were a group of three families that came from Michigan and we had the best vacation the pool is one of the best features in my opinion i think its the best in Daytona. The staff was very friendly and they helped make our vaction so special we meet so many wonderful people. We already have our rooms booked for next year i love my pool side room #122 its the best. Thanks for the wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Bad reviews are deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: Cody C
Reviews.Content: When I first looked for a place to stay at in Daytona Beach, I quickly removed the Hawaiian Inn from my list due to the TripAdvisor reviews. But boy am I glad that I did not trust the TripAdvisor reviews. I have no idea how it could get such bad reviews, and now I just assume that the expectations of the different reviewers are very high and expected a 5-star hotel. First of all, the pool did tend to be crowded but what else do you expect? It was not so overcrowded that I felt uncomfortable or could not enjoy my time either. Every day there was a different singer at the pool, which was very awesome because I did not see any other hotels doing this. The location is pretty good as it is only a few minutes from the boardwalk. The room my family stayed in was clean and taken care of with a very nice balcony as well. The staff was very friendly and also very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anybody that was staying in Daytona and wanted it at an extremely reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Mike C
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we found this "resort" on the Internet to the time we walked in the door the advertising was false. This place is nothing like the pictures. It is dirty, hot, and very out dated. On the front door there is a sign that explicitly states "Pool is for registered guests only, this is strictly enforced." this is absolutely false!! When you get to the pool there are people pouring in from the beach without wristbands. I asked the pool attendant and he stated that as long as they bought a drink from the bar they could stay in the pool area!! Are you kidding me? So as long as they continue to get drunk they can stay and enjoy the amenities that me and my family paid for?? The pool attendants are glorified bar bouncers. They have no intention of keeping the pool safe or enjoyable for guests. The only duty that they served was to make sure that patrons did not have a cooler that held more than a six pack. This is obviously to make sure that you support their bar. People are smoking everywhere by the pool. It's an overall bad experience. They have a laundry room but no change machine. The front desk also has no change. The elevators were out that led to the fifth floor for 2 days. I urge you to not let the pictures of this landfill fool you. Do not stay here. Pay a few extra $$ and go somewhere south on A1A. Please scroll down to see he same response that The Hawaiin Inn will put on this as well as every other bad review. There is no concern by this horribly failing dirty hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Yearly Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sheila B
Reviews.Content: I never do this, and I don't like to complain, but here goes. We booked a room with a lady named Rena on the 4th floor. We payed a 200.00 security deposit, and then the weekly rate for a total of 875.00. Traveled 12hrs to arrive at a smoke-free room, smoke filled. The place smelled horrid! Then, we found a balcony door with a dead bolt completely broken off. Oh, and there was access to the condo from either side of the facility. Contacted the owner, which told me that she would send a 24hr locksmith to our room, she told me that her maintenance man that had not taken a vacation in 20yrs, was on vacation. Someone did come to out room, looked at it and told us that he would have to repair the whole door, that there was no way he could repair it with what he had to work with. This was on a Saturday afternoon, I called Renata back, she then ask, "what do you want me to do about it, I am 1200 miles away!" I gave her a number to another resort in the area and ask her to just call and book us a room. She eventually complied, and we left the place, never to return again! It took us 12hrs travel time and 3hrs phone time, to resolve an issue that should of never occured in the first place. Please be careful if you are considering renting from this owner, it caused us to lose an entire evening of vacation time!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Daytona Beach, Florida”
Reviews.Author: ddmartin
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, July 27-29, 2012, was my third stay at the Hawaiian Inn, and after this weekend, I won't stay anywhere else. We had a ladies weekend for my friends 30th birthday, and weren't sure how many ladies were going to show up. The employees at the front desk were most accommodating and helped me out with all my issues. The room (#231) they put us in was beautiful and big enough for the 5 of us and we were able to eat in and save money, because it had a full kitchen. I will be celebrating my 50th next year, and I'm already planning to make reservations to stay there on the bottom floor at the pool deck, and the front desk helped me out with that too. It is so nice to return each year and see familiar faces and have a family friendly place to go too. The renovations that have been done are beautiful, but there are still a few issue that need to be fixed, but nothing that hindered our stay. Thank you Hawaiian Inn for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kathy D
Reviews.Content: We have been going to the Hawaiian Inn on our yearly vacation for 39 years. Over the years we have met some great families that have started going with us to play water volleyball. We are around a group of 25 or more families now!!! My family stays in units 108 & 109 for 2 weeks (July 8th - July 21st) and they are clean and well maintained. Some friends of ours stayed in unit 208 and WOW this unit has been redone and it is GREAT!!! I hope the owners of the units we stay in consider redoing their units like this!!! This year our housekeeper Karen was the BEST we have ever had. Michel and the front dest staff are very helpful and friendly. We wait to buy our swim suits every year from the gift shop because they are great quality and prices. The pool and pool deck are amazing. We make our reservations a year in advance to help us get the units we request. Can't wait until next year! SC/GA Volleyball Group

Reviews.Title: “Please get me out of this dump!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bob R
Reviews.Content: I can not explain how horrible this place is. Dirty, moldy rooms. It smelled of mold and urine. I would not let my kids touch the floor & cringed every time they needed to use the restroom. The pool was just as bad. I even asked for a pool skimmer to clean the pool myself & was told they didn't even have one on the property. To make matters worse we had a rat, yes a rat, that we heard every night in our room! My children cried every night & just wanted to go home!!! We will never stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The reason why there may be good and bad reviews....don't book!”
Reviews.Author: Jamie H
Reviews.Content: On 7/20/12 we attempted to check in and when we got to the room it was disgusting and it was a sweet by the way... nasty carpet, rotting or termite eaten doorway, rusty stove, everything looked dirty. The front desk told us that each room is private owner and some owners may not do any maintenance and some may do a lot. So you won't know what you are getting until you get there. In our adventures loading and unloading and being in the main area of the hotel and the elevator we noticed a lot of cheap and unclean areas. The elevator had peel and stick tile on the wall that was falling off, none of the fixtures had matching screws and although you may think these are little unimportant items it just goes to show were the Hawaiian Inn doesn't care about quality yet you are paying the price for a nice hotel while the cleaning staff is talking about football players in the hallway. We ended up checking into the Emerald Shores which is nearby and still in Daytona Beach Shore but not in the very crowed area by the International Speedway and Main Street beach entrances. We stayed at the Emerald Shores the year before and we thought loved it. We wanted to try a new place that looked just as nice and had a few more amenities like a tiki bar but that didn't work out. Emerald Shores was actually booked except their penthouse sweets on the 9th floor and we booked for only $30 more than the nasty room at Hawaiian Inn... We got 2 rooms, 1 king bed, 3 couches (1 pull out), 2 bathrooms, 2 balconies, 2 flat screen tv's, 2 bathrooms and a full kitchen!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE, POOL, BAR AND BEACH”
Reviews.Author: MMPJMH
Reviews.Content: This place has it all, right before your eyes: free parking in an open lot, a fabulous pool, friendly bar and the sandy beach is just steps away. There's even a coffee shop serving breakfast right in the lobby. We stayed one night on our way north, another on our way south. It sure is better when you can snag a room with a balcony and view -- but you can't beat the value here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth your money!”
Reviews.Author: Tracy768
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. SAVE YOUR MONEY!!! We booked directly with the hotel and requested a renovated room. After checking in to Room 334, we found we were not given a renovated room! The stove and inside of the microwave were rusted, the sliding door was extremely difficult to open (2 hands needed) and did not lock, the bathroom towel rack fell on the floor, there were numerous cracks in the ceiling and shoddy drywall work. They came and repaired the hot water in the shower that was pouring out the knob in the tub and one minute the water was hot then cold then hot again. The comforter was dirty and the maid complained that it was “new last week.” How many families used it since that time??? The staff in the poolside food café was EXTREMELY rude to my wife when she requested additional cheese on her nachos. She was told “A serving is a serving!” and was yelled at as he SLAMMED the tip jar down and said “Show your appreciation in here!” My wife complained to the front desk immediately and the clerk said that the food service was handled by another company. When my wife requested to speak to a manager she said “I don’t know when I’ll see the manager.” My wife gave her our name and room number, but of course, we heard nothing. There were more locals at the pool and bar area than quests. The bartender spent more time serving his local friends rather than taking care of the guests, including handling money and sticking his hands in the lime slices and cherries, etc. Nasty! At one point one of the locals asked for half and half and the bartender grabbed his chest even with families and kids around. The food service company also puts on a dinner show at the hotel. SAVE YOUR MONEY!! Not only is the show hokey, but the food sucks!! Bad bad food and they charge you 20% tip up front! Well like I said, save your money or spend a little more and actually stay some place that knows how to run a business.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: Joni H
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for springbreakers but not much else. If you have a family with children this is not as good choice. There is a DJ playing loud music by the pool every day from noon to six and a bar by the pool. The first day we got there a woman was pole dancing beside the pool, and was not asked to leave or stop by any staff members. The police showed up after being called by someone staying in the hotel. The rooms are dirty. Our sheets never got changed and the floor was never swept. Service is awefull. We called the front desk to ask for more towels and wash cloths, and they didn't have any. We called to get the phone number for pizza delivery one night and were told they didn't have any numbers but to Papa Johns. They only have one way in and out of the hotel and only two elevators to service everyone. And the rooms and hallways are very hot. The rooms are cheap but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT JUDGE A BOOK BY ITS COVER”
Reviews.Author: c r
Reviews.Content: pure dirt,bath black with mildew,beds flat.carpet pure dirt,no hot water in kitchen,stove did not work,staff did not care, i spent $20.00 of my $ trying to clean bath, had to beg for towels then would not give you enough and they were wore out and dingy,please do not waste your $ and ruin your vacation by staying here i am 67 yrs old and have stayed all over the usa and this is by far the worst--looks good outside--do not go in

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: Denise K
Reviews.Content: I am sincerely shocked by a few of the other reviews of this hotel. Our experience in staying at the Hawaiian Inn Resort was nothing like what i just read. We brought over 30 family members and friends with us for our destination wedding and everyone was very pleased with our stay. Although all of the rooms were different, some were remodeled and some not, they seemed to all be clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. With such a large party I was highly impressed with how organized and professional everything was. We stayed in room 432 and the view was breathtaking. The room was spotless and our very friendly housekeeping staff brought fresh towels, toilet paper and cleaned our room daily. We will be planning to revisit for our anniversary every year and wouldnt think of staying anywhere else! Thank you so much for an unforgettable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic! Hotel Impossible needs to visit!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trip S
Reviews.Content: This hotel seriously needs to be on an episode of Hotel Impossible. The rooms are terrible! The first room they gave us had a HUGE hole in the ceiling and mold all over the walls, stains all over the couch and chairs. When we asked to switch rooms, they were surprised that there was a hole and mold in the room (you could not miss it!) The next room they gave us was not much better although we did not see any mold. The bed was hmm?, old? It made horrible noises with just the slightest move (both beds). The bedspread was disgusting, luckily we brought our own. The hallways are dark and dreary. The steps going down to beach level are totally sand covered (to the point it is dangerous to walk down them). I understand that sand will get on the steps from the beach, but those steps are ridiculous!!! We DEFINITELY will not be back! We would have switched hotels, but there were no vacancies because of the race in town, we only stayed two nights and found another hotel out of town!!! The only thing this had going for it, was the staff was nice, but that is it. I do not understand why anyone would want to stay in this dump, not even if it was the last hotel in the city with vacancies!!!!!! DISGUSTING!!!! STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine1012
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over the Christmas Holidays and had a great time. Everything was clean and everyone made us feel welcome. Certainly enjoyed the Luau they had. Great food and fun was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: lovespain
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe that we actually paid to stay at this dump. It was disgusting! When we checked in, they put us in Room 501. It was nasty. Everything was old and gross. The doors were all rotted. There was no balcony. I simply could not stay there so they changed our room. The next room - Room 243 - was not much better. They do not give you soap and only a small tube of horrible shampoo (glad we brought our own). The doors again are rotted away. The door to the room never shut properly. Our view (with a balcony) was the parking lot and being on the second floor - the door did not lock. Anyone could have walked in. The bed felt like sleeping on a hardwood floor and each of us got a pillow that was flat as the floor as well - no extra pillows. The bedspread (if you will) appeared to be something they may have purchased from the Good Will. My husband did not sleep either night due to the DIGUSTING, OLD bed. The lobby and hallways did not have air-conditioning. Okay, this is Florida (and we do live in Florida). Everything MUST be air-conditioned. We were sweating everywhere we went. Outside of this NASTY Inn (motel?) was another story. You are near NOTHING! No restaurants, No nightlife, NOTHING! We walked about two miles until we found a gas station so that we could call a cab to take us to a restaurant and some nightlife. WHY WOULD ANYONE STAY HERE? Never Again!!!! I would really like my money back!!! This is a True Dump that should be gutted.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: Catev
Reviews.Content: Rude rude staff...anytime I went to front desk to ask a question ...places to eat ?? Things to do ?? NOONE and I mean NOT ONE PERSON working would acknowledge your presence ... Then all they would say is " I don't know " room was NEVER cleaned one day...they would only empty garbage can and left what was dropped lying in the floor... Had to ask every day for toilet paper, and towels and washcloths...twice they gave us their kitchen dish towels to wash our bodies off....rudest, most ignorant people I've ever met...and the arm band pool police says you HAVE to wear an armband even if you are sitting at the tiki bar of the evening, (i dont think so) but anyone can walk off the beach and don't have to...and he is VERY rude about it...have been coming there for a few years...through all the construction, "thinking" it would get better, but it has gotten worse...so I'm coming back next month and I WILL NOT be staying here, I'll just come visit the tiki bar " without" an armband and give my $$$ to another hotel that cares about their customers...

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Michelle S
Reviews.Content: We came here for the 2nd time around, since our first time coming we enjoyed it the room was clean and nice no issues. We decided to bring the whole family this time, and stayed in room 130. HORRIBLE!! Nasty, dirty disgusting. If you are a vain person then you will want to request this room, each room has mirrors wall sized mirrors as if you were visiting a fun house. Rats running in the vents, my kids freaked out. I def do not feel I got my money worth and wished we would of checked out and went somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJTripper2
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel directly on Daytona Beach. The view of the ocean is spectacular! We stayed in room 127 which was on the bottom floor facing the pool. It was very easy to come and go to the pool or beach by going thru the patio door that faced the pool. The patio door was very thick so you could not hear the noise from the pool. They recently renovated this place and supposedly, the rooms are individually owned. So, some rooms are better than others. The owner of room 127 where we stayed had just renovated this room. It had new beds, carpet, bathroom cabinets, and dining room table. The room was also convenient because there is a full frig, stove, and microwave. There was a burger joint next to the pool that was good and the had a dj playing music by the pool. We used the pool chairs on the grass facing the beach and were close enough to take a nice walk on the beach. This was a relaxing vacation in Daytona. There are a lot of eating places up and down the streets. The are also grocery stores and a 7-11 nearby. The room had two queen beds so there was plenty of room for our younger kids to share a bed. I would recommend this place if you get one of the better rooms. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: JOHN E
Reviews.Content: Our second year staying here. Great Hotel. Rooms are clean, maids were great the office staff met all our requests. Breakfast there is very good. Live music was not the best but "water dog" the DJ did a great job!!! Looking forward to going back next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities!!”
Reviews.Author: BNChampion
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and clean though dated. It was very family oriented. Every room had a great view of the ocean. The pool was nice. It had a tiki bar and grill. I was disappointed when placing an order for their "World Famous Burgers" that they were out of them at 7 in the evening. I was also disappointed that when I asked what kind of fish they served, they didn't know. I also requested a substitute for the fries. When my food came I got fries :( I would stay there again but probably find somewhere else to eat.

Reviews.Title: “This was our first time staying at the Hawaiian Inn and it was fabulous. We will be going back again.””
Reviews.Author: Tiffany J
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hawaiian Inn was just as the add on the internet said. We had a ocean front studio rooms with two Queen size beds full kitchen bath tv balcony. Just a perfect location and a wonderful view of the ocean. It had large out side pool and a heated inside pool, mini golf course and shuffle board. entertainment on the pool deck during the day and a Hawaiian show we went to on one of the nights. Well worth the price we payed for every thing. I will be back and have told many of my friends if they go to Daytona to stay at the Hawaiian Inn. Its well worth the money and we have no complaints. Loved it. Thanks for a great time. Staff and workers where great too.

Reviews.Title: “This was our first time staying at the Hawaiian Inn and it was fabulous. We will be going back again.”
Reviews.Author: Ighw_12
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hawaiian Inn was just as the add on the internet said. We had two rooms which were called ocean front studio rooms with two Queen size beds full kitchen bath tv balcony. Just a perfect location and a wonderful view of the ocean. It had large out side pool and a heated inside pool, mini golf course and shuffle board. entertainment on the pool deck during the day and a Hawaiian show we went to on one of the nights. Well worth the price we payed for every thing. I will be back and have told many of my friends if they go to Daytona to stay at the Hawaiian Inn. Its well worth the money and we have no complaints. Loved it. Thanks for a great time. Staff and workers where great too.

Reviews.Title: “We had a awesome time.”
Reviews.Author: Dena M
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a good value for the price. Sure it is an older building, but the price reflects that. Our kids loved the pool and the access to the beach. The elevators were in and out to the fifth floor, but it wasn't that bad. We would definitely go back and probably will next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Best view ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pat A
Reviews.Content: My family and I including a very young child found everything we were looking for in an oceanfront hotel at the Hawaiian Inn. With three pools, one inside and heated, we had a pool for any occasion. There is a poolside bar and grill which was also very convenient. We actually never had to leave the property. We loved it so much we purchased an extra night. I can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beachy Room”
Reviews.Author: JJdiving
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 127 which is on the first floor and goes directly out to the pool without having to use the hallways, stairs, etc. It is great to run back to the room to get snacks or sunscreen without having to worry about leaving my pool stuff outside unattended. I was also able to keep the door unlocked so the kids could run in to use the rest room without having to find me to get the key. I could keep an eye on the door to the room while laying out facing the ocean. It is like being at home with a pool and an ocean in your back yard. We did use the full size kitchen to make breakfast and lunch; however, the breakfast cafe and the poolside snack bar had great food. The kids also loved having the indoor pool just across from the room, so in the evenings I could look out the huge window and door to see the kids at the indoor pool. The main pool is HUGE. We also played on the mini-golf course facing the ocean... very nice with waterfalls and fountains. They do require the hotel guests to wear wrist bands so it will help keep out the non-guests from using the hotel amenities, which is great. The grounds were clean and we had no problem finding available lounge chairs by the pool or facing the beach. Our room had just been renovated by the owner. It had new carpet, two new queen beds, new dinette set, renovated bathroom and more. I have attached a few photos of the room. The parking was on the south side of the building and only 60 ft from the door to our room, so it was quick and easy to unload the car. We did enjoy several restaurants in the area, especially Aunt Catfish and Stonewoods. However, I loved that we were able to save some money by cooking in the room. I had read the reviews before the trip and was thinking the room would have a mini-refrigerator. NOT true- room 127 had a full size refrigerator, microwave, stove, oven, coffee pot and toaster. Jennifer, Brian and Alex at the front desk were polite and helpful. Karen and the other ladies in housekeeping were very nice and gave us towels as requested. We will be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: M P
Reviews.Content: Well after arriving there and going to the pool to relax they sent their maintenance men to tell us that we had to leave their property. Then after that embarrassing situation they refused to refund my money. It was not worth the money anyhow!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: Tammsh
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for 3 nights and we had an absolute blast! We initially were only going to stay the weekend but were having so much fun we added an additional night. The price was fair and we were able to stay in our same room. The room I admit was a little dated but was still perfect for us. The pool area is huge and access to beach was nice. We plan to go back at least 2 more times this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: BeachTrip12
Reviews.Content: The room was ok. Going into this I knew it wasnt a five star hotel so some things i did expect. The floor did have some stains. When you found the temperature for the shower you liked all of a sudden the shower would switch to either extremely cold or extremley hot (not good for the kids) and never could get it right. The balcony including the table and chairs had bird droppings all over it. The Wifi did not work for us which was ok. I booked this room mostly because it had a kiddie pool for my kids to play in. I was EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED that it was filthy. You can clearly see in the picture I took of it. Just a suggestion they should put the ice machines and soda machines in the middle by the elevators and not only the south end of the hallway. It did has some good things. We did ask for some extra pillows and they were very nice and prompt and did bring them to us. The staff was nice at check in. As far as the view it was wonderful. Large parking lot which was plus for us.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay.....30 years ago”
Reviews.Author: yougotjay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a privately owned condo which was very clean just a little dated. The pool area was nice and the heated indoor pool was also a nice touch. There was a tiki bar at the pool deck selling overpriced beers and way overpriced watered down mixed drinks. The hotel itself was just worn and outdated. The wifi was free but it was hit and miss most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Hawaiian Inn. It was lovely. The hotel staff was friendly and outgoing, the rooms were clean and scenery was breathtaking. The indoor pool was nice and comfortable and very clean and well maintained. The hammocks were a nice place to enjoy in the early morning. My niece had a great time at the mini golf. The only thing I was disappointed about was the Tiki bar closed to early and there were no torches around the outdoor area.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than A One Star With My Review”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel055
Reviews.Content: Come to Hawaiian Inn where they cater to young college adults who love to party into the wee hours of the morning. If you enjoy Slamming of the doors, Yelling and Hooting at the top of your lungs, Banging on Every room door in the hallway, and, keeping other families awake; this is the Place for You! No Security, No Rules, and No Respect for other vacationers. For those with young children, or older, and are thinking about a vacation at Hawaiian Inn - This is Not the place for you! For if you complain about the excess noise at 3 am, 4 am, 5 am; the front desk tells you "It is Spring Break!" Before booking we emailed the owner asking if the murphy bed was a queen, as we could not tell by the photo. We were told it was a queen, or at least a full size bed. He has owned this property since 2004 and doesn’t know the difference between a full and queen size. That should have been a sign, but we ignored it and proceeded with the rental. This person never disclosed what Hawaiian Inn is all about. It is a Condo - Hotel that caters to Spring Breakers and Bike Week partiers, and I mean "Hard Core Partying". It rents out other owners condo's to "anyone." We rented directly from the owner of unit # 229. I thought, I did my research on this place and could not find any negatives even on Tripadvisor dating from Jan.2012 to Feb.16 2012. We left for Florida on Feb.26 2012. You can tell by the different reviews of this place that most of the “Good” reviews are from the younger generation. No surprise on reading reviews about the broken things in the condo's, we know how they get broken. We paid for a month stay at this place. The ad had stated a relaxing time; it also stated it had a "full" kitchen with a "full" fridge, a dishwasher, and a queen size murphy bed. What we got was a kitchenette with a "bar" fridge, a "bar" sink, a two burner stove top, and a double size murphy bed that squeaks and grinds with every move – I posted a video of this and while we are showing the bed you can hear the music coming from the other condo through the wall. The owner’s ad has now been changed. The pull out couch needs a new mattress, as it has a few dips, but it was better than the murphey. In the closet area there is a heavy wooden dresser in front of the safe making it impossible to get into. There is no inside table or chairs, only on the patio. The towels are thread bare and you have bits stuck to you when drying. There is a spot on the wall where the "smoke detector" should be. The rug inside the condo has paint drippings and you have to flush the toilet a few times for anything to go down. We had no security with the patio door, as the lock was corroded and ready to fall off. This condo is on the second floor with only a partial wall between the patio's making it easy to climb over, or up to. It is directly across from the stairway door and is above the door to the swimming pools, so you hear the loud slamming from both sets of doors. There is no rug in the hallway to help smother the noise, so everything echo’s very loudly. We arrived on Wed. Feb.28 and on Fri. Mar.2 three bus loads of college students arrived with more on the way. Having no sleep for three days/nights, our vacation was in ruins. We contacted the owner of #229 during these three days who kept telling us security was there. We even called him at 2:30 in the morning so he could enjoy what we were enjoying. There was NO security. The police were called quite a few times, but soon as they left, the students started back with the partying. http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=endscreen&NR=1&v=FBQ_1uPr4zE – 2am http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsGk9tX11tw&feature=channel – heated pool http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MiDYfL5V53k&feature=youtu.be – hallway http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=npEsueEEtkc&feature=channel – condo inside These students had shopping cart races down the hallways, they trashed the lobby and took every information pamphlet and tossed them around including the elevators, over turned the concrete tables outside. Finally, we could not take it any longer and we left on Mon. Mar.5 to find other accommodations instead of enjoying what we thought would be a relaxing time. This condo owner knew we were grandparents and not the partying type which is why he rented to us, as he knew his condo would not get trashed like the others. We did not get the vacation we had hoped for, instead of staying in one place, we had to find other accommodations which rented by the week. We stayed at #229 for 6 days and we were charged for 13 days. We were tired of fighting for the remaining weeks we had paid, as we just wanted to salvage some of our lost vacation and get rid of the stress. I have to give credit to the front desk and all who works at Hawaiian Inn. They really tried very hard in keeping this place clean during this time. They were not rude to us and were very sympathetic to what we experienced during our stay with them. If you’re a student looking for an exciting time this is it. If not, you have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Bumme
Reviews.Content: This ace needs to be torn down and rebuilt! The elevators were grinding and jumping, we were afraid of getting stuck everytime. The room was such a dump! The carpet was damp and stained. The bathroom was a mess maintenance wise, shower only had cold or hot no in between, toilet seat was falling off, the sink and shower drains took forever to drain. The pools were disgusting! Baindaids, hair clumps, cigarette buts floating in it. Plus there is parking on the beach right in front of the pool area, we watched many people park and use the pool and bathrooms that were not staying at this hotel. Let me say, dump again! The housekeeping staff was very friendly and did a good job with what they had to work with. They were great! Oh and the towels were small and hard, I wouldn't even use them on my car! My advise, look elsewhere!!

Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Delana P
Reviews.Content: The rooms are less than lush. The doors are very heavy and loud all night. The lights didn't work 50 percent of the time. The outside door (we were ground floor) wouldn't lock - had to call maintenance when we arrived. Not enough parking. Less than friendly check in staff. TOO MANY spring breakers . . . had to call security. We were told by locals NOT the best part of town. Would not stay again. Left two days early, they called us to see if our room was really vacated . . . in other words, could they rent it and get double for a few nights. Ohm. . . NO!

Reviews.Title: “Very good do far but...”
Reviews.Author: sbanta
Reviews.Content: We arrived today and are staying 5 nights. The staff so far have been very friendly and helpful. However, when I reserved our room we were promised ocean front. What we got is a view of the Tiki room roof. This is our first trip to Daytona Beach so it's a little disappointing. Room 230.

Reviews.Title: “4 days on the ocean”
Reviews.Author: Sansail
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Florida early and decided to stay here for 2 extra days. We had booked 2 days from home. We have stayed here before and the location is great right on the beach. Some of the condos are pretty shabby but we ask to see several and always luck out. The condo we stayed in had just been re done and was great. The front desk staff are friendly. The housekeeping is somewhat hit and miss. We didn't receive towels one day but they eventually delivered them. For the price it can't be beat. We just wanted to enjoy the view, walk the beach and relax, and that is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok - a few hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Carole L
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaiin Inn for Daytona 500 - we stayed for 5 days. Our room was ok. The first night we slept on a curvy mattress, so we switched mattresses with other bed, again the mattress was curvy, woke up with neck and back pain. I then noticed that the box spring was completely wrecked, so my husband and I switch the boxspring, we slept much better, we kept our patio door open all night and slept at the sound of the waves, this was wonderful. The staff was very helpful and polite. I would go there again for sure, next time I will book directly with the hotel none of this bookings.com. It cost way too much going through them. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Central”
Reviews.Author: DWieler
Reviews.Content: So the first thing is that we rented a condo - part of the place but not run by the hotel - it's all a bit confusing but nonetheless... The accommodations were great, the pools are nice, the beach is magnificent, the staff helpful and polite. Problem...? It's called Spring Break - a million drunk and noisy kids descend on Daytona the first week of March and stay for six weeks (I understand the actual kids don't stay the entire time...). We found this out the hard way - not really the hotel's fault, and they tried to keep the noise down, but they were fighting a losing fight. So if you really need to stay in Daytona during this time, ask if the places you're considering do Spring Break. Unless you're a college kid looking for a good time, in which case, join the fun. I did 30 years ago and was glad I did. Not so much the past few days...

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: Before I booked I read all the reviews about the Hawaiian Inn. Was a little concerned before my arrival but because it was race weekend there wasnt much left. I was very impressed when i walked into my room. Sure some of the furnishings are a little dated, but you got to remember that you arent staying at the Hilton. Saw some rooms under construction which is a good sign. The staff was very helpful. Housekeeping was actually a pleasure(and they spoke english). We stayed on the first floor with a walk out into the pool area. Used the shuffle board and mini put. Would defiantly book the same room again next year.

Reviews.Title: “POOR PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: johnp875
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Daytona and i must say this resort(????) is not the place to stay. Anybody who likes this place has very low expectations. two days in a row i had to go to front desk to ask for wash cloths and the second time i got NONE. Can you believe this?? And to top this off Alex the guy at the front counter gave us two bath towels and told us to use them for wash cloths, what kind of place is this?? The water pressure in the shower was so low you almost had to stand right under the shower head to get wet. House keeping has no idea what a vacum sweeper is .The floors were never swept while we were there .The fridg was all frosted up and needed defrosted when we got there . Y ou would think for allmost 200.00 a night they could atleast have a clean place and give you wash cloths. LIKE THEY SAY "BUYER BEWARE" This place is NOT worth the money. DON'T STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “wow what a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pam s
Reviews.Content: we drove into daytona looking for a place to stay and were lucky to come onto this wonderful place. it had ample parking. the rooms are variable in their decor. the staff were wonderful in accommodating us. we planned on staying 2 nights but landed up staying 6 nights. the view from the rooms of the ocean were wonderful. really enjoyed our daily beach walks. we will only stay here when we travel to daytona

Reviews.Title: “Yucky place”
Reviews.Author: gramma06
Reviews.Content: Wow what can I say. Have always counted on reviews with trip advisor & this time decided to chance it even though the reviews werent the best Booked this place months ago. Did receive king suite with an ocean view but so poorly maintained. When we complained they let us look at 2 other rooms. They were in worse shape then the one we had. Come to find out these rooms are owned by individuals and are rented out. None of this is mentioned on the Expedia web site we booked through When we asked how to get out of rental we were told by the front desk we would have to go through Expedia to get our money back what the heck??? I could go on & on but trust me this place is so poorly kept. We were told some of the rooms are nice if that particular owner has renovated their place do it would be my advice to check this out On a positive note. Pool & tiki bar are nice but they are managed by a different group Cafe is NOT good. Don't bother there either

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Barnie9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn for four nights. We arrived early and Bryan was fantastic, he checked us in, front desk was so helpful with any of our needs. The rooms were just great, bedroom with 2 queen beds, living room with pull out couch, bathroom and kitchen. I must say I was concerned at one point after reading previous reviews but they flew out of my mind when we entered the room as it was very clean. The only problem we had was there was no housekeeping while we were there but there was no problem in getting clean towels at the front desk. We stayed in room 310 and had a fantastic view. I would definitely stay there again as they have everything a person needs. :)

Reviews.Title: “Such a great time we booked an extra day!!”
Reviews.Author: kimberly W
Reviews.Content: When I got there to check in there were no hassles the staff was really nice and had us checked in fast. There was so much to do beach, pool, golf and laying in a hammock. We had such a good time we stayed an extra day and the whole atmoshere was awesome I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Prices”
Reviews.Author: Rachel G
Reviews.Content: Hawaiin Inn of Daytona Beach is a very clean and comfortable hotel that we have found to be conviently located to everything. The staff is very attentive to the needs of the guests and management seems to be doing a great job! We have stayed at this property on several occasions and have yet to be disappointed, normally a hotel in this price range does not offer nearly as many ammenities. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to enjoy Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Haveing a GREAT time”
Reviews.Author: ninamariemanfredifor
Reviews.Content: We have been here for 5 nights now and are staying another 7. What a relaxing vacation this has been. the folks at the front desk have been nice and very helpful. The Luau was fun we even got up on stage and took part in it. The food was great, we smelt it the second night we were here and it made us want to go even more just to get a taste. There is a variety of ages staying anywhere from families with children, race fans for the upcoming weekend and seniors. The gal that works at the Tiki Bar is friendly and the drink prices are reasonable. We have family that live in Central Fl that have come to stay a night this past weekend and are hoping to be able to return again this one. They now have a great weekend getaway location that is within their budget and close to home. The room is large enough for the 4 of us that came down from Mass. Having a kitchen has been nice for sometimes but there is also a grill area that sells hamburgs fries and such because after all I am on vacation! Yes I could go on and on but as I said I am on vacation so off I go to enjoy it. Hope you guys have a great one when you come down this way.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal on the beach”
Reviews.Author: MARK f
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Hawaiian on Daytona Beach. The staff was very professional and helpful. The heated pool, putt putt course and shuffleboard added extra value. And obviously spending time on an almost deserted Daytona Beach was excellent. We plan on making this an annual event.

Reviews.Title: “It's what you make it”
Reviews.Author: rosapisces
Reviews.Content: Before my stay at the Hawaiian Inn I read every review and had seriously considered finding somewhere else. I am glad I didn't. Much of what I read that was negative was true. Could have been cleaner, there was some construction noise, house keeping was hit and miss at times, the pool was closed for repairs, and the some of furniture could be replaced. Having said this, I had a great time. Our room was totally livable; the view is amazing... we even saw doplhins on our last day just where I had been swimming only an hour prior. It is obvious that the hotel has made many improvements and is continuing to do so. The price makes it very accessible for the average person / couple / family. I would definitely return. We had room 519 which has two queen beds and a pull out couch - it wasn't perfect but I will request it next time if I was given a room I didn't like. What I mean by not perfect is the beds are not very comfortable and although you can tell someone tried to renovate the room the work is a little sloppy... but like I said, I would totally stay again. In fact, I'll likely look into purchasing a condo here of my own at some point. Mybiggest complaint is the beds... and the awful noise of the fans from the restaurant... they are loud and woke me up every day that the restaurant was open. Maybe it was so great since I expected worse.... but in all honesty I felt welcome, safe, comfortable, and had a great vacation. I also seriously recommend local restaurants Zen Bistro and Our Deck Down Under.... the best food I had while visiting.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Green Cove Springs, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “our wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel twice and are already planning another trip back.The staff here is fabulous ,the view is breath taking, and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated”
Reviews.Author: Holmby
Reviews.Content: What a sad place! Dark and old fashioned receptionarea should have scared me off, but no. The room faced the ocean and the view is spectacular, but the place is just sad, long corridors and a room where most of the furniture should have been replaced a long time ago. The area is not wery interesting either, just a ihop restaurant and a Mall close by.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: erey67
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week stay at The Hawaiian Inn and would NEVER return. The place is one step up from a housing project, totally filthy room, our room was never cleaned the whole week we were there, no hot water in the kitchen, we had to wash our dishes in the outdated dirty bathroom. The front desk staff was useless. There was mold not only in our toilet but on the bedroom wall. Dirty stained furnature, gross carpet and smelly!!! If it wasnt so cheap and I didn't have 6 people traveling with me I would have left the minute I saw my room. NASTY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “a little taste of hawaii”
Reviews.Author: naelele
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter here on thanksgiving weekend. She always wanted to go to hawaii but we can't afford it so this was as close as we can get for right now. The staff was very plaseant and helpful. The hotel rooms was clean. The dinner show was outstanding and my daughter had the chance to get on stage and learn a new dance. When we got back home she talked to everybody how she had fun on her mini vacation to hawaii. I highly reccomend anybody who can't afford to go to hawaii, come here and get a small taste of the experience. If i had one bad thing to say about them, I was disappointed the restaurant was not open for breakfast. We had to eat out but the place they recommend for us to go for breakfast was worth it. Thanks you guys so much for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just Horrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: michael f
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps the worst hotel I have ever been too! Gives Daytona Beach a bad wrap. Let me start by sharing the following: 1) There was a homeless person at the pool each day 2) The hotel was just filthy and so out dated 3) The rooms were sloppy and so unpleasant 4) The staff did not change out towels or even make the beds 5) The noise from the parking lot late at night woke our family up many times 6) Parking lot was filled with garbage 7) The plexy glass on the security gate was broken 8) Our room had three locks on the outside that two were not even used Please find another hotel and save yourself from misery

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a great hawaiian dinner & show”
Reviews.Author: steven f
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hawaiian inn july 2011 and had a great time. Staff was awesome (mel). The pool was big. The room was clean & had a great view of the ocean. The hotel has a dinner hawaiian show that was the best. We had a great time here.

Reviews.Title: “My vacation September 2011”
Reviews.Author: Kim F
Reviews.Content: My sister an I stayed at the Hawaiian Inn for a week. We use to bring our kids for 7 years from 1994 til 2001. This is one on be Best Resort Hotels I have ever stayed in. Most of the time you dont even have to leave the hotel. There is about everything you need right there. The staff and all help are so very kind and helpful. It is situated right on the Beach with the access to pool and sauna and the Tiki Bar outside to eat and pleasure. If i had any choice for a Destination to take another vacation, it would definitely be here. I hope to be able to come next year and carry on the tradition with my granddaughter and children which are grown. The Luau Diner Show is Awesome. So well planned and the food is tremendous. Cant wait to come back. I love the roar of the Ocean waves and looking at the Sunrise and Sunset from the room or out by the pool or on the ocean. Hope to see you guys again Next Year. Aloha to all and Thank you so much for a wonderful, enjoyable vacation. KIM FOWLER

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: timeline01
Reviews.Content: Staff very nice, right on the beach. Could see dolphins feeding from our room in the morning. Tiki Bar was fun, and again great staff. Short on towels, small concern, did have some from home. Did not eat at the hotel but found a great local breakfast place just up the street, The Cracked Egg, a must. Hotel had large hammocks on the beach with lots of palm trees. The Hawaiian Inn had some dated features, but I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away.”
Reviews.Author: Peggy H
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, Bikefest was beginning, but service was still great. Our room was lovely, we ate there for all our meals were delicious. Huge hamburger and fish sandwiches with prices that give a lot of good food for little money. The staff at the Tiki Bar were all fun and entertaining...... All in all....We had a great time. Oh yeah, and the heated pool was a plus as well. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: blue175
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends during spring break of 2011. The price was unbeatable at $200 for the whole week, but as my title suggests, you get what you pay for. When we arrived, we waited at the front desk for THREE HOURS for service, and the line was not nearly long enough to justify the wait. The card readers on the doors were constantly malfunctioning, leaving us locked out at inconvenient times of the day and night. Repair service was slow, but more acceptable than the front desk service. In general, the place seemed to be severely understaffed at what I imagine is a very busy time of the year (Bike Week and Spring Break). The place was undergoing renovations at the time, so naturally that entailed being woken up to the lovely sound of jackhammers and buzzsaws at 7am, then contending with the racket for the rest of the day. The cleanliness of the rooms was acceptable, but the hallways were godawful. Dirt and grime covered everything, and I even spotted a cockroach enjoying the shade under a hallway vending machine. Granted, this was partly due to the hoards of drunken college kids stumbling around the halls, but this is no excuse for failing to do simple daily maintenance. The location on the strip was good, as was the daytime poolside programming. Additionally, the shuttle service into town for the nightlife was a great deal. The hotel is only a block or two from various grocery and convenience stores, as well as both local and chain-type restaurants. No complaints here whatsoever. My advice: if you are a college student looking for an excellent spring break deal, this is the place to be, provided you can put up with service and cleanliness issues (trust me, you can). If you're looking for a place to stay with your family while at Daytona Beach, look elsewhere unless you are really strapped for cash.

Reviews.Title: “hawaiian inn is great!”
Reviews.Author: BB1234534388
Reviews.Content: My wife, brother and his wife spent 5 wonderful days there in Sept 2011. What a supreme location! Our rooms were clean and updated. Apparently there are new glass sliders to the balconies and the views unmatched especially the sunrises. The mgr, Brian, bent over backwards pleasantly accomodating all of our requests. He even made it a point to learn and remember our first names greeting us cheerfully each day. We had lunch several days at the outdoor Tiki Bar. The food was terific, portions large and the prices very reasonable. We plan to return at least a few times a year and wouldn't think of staying any place else.

Reviews.Title: “31st wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: pweekley59
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time!!....Loved the luau show...the pool was clean & the tiki bar was nice...we are locals & just wanted a getaway for our anniversary...the view was awesome & dont forget the hammocks!!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Linda1951_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good after the renovations.It is right on the beach and has a good sized swimming pool.Rooms are large and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “My family and I enjoyed our vacation stay at Hawaiian Inn, Daytona,FL”
Reviews.Author: edwinadasher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hawaiian Inn for 8 days and enjoyed it. Two employee that I would like to talk about are Tonia, housekeeping and Alex desk clerk. We wanted to change rooms since we couldn't use our computer in room 534 . the desk clerk did the change to another room 516 which the view was much better and closer to the elevator and we could use our computer.Also I had to use a wheelchair and cane and it was so much better since we changed rooms. Tonia was so nice to us. She is very cheerful and made our day start off great. She helped us in a lot and I really appreciated it. Thanks for providing a mode for us to tell the company about the good care we received. The manager was very friendly and agreed about the two employers I am talking about. We look forward to going back to Daytona and staying at the Hawaiian Inn. Thank you. May God bless you, Gene, Edwina and Christy Dasher

Reviews.Title: “ROOM 340 ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: slyle71
Reviews.Content: We were assigned room 340 and could not have been more pleased. This was a weekend getaway for mine and my husband's three year anniversary. The room was a one bedroom king size ocean front balcony room. The decor was tropical themed and beautiful. Living room had large tv and black leather furniture including a recliner. Full kitchen was spotless and had dishes/cups/glassware/plates. Bedroom had king size double pillow top mattress and clean, fresh sheets. Bedroom also had 26 inch flat screen brand new TV. Bathroom was flawless with desgner tiles and beautiful glass shower doors. Sparkling clean as well. Plenty of towels and hairdryer was available. Huge balcony ran across the front of the room with seperate glass doors for the living are and the bedroom. THIS ROOM WAS EVERYTHING WE COULD HAVE ASKED FOR AND MORE!! ((staff was courteous and helpful, too))

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and I was a little nervous about staying here. A friend who lives in Florida said to try it, so I did. I had a great time, the room was really nice and the pool was great. We had one issue with the room, I went to the front desk and they helped me on the spot and they were really nice. I think this a wonderful place to stay and will go back.

Reviews.Title: “My Daytona Get-a-way's with the Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: overhereinmo
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon the Hawaiin Inn while planning a long over due couples get-a-way..We stayed for a week in July2011 and we couldnt have been happier with the room, staff,location and price. I had such a great time that when I had to return for a cousins wedding in Spetember of 2011... I once again booked a room here. I invited a few girlfriends along and had an amazing time!!!!!!! The show was wonderful and worth attending more than once:) The Hawaiian Inn will see me again and again and again!!! Thanks to the Hawaiian Innstaff for making my 12 days in Daytona Beach a happy, safe, and memorable place...see u again soon :)

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Rose R
Reviews.Content: We had a surprise party for my daughter and the staff, Michele, Patty, and everyone was so accomodating.. The band at the Tiki Bar sang Happy Birthday and our rooms were perfect, and the food, Hawaiian Luau show and dinner was super.. What a great place for family and friends to get together.. Thanks everyone for allowing us to have a special surprise

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: Betty T
Reviews.Content: It was a really nice room and they had everything you could need at the hotel. They were very helpful to get us on the ground floor because we had small children. We liked the fact that it was on the beach. It was close to everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Family in Florida”
Reviews.Author: Laura G
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms, one for two nights and one for one night. When we went to check my son in on Saturday, the front desk could not find the second reservation but kept looking and called the reservations line. Once it was determined that the reservations line did not put the second one in they quickly found us another room and we were able to check in about 15-20 minutes later. The front desk lady was extemely pleasant to work with I could tell she enjoys her job working with people. Everyone at the inn was freindly and willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “We had a WONDERFUL stay @ Hawaian Inn & will go back for sure!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyJames
Reviews.Content: We took our kids for a family weekend getaway & had such a GREAT stay at the Hawaiian Inn Beach Resort on the South end of the bldg, our room was CLEAN & BEAUTIFUL. Our kids had a blast and it made our family time together well worth it, the ocean view was to die for & the staff was very professional & pleasant I must say. We will be planning another visit to the Hawaiian Inn in the near future for sure. It’s been a while since we took a trip with such respectful and professional employee, the manager promised us that we were going to enjoy & like our room & we sure did. LOVED OUR STAY THERE…

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: jtjdal
Reviews.Content: Great view of the ocean. Afternoon entertainment by the poolside. Tiki bar. Luau 3 nights a week. The price was reasonable and we really enjoyed our stay. Free putt-putt golf and shuffle board.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Spirit in Daytona Beach Shores”
Reviews.Author: Budskins
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised that the newly renovated Hawaiian Inn in Daytona Beach Shores has captured the Aloha Spirit of Hawaii. This charming resort offers 3 unique swimming pools, mini golf, shuffleboard, a hammock garden, video arcade, lively tiki bar with live music much of the time, an outstanding luau show, and a breakfast cafe. Each unit seems to be individually decorated with Hawaiian Decor and has a kitchen or kitchenette. Our unit offered all the comforts of home and provided us with a very relaxing atmosphere throughout the weekend. The Ohana Luau is definitely the best entertainment in Daytona and the buffet is over the top. This hotel is family friendly and efficiently run. We will definitely be returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay and WILL be back!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamsFive
Reviews.Content: I am sure that there are people that would have negative things to say about anywhere that they stay but our trip was great! Our room had a large private balcony, large living room, and it was clean. Our housekeeper, Shaq made sure that she did her best to clean our room to our liking and she promptly provided clean towels each day. We attended the Ohana Luau and it was magnificent! We will definitely be back. For the price we paid, we were able to get what we asked for......large room with private balcony, beautiful ocean front, and full kitchen with all pots, pans, utensils, etc! Thanks Hawaiian Inn for making our family's first trip to Daytona Beach the best!

Reviews.Title: “BAD! BAD! BAD!”
Reviews.Author: dmills20
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms four months in advance, figuring they would be next to each other. Our room 516, was nine doors away from 507. The balcony sliding door would not lock. When they fixed it by drilling a hole to put a pin in to hold it, (which was a clever idea that actually worked) they did not clean up the steel shavings and my grandson got them in his foot. There was an issue with the toilet in one room and when I called to have someone fix it, I was told that the person I was talking to was the only one available and if I cared to I could come to get a plunger, which I did. I felt like Fred Mertz on the Lucy show. We asked for towels about noon and though they picked up the wet ones they did not bring dry ones until early evening. The freezer compartment on the fridge in the other room frosted up to the point that the door would not close, so I had to chip away enough ice to allow the door to close. No toilet paper in the one room. The micro-wave oven had not been cleaned for some time. There was burnt food on plate. I was told that this is a Condominium Hotel, where-by the rooms are owned by individuals. If that is the case then New York is not the only place where there are slum lords. The folks who owned the rooms we had must be PIGS We drove eleven hundred miles to go to the TWILIGHT ZONE. I don't understand how these conditions are allowed to exist. I would hope that the other motels on the strip are not as bad. In the future we will go to someplace closer to us, perhaps Virginia Beach. Like Barbara Bush said, "JUST SAY NO" to the Hawaiian Inn! Darl "Pete" Mills Mt. Gilead, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “awsome room”
Reviews.Author: Lona0
Reviews.Content: my first trip to daytona beach.i picked hawaiian inn,for the price u cant beat it how ever each room is owned by differant people.some of the rooms i wouldnt stay in,but if you stay here one room that i stayed in was great i have to say who ever owns room 307 did a great job.i love this room and when i come back this will b the room i request.the staff is friendly and the room was clean.room 307 is ocean and pool front.very nicely decorated.thank you to the owner of 307 for takeing pride in your room,im loveing it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: brinck51
Reviews.Content: The only complaint I had was that the room had no lights to read by once it got dark and no table or chairs to eat off of inside the room. I did call the main desk to ask if they could find me a lamp and was told that the room belong to an owner and that they couldn't put anything in there, or borrow from another room .

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the value”
Reviews.Author: Bfwahoo
Reviews.Content: Can't best the value. The pool, tiki bar, beach, live band onweekends etc are all great with easy access. Will stay here everytime

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accommodations - 206”
Reviews.Author: lemonade3
Reviews.Content: Mary, My Mother and I had a lovely time and totally enjoyed the comfortable Unit number 206 at the Hawaiian Inn in Daytona Beach this last week. You thought of everything as far as amenities: toaster, coffee maker (including filters), microwave, blender, ice, utensils, hair dryer, mixing bowls, coffee mugs, plates, dish soap, dish towel & even cookware. The bed was very comfortable and everything looked brand new. I can’t think of anything I would have wanted that you didn’t already have in the unit. The view is awesome; we enjoyed most of our meals on the balcony looking out over the pool with a great view of the ocean. Thank you for helping to make our visit so enjoyable. Anita

Reviews.Title: “This place should be shut down”
Reviews.Author: ekytan
Reviews.Content: We arrived, told our room was ready but walked into a room with unmade beds, blood on the fridge, throw up on the floor, coffee in the pot, dishes in the sink. We waited another hour while they were "cleaning the room". We went back up the room still wasn't cleaned. While we were waiting also, three other famillies checked out because they were unhappy. We had our whole stay refunded. We slept in the car for a night...but it was infinitely better than staying in that place. Absolutely disgusting, even for us college kids. We felt extremely unsafe. The staff could have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “The absolute worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life.”
Reviews.Author: memphisbud93
Reviews.Content: PLEASE do yourself and your family/friends a favor by not staying in this hotel. If it is the only one within 500 miles with vacancy, I HIGHLY recommend canceling your trip. The only thing this hotel has going for it is its cheap price. I encountered a few problems in my room that a tourist never wants to go through. First, the air condidioning unit was very insufficient. I had the air on full blast cold and I was hot the entire time. And im usually always cold. Also, the service was terrible. Most of the housekeeping doesnt speak English. And my BIGGEST complaint about this hotel is the length of the time it took to get towels to the room. They only let you have 1 per person, but the average person is going to shower twice a day at the beach. Once in the morning and once after you get out of the sea water. Three times I waited over an hour to get towels and one of the times it ruined my plans because "all of the towels were in the dryer." Although there were many more small complaints, the last one I will bring up is the broken elevator. There is only 2 in the whole hotel, and one was broken. We had to walk across the entire floor to get to the elevator. And they were very hot. Dont stay here, even though it's cheap. Dont make the same mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Look further. Not where I want to lay my head!”
Reviews.Author: DaPon78
Reviews.Content: While staying in the area at another hotel, we decided to visit several hotel along the beach. We stopped by this one just to see if it might be worthy of a future trip. We did not stay at the hotel, only toured it. With that said, we will NOT stay at this hotel EVER! It is a mess. They say they are finishing up a renovation and only need to put in a few windows, but I'd say the renovation hasn't yet started and they need to put in a new hotel. Oh my, they provided a key to look in one of their rooms. It felt like we were walking forever. It was atleast 100-125 years from the elevator to the room. We passed rooms with a variety of doors and locks. We had to pull up our pants to walk through a partially flooded area where it appears the ice machine was either badly leaking or not cold enough to keep the ice from melting. We finally reached the room and we didn't stay in very long. It had an unpleasant must smell, and a love seat the seemed like a throwback to the 80's. The bed was uneven and squeaked loudly when I leaned up against just barely. We left out rather quickly. The hallways are long, dim, and really a bit scary. The elevator stink and my wife held her breath while on it. This is a poor place overall. Many of the units are individually owned, so maybe you luck up with a nice room, but in a crappy hotel. However, I'd expect that the privately owned, nice rooms are only available though the owner on a condo leasing site and not available if you book directly with the hotel. This is not the place to book, go to the Emerald Shores for a better room and maybe a cheaper price. The Holiday Inn Express and Suites in the 3300 block of A1A is the safest bet. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and updated. We stayed there, but found the Emerald Shores hotel to compare fairly well when we visited it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: daddyjohn24
Reviews.Content: Since all rooms are individually owned there is a wide swing in the room quality. We got lucky and were booked into a newly renevated unit. The construction on the hotel is pretty much completed, and our stay was fantastic!!! New room---great dinner show--tiki bar and hammocks!!! We will be back, but we will also request room 517. The O'Conners Rochester N.Y.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our time at the Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: cookie53449
Reviews.Content: The Inn is being remodeled nicely. We can't wait to return when it is finished. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The pool and outside grille are so reasonable and convenient. Don't miss the Hawaiian Dinner Show! So much fun.

Reviews.Title: “omg,, the website dont give it justice,, goto their facebook page”
Reviews.Author: ckck357
Reviews.Content: first and foremost,,, i really have to give much love to ANASTASIA at the front desk for busting her butt to make my trip wonderful,, there were so many ppl trying to check in or out,, and with all business things can go a little wrong,, ANASTASIA was the sweetest woman i met in daytona,, she made it a point to go way more than her job description and actaully ran up the floors to make sure my room was perfect,,, so when you see here,, you will know you are at agreat place,,,,,no this hotel is not the billon dollar sky rise in daytona,, but is the most down to earth beautiful hawaii theme adventure,, the pool never closed,, there are hammicks everywhere, and the beach is right there by your room,, directions there are simple,,, my room had a kitchen and there was a grocery store and liquor store ,,across the street ,,,it does save you money,,, i recommend room 222,, its perfect for the scenery,, nic e bed ,, bathroom floors and patio,,,,i do recomend you get out to the beach by 9am to resevre your own large umbrella and chairs inches from the water,,, 30 bucks a day is worth it,, after that enjoy the nice clean pool and DAVE the bartender over at the tiki hut on the property,,,, i have a facebook page ckck356@hotmail.com ,or search for matthew ck woodward ,,is the easier way to find me,, i have lots of unproped pictures from every angel of the property,,, i wouls also encougare you to go to the website on FACEBOOK for the hawaiian inn instead of the oringnal site,,,,, i had fun ,,i spent more on gas then i did my stay there,,,,,,,, thats almost priceless,,, ps,, they have a great dj,,, mike dj felony,,,,,,,,,, he has a facebook page as well,,,, ans thank you again ANASTASIA for your great help,,,

Reviews.Title: “One word- AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieBoop07
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend!!!! Everything was beautiful and awesome. It was a girls weekend out and there were 4 of us. We loved our room and the view was amazing. The luau dinner was the best thing i've ever seen and the food was incredible. the only complaint we had was the shower, how it would be extremely hot then extremely cold no matter what you did to it and it would go back and forth from cold to hot. it was definetly bipolar. But other than that it was total awesomeness!!!! Oh and we wanted to throw a suggestion out there, the heated indoor pool, we think, should be open 24/7 but after dark it should just be adults over 18 only. that would have been awesome. We love this hotel and will definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Nightmare, AVOID”
Reviews.Author: mmc1235
Reviews.Content: This was our second Spring Break at the Hawaiian Inn, and it will also be our last. To start, we requested the same room we had the previous year because we enjoyed the location in the hotel and its accessibility. I called three weeks after booking the room, which was also 3 weeks before our intended stay to ensure that we had the room we had requested. The staff member told me that we were given that room and looked forward to seeing us shortly. Upon arrival, during check-in, the staff member at the front desk told us we were in room 222, which was not our requested room.
