When we mentioned the request they told me they didn't know about it, and that there was construction being done, and the room was unavailable. Later my friend witnessed guests walking in and out of the room we requested. Our room on the second floor was nice, but very inconvenient as it only had a King and a pullout Full, where the room we asked for had a King and a pullout Queen. As we put our bags down on the bed, it collapses on the bottom right side. We changed clothes and headed out for dinner. On our return back to the hotel, no more than a few hours after check-in, we stopped by the front desk on our way to the room and requested a cot and told the staff member that the bed was broke when we put our stuff down. He asked for our room number and had one sent up. The cot was only requested because the King could not be slept on. Our checkout was suppose to be on a Friday at 11am, but we decided to checkout a day early and left Thursday evening. At the time of checkout, the staff showed me all the charges that accumulated throughout the week on my particular credit card. Everything was correct, they even forgot to charge me for my security deposit. He said there won't be anymore charges on the account. However, the following Monday, I had a charge on my account for 100$. After 10 minutes of re-explaining my story to each of the staff members before they let me talk to anyone who could do anything, the supervisor told me the room had been inspected and the bed cost 100$ to fix. First off, if I had a wrench on my spring break vacation, I would've fixed the bed myself, but instead I tried to enjoy my stay, thinking the staff might have made note of the reason I requested a cot. She told me the room had just been put together and everything was new. Yet, the tile was cracked throughout the room, the sink and shower had mold around their fixtures. The maid service was nonexistent. Every day my guest and I went down to the front desk whether it was for towels to shower, or toilet paper for the bathroom. Even talking to one staff member who was recently hired told me had heard nothing but complaints since he started working there. I will not be returning to the Hawaiian Inn due to their lack of ability to inspect rooms firsthand, their very poor customer service, and their lack of communication through their own staff with things like requesting certain rooms, noting why a cot was even requested. Poor management, stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Valerie at Front Desk; a big thank you ! ! !”
Reviews.Author: Mrsb517
Reviews.Content: I was expecting an important Fed Ex package today or tomorrow, and we got that dreaded phone call, someone at home had passed away, we needed to get on the road. I was in a highly emotional state, and Valerie behind the desk at Hawaiian Inn, offered me a few suggestions to handle my issue; thank you Valerie for your above and beyond service! The hotel is under a major renovation, but I'm sure before long it will be the hotel we all know and loved. We are snowbirds from Michigan and have spent many winters here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Balcony - Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: vivadenda
Reviews.Content: Perfect View on a new Balcony. Nice little kitchen. Tiki Bar was cool. Half the place was under construction but where we stayed was fine and the price was really good deal!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: LuvinLife48
Reviews.Content: Brought in the New Year right here and it was a wonderful choice and the stay was nothing short of great. First i would like to say that this is not my first stay here. I have stayed here a few years ago and i can really say that i see a great improvement. I would like to take a moment to thank Michele and Louis and Merissa (hope i spelled your names correctly) for your assitance and helping to make my visit a extremely nice one. This was the first time in a very long time that i have spent a lot of time in my room and really did not feel like i had to just get out of the room. I was well-informed of the construction going on at the hotel right now, but i can honestly say that it was not really bad at all. We were lucky enough to have a really nice room and i had requested a higher floor and was lucky enough to get a newly renovated room on the 4th floor. If this room is representative of the upgrades to be completed, the Hawaiian Inn will be al really all around great place to stay. The room service was great and i can not say enough how warm, welcoming and helpful the staff was. I saw nothing indicative of some of the negative reports that i read lately on the Hawaiian Inn. I would stay here again and recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump!!!!! Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: wtrgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like advertised. It is a run down dive that is completely under construction. The staff is rude. Nothing is open. There isn't even soap in the rooms. Don't stay here. This is the nastiest place I've ever been.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: eellis9
Reviews.Content: Upon deciding our location for honeymoon, I was immediatly informed of this location by two, yes two, of my co workers. When looking at the previous reviews from other people, I was a bit hesitant to book with the company. The prices were just irresistable, so I called them promptly. Roy was pleasant and understanding. He reassured me. These concerns were being adressed at this time. The Inn is being completly remodeled and will be ready soon. We booked, as Roy and Michele had a perfect room for us. When we arrived, we were so happy with the accommadations. Getting to our room, we had no problems. We enjoyed the trip so much, that we stayed one extra night. The put put was fun, the pools beautiful, and the staff more than accomadating. The price was fantasti! The decor of the room was not so impressive, but the view was the best. We even saw a school of dolphin swimming and jumping about as we left. Room 430-we love you! Thanks' for the memories. Erica Ellis-Wilson

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ratdog25
Reviews.Content: Hotel looked great on internet, but it's all bogus. Old hotel falling apart. Room smelled of mold and urine. Woke up first morning with multiable bed bug bites...CHECKED OUT _NEVER TO RETURN!!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love this place! You owe it to yourself to try this place.”
Reviews.Author: sdove7036
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at The Hawaiian Inn for over ten years off and on. Since I hadn't been there in two years, decided to check it out on line, and was surprised to see bad reviews. I'm SO glad I followed my instinct and stayed there anyway! I would have truly missed out otherwise. I was traveling alone this vacation, so perhaps I notice more than usual, but it was all good. Let's start with the staff. So courteous and helpful you would have thought their managers were standing behind them at all times. They were at the ready with a welcoming smile and eagerness to find solutions to whatever your situation might be. Roy was at the front desk when I checked in, he was a pleasure to deal with, and had a wealth of information on the hotel itself, as well as surrounding area, and what to do for fun. Next I met Jackie on the housekeeping staff. She came by every day like clockwork, and was happy to give me the "extras" I requested like a few extra garbage bags, or extra towels. Finally I met Yana at the front desk. When the clasp on my bathing suit broke, Yana scurried around until she found a sewing kit so I could make the repair. I made a point to ask for the General Manager, Luis, so I could commend him on the way that both the hotel AND his staff were exceeding my expectations. Also worth notable mention was the gift shop. I met Dave there, who walked me through an entire new outfit... head to toe... literally. From my new sunglasses all they way down to my new flip flops, and a few items in between... all for a total AFTER taxes of less than $90! I couldn't have gotten that much for that little in my local mall! The food and service were also above expectation at the tiki bar, and at the grill by the pool. The couple that runs those two places are both so outgoing, they put me completely at ease, and had me so engaged in conversation with them and others there, I actually forgot I was vacationing alone. This hotel is older, yes, but it was clean, and they did their absolute best to make sure I had a nice stay. They are undergoing some renovations, which are noticeable, but also commendable. I look forward to seeing what improvements have been made by my next visit. While I was there I saw balcony replacements beginning, and stacks of new mattresses arriving. It’s nice to know that they're on top of things. In closing, please see for yourself the room I stayed in, unit 119. I've attached a link to the video I took when I first arrived. I hope you give this place a try. On top of everything else, it's a tremendous value! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fPwLmbci7LY

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Inn, Never Again”
Reviews.Author: cfh030495
Reviews.Content: A hotel stuck in the 70's. This was the 1st time I was able to pay my whole hotel stay a month in advance. In order for my family to be able to take a vacation this year, due to the economy I was forced to find a hotel that was not so expensive, (Something I will not do again). After driving 700 miles, I walk in the lobby and was informed I had a balance of $15.75, of course I had the paperwork indicating I paid for 6 days in advance and paid what I was told to pay. The man at the front desk, insisted I was quoted the incorrect amount, and made my husband and I feel that if that little amount was paid we were not staying, that's the impression we got, he even turned his monitor around showing me I was wrong. It wasn't the amount I was upset about it was the principle of the thing. We were informed of our room # before he went on about the $15.75. Then after all that mess, he took on himself to change it, that too may not be a big deal to someone else but at the time we made the reservations, and at the time I paid it all in advance we request the highest floor possible, and the center of the hotel, they said that wasn't a problem, he tried to move us from room 419 almost top floor to room 237 almost at the bottom on the side. Lets get to the room, hair ball on the wall of the bathroom, cracked mirrors on the closet, along with tracks of the closet and sliding glass door to the balconey was rusted. The door took me and my daughter to open. The side of the refrigerator was rusted (nasty)!!! Let's go to the 4th day, knock on the door, they said "your checking out today", I said no, the next day, knock again said "so you're checking out" I of course said no, then the phone rang in the room, "I have you're checking out today, by this time after repeating myself I was a bit upset. My husband again took the same paperwork down to the front desk, he spoke a manager. He informed my husband that the staff was instructed to see if we were going to check out early. WHY? After leaving that so called place, I arrive home, I checked my bank account, i had 2 charges on my account for $95.63 on 7/29 and 7/30 just so happens those are the 2 days they come knocking on my door, i called the hotel, all he said was we issued credit back, my argument was, why were you all in my account when everything was paid in full a month in advance. Of course the manager was not there at the time i called, I did call back and i spoke with him, all he said was he was sorry, and blamed the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is old and ragged!!”
Reviews.Author: OkieFamilyOf5
Reviews.Content: If you see the pictures on tripadvisor they are REAL!!! We thought that if 50/50 recommend that it would probably be alright. WRONG!! The pics of paint peeling, concrete missing are so true. The hotel rooms are OK. Seem to have clean sheets, but the showers are molded, the ceilings are molded, balcony doors don't work, most check-in/out staff is not friendly. When we were checking in, my husband ask the clerk what the rooms looked like and her reply was "I've never been in one of the rooms" and they can't even tell you what it cost to wash and dry in the laundry. The lobby was nice and so were the pools. After seeing our rooms and the condition we canceled our reservations to the dinner show (it cost more than advertised too). They say it will be about 2 yrs before its remodeled, so maybe then it will be a nice place to stay again. The hotel does have 3 pools, ping pong, small arcade, and putt putt golf, but is not within walking distance to the boardwalk or hot spots. Wifi is handled thru a 3rd party, not the hotel and it costs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, Horrible Place. Never Again”
Reviews.Author: charkeyp
Reviews.Content: Room was not ready by 4pm check in time. Lobby was FULL of people wanting their room. We got moved to a differant room than the one we had paid for. Walked in it and the trash had not been emptied and there was no towels or soap. The room was a dump. The pool was dirty and too deep for my 8 and 10 year old. The next day went to the managers office who fed us a bunch of BULL Crap but we finally got moved to the room that we had paid for. Every night we had to call down to desk for towles, then still had to go get them ourselves. Seems like someone was at the desk having problems every time we passed by. Was going to do laundry but the change machine was empty and the front desk had no quarters, so their solution, "walk to the motel next door and ask them". The tub did not drain. Elevators were down right scary. Would not reccomend this place even to the people that I dont like

Reviews.Title: “This was the worst place I have ever stayed! Black mold on the walls!”
Reviews.Author: ajcypret
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely disgusting! There was black mold on the walls, the sheets and comforter had stains (I even went and bought sheets pillows and a comforter for the bed) We stayed for 2 nights. I was with my husband, parent inlaws, sister and borther inlaws, a teenager and two children ( Inlaws paid so we stayed.) We were locked out our room for 2 hours due to a lock malfunction. The pool was nasty and we never saw anyone clean it! The ceiling was falling down in the shower and their was mold on the shower curtain. The airconditioner was leaking water onto the floor. On the outside on our balcony ( door was also not working properly) the concrete was falling off of the rebar. Oh and the shower would not drain! The TV was fuzzy and the carpet was coming up. I have stayed in $35/night rooms that were better and cleaner than this place. I really felt like I was going to leave that place with some kind of disease! It was GROSS and I will never stay there again, I will tell everyone about the terrible experience! If you want to have a nice vacation do not stay at the Hawaiian Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Condo, Pool and Deck and Beach”
Reviews.Author: KChesnut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn and rented from Owners and the condo was great clean cool and very nice. All floors of our condo were tile and new. Hotel has done lots of renovation on the balconies on the north and south and street side and will continue to replace the balconies on all rooms this fall. Pool is huge with large deck area and bar and grill. Pool needs to be cleaned more often. We have stayed here many times before and found that we still like it and great for kids. We met a lot of nice families and hope to see them next year. The Hawaiian show was good as usual but dinner was not as good as expected and overpriced. Looking forward to returning soon or next year. Music out by the pool and games on Thurs, Fri and Sat. Always rent from owners not through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Hawaiian for yourself ; )”
Reviews.Author: minadolphin
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Hawaiian for 6 years now and I will continue to go back evey year. The atmosphere with the DJ and Tiki bar(poolside grill with the best food) and largest swimming pools is amazing! I see alot of negative reviews from people and all I can say is they need to go through my wonderful agent Stephanie Jones one time and they too will be back.She will bend over backwards for you to make sure your visit is one to remember. I have rented different units each time I have went and I have never had a bad experience.All of her units are clean and very well kept. She was able to accomodate me and 48 guests for my wedding which I could not thank her enough for making it remarkable!! It was so great most of them returned with me this year. During the past 6 years I have seen so many changes ...all for the better. And it is going to continue to get better with all the renovations that are taking place. Its great going to a place on vacation where they know you by name when you walk through the door. We have met so many nice people there who go back the same time every year as my family and I do. I recommend those who are looking to stay here go through condosindaytona.us and book through Stephanie Jones. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: vsfkyfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days--and that was definitely too many! Sliding glass door was falling off in son's room Furniture was falling apart . Looked like it had not been redone since it was built 30 years ago . It was very disappointing . The location was great, but after dark you were in trouble because there were no lights around pool or outside of hotel All I can say is DO NOT STAY HERE !

Reviews.Title: “this place was beyond bad”
Reviews.Author: amyron
Reviews.Content: first room had horrible beds no lights and toilet didnt work and front door didnt lock and wireless internet didnt work

Reviews.Title: “Very nice roomm with great view!”
Reviews.Author: GiGi863
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hawian Inn on several different occasions, room was owned by private owner Mary Moates. Everytime I have stayed there the rooms where very clean, nice hot showers and the kitchen has always had what we needed to cook or clean with. Also plenty of space to sleep, (we had 5). I would highly recomend staying with Mary and plan on doing so again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest places and easiest people to deal with!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mscatherwood
Reviews.Content: We have been renting from these paticular people for years (Mary Motes) and she is always so kind and helpful. Her places are extremely clean and reasonable. The decor is beautiful and we will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Spring Break ever.....”
Reviews.Author: lexiebolinger
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based off its website which looks really nice. My friends and I were looking for a hotel on the beach so we could have a little spring break fun. When we walked in the door they immediately charged us a $75 deposit which was not listed as a requirement on their website. Then they proceeded to put us in the worst room they have on site. The furniture was molded and the ceiling had leaked and was brown and peeling. No one cleaned our room all week nor did they bring us towels and fresh linens. We had to go down to the front desk to ask for them and change our own sheets. I know that we are young but this felt like discrimination against us on the hotel's part. Everyone that works at this hotel was rude to us the entire week. We will never stay here again and will tell all our friends and their friends to never stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Inn is great!”
Reviews.Author: ahamman
Reviews.Content: I rented a Hawaiian Inn condo from Mary Motes in March of 2010 for Spring Break. Being a college student, I thought the condo was extremely clean and offered at a reasonable rate. Room accommodations were nice and the balcony view was great. I would definitely recommend renting from Mary and I hope to return to Daytona Beach in the future. Thanks again Mary!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get out of there fast enough.”
Reviews.Author: DeePBonn
Reviews.Content: We weren't looking for anything fancy, just relaxing with a good view of the ocean. Our experience was anything but.... The first thing I noticed upon entering the room was the big chunks of concrete missing from the balcony walls exposing the rusted metal reinforcements. The second thing was the loud DJ music coming from the pool. It was so loud, we thought maybe the balcony door wasn't closed. That's when we discovered the door didn't really close properly. The oceanfront unit we rented, as with most of the units, looks first out at the very crowded pool, then past the hut where the DJ had his amps blasting back at the rooms, and then in the distance, a bit of ocean. To top it off, the building is curved such that the neighbors on either side can go out on their balconies and look into our room. In order to gain some privacy, we had to close the drapes thus negating the bit of ocean view and darkening the already very drab room. One of the beds was what I call a canoe bed. High on the sides and low in the middle making it impossible for two people to sleep comfortably unless you wanted to sleep in constant embrace. What we didn't realize is that because the rooms are privately owned, each one is different so experiences could vary greatly. However, some of these complaints would apply no matter how nice the room. We had reserved for 2 nights, but the receptionist graciously let us out of our 2nd night's stay. We moved to the Bahama House where our experience was much improved and well worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Served the purpose......”
Reviews.Author: dratmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Bike Week 2010 in the beginning of March. For the amount of time that we spent in the room, it was fine. We booked through a private owner, Mary Motes, so this was good & bad....good for not waiting at the front desk to check in, but bad because we didn't have any cleaning service/replenish towels/toiletries etc. for 7 days. NEGATIVE POINTS - Lights were dim, all hot water in the shower if you turned cold water on it was freezing, balcony was falling apart, lots of pigeons (& pigeon poop), pool was not the cleanest, however it was too cold to swim anyhow. Tiki bar was not happening (again due to the cold weather), sliding glass door to balcony was not in the greatest shape but still worked with a little effort and there was remodeling going on but never affected us, not very sound proof for sleeping at night. POSITIVE POINTS - King size bed was clean and comfortable, heating system worked, all appliances in the kitchen were clean and working properly, room was clean and very well decorated for the age of the hotel, good location, oceanfront (can't beat that!!), there WAS hot water in the shower (some hotels don't have this especially when everyone is getting showers at the same time), staff was friendly. Lets admit that you can't please everyone all the time - but remember you are on vacation and usually don't spend a lot of time in your room anyhow. Its all what you make of it......... It's not the Hilton - that is down the street further and more expensive!!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingmom66
Reviews.Content: When me and my family arrived at this hotel I should have known it was going to be a diaster. The outside of the hotel looked like it had just been hit by a hurricane. There were so many things wrong throughout our trip it wasn't even funny. When we checked in the man was very nice. We weren't told that to get to the 5th floor there were different elevators. we got on one and realized it only went to the 4th floor. After we reached the 4th floor we left the elevator to find ourselves roaming around the floor trying to find the way to the 5th floor. Once we finally found our room, we went in ti find the room nicely decorated, but that was about it for the nice things. We had a room with a king bed and 2 futons. The king bed was pretty much like sleeping on the springs covered with fabric. The futons were like they had been used to death. The cushions on them were flat and one of them was broken completely on one end. Needless to say it was very awkward to sleep on until someone finally showed up to fix it. There was never fresh towels brought to our room. If we wanted them we had to go get them every time and then most of the time they wouldn't even have any. We ended up having to use our beach towels we brought. In the bathroom shower you could only turn on the hot water and if you turned on any cold at all it would all be freezing cold. We had a small kitchenette and all of the glasses in the cabinet were pretty severely cracked and not really usable. The pools were all pretty nasty and the indoor heated pool was not even indoors. It was only covered and the only way to access it was by going outside. The sliding door that went out to our patio wouldn't slide and all of the blinds were either missing or broken. The patios are not private at all and very unclean. There was pigeon pooh everywhere. This hotel is what you might call a party hotel. It was full of drunk college kids screaming and yelling the whole time. If you don't mind all of this kinda stuff this is the place for you! I have done a lot of traveling and I think this is the worst place I have ever stayed at. There are so many other things that were wrong, but I am hoping the things that I have listed will detour you from staying at this place.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY, RUSTED, FALLING APART, SPEND A LITTLE MORE...DON'T STAY HERE - TRUST ME!”
Reviews.Author: blah8888
Reviews.Content: A mini-family vacation turned into a 2-day anxiety, high-stress battle between my family and the crass spring breakers. After a 3 hour drive, we went up to our room which had HOLES ON THE WALLS. The headboard was pulled off the wall, the "artwork" had a crack down the middle of the glass, telephone was cracked, furniture was scuffed. I called service desk and Raoul (who is outstanding!) moved us into a different room. We waited and finally made it into the upgraded room an hour later. We were exhausted and lost vacation time during this shifting process! When you're taking care of a 16 month old, you have a schedule to maintain and this was completely ridiculous! After we finally get settled in the new room, I spotted what appeared to be "2" sauce stains on the comforter. DISGUSTING! So, of course I had to check the rest of the filth, and found what appeared to be VOMIT or DRIED FOOD SMEARED on the fitted sheet!!!!! Raoul again provided sheets, he did not have the key to the closet so he provided queen size sheets to a KING size. So, we had to use the flat sheet as a fitted and both my husband and I had to cover ourselves with the fitted sheet!!!!! And of course, by the time we went to bed after showering, etc. the "KIDS" were back and LOUDLY YELLING & TALKING - EXTREMELY LOUDLY as they paraded down the halls. Sleepless night one down the drain, we each got 3 or 4 hours sleep. The next day, went down to see what other lovely room we were going to be stuck to, and the place was crawling with cops and the "KIDS." Patiently we waited, only to be told he would give us a room in about 20 minutes. Loved the fact that the gossping about the mayhem caused by these criminals was more important then taking care of the other "guests" as if they were the only exclusive guests. Which, by the way OUR MONEY IS JUST AS GOOD and WE DON'T DESTROY YOUR PLACE OF BUSINESS. We had plans for 10 o'clock so had no time to waste, walked back down because of course no one called, and he did not have an answer and wanted us to continue waiting!!! We said no have plans, and he said when we come back he would have something. We returned about 12:30 no rooms available yet so he would call when a room was ready. An hour went by, no call so THREE HOURS LATER we returned and stood at the counter, he saw us did not acknowledge us then disappeared and after a few minutes said he had a room. So, 3 HOURS of lost vacation finally went to the new room, after about an hour later after getting settled WE STARTED OUR VACATION! After a stressful first night and day we turned in. I was woken at THREE A.M. to a man SCREAMING BLOODY MURDER AT THE TOP OF HIS LUNGS!! "whoo-hooing" and saying "YEAH HAWAIIAN INN" Obviously doing it on purpose! For a long time, extremely loud! Next my husband, then my mom, then my daughter woke up! I was furious!! Afraid for our life - because who the hell can trust a drunk individual, let alone a bunch of them - none of us wanted to go down to the service desk for risk of getting murdered or raped or whatever and we highly doubted a phone call would resolve anything. We heard them continuously throughout the night we were "lucky" our room was right by the elevator. About an hour later, we started smelling cigarette smoke seeping in through the vent in the bathroom. We opened all the doors to circulate some air in there the whole ordeal cost us yet another sleepless night. Raoul was the best thing out the whole experience. Sad, my husband has stayed there since he was young, and we visited several years before and loved it, thus the reason we went back. NEVER AGAIN. The place is a dive, filthy, filthy, never again we'll we return and will not recommend it to anyone, and we know lots of people. So, keep catering to a bunch of degenerate, disrespectful bunch of drunk kids who are just tearing up your facility and giving you a bad reputation I hope their money is worth it. Oh, don't be surprised if the health department comes knocking, the pictures will help them out.

Reviews.Title: “Renewing a tradition”
Reviews.Author: gonplay
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hawaiin Inn which I remember so well from my childhood because of the exotic theme. A few years ago I stayed there and found it run down and shabby looking. Since then there has been a major renovation without losing it's charm. I really liked what I saw and will stay there again. It's like my old standard got a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Bike Week 2010”
Reviews.Author: bandit4994
Reviews.Content: Read the revews about the hotel and was shocked.as it was to late to change the booking we decided to go ahead and stay at the hotel,great decision we had a great 10day holiday the staff was great the hotel is undergoing a transformation at the moment but this didnt affect our holiday at all.ROHL and the staff are great and we are already making plans for our next trip to the Hawaiian inn Thanks again guys.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!!”
Reviews.Author: terbr1
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to the Hawaiian Inn mid February for my daughter's wedding. Let me tell you, they were absolutely wonderful there. We needed 5 rooms and each one was different due to various owners. The bride and groom's room was sooo wrong but they immediately fixed that giving them choices of rooms. All the rooms were clean. They really went out of their way to make our stay wonderful!! Yes there is remodeling going on but that was ok. It is going to be gorgeous when they are done. For the price and the view and the wonderful staff...I can't say enough. I would highly recommend the Hawaiian Inn and I will definitely be back in a few months. I especially would like to say Thank you to Michel and to Marissa. You are very special people. Anyone going there must see the luau show! Fantastic!!! Loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away! Worst hotel experience of my life.”
Reviews.Author: volleyflavor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly on their website after reviewing it on some travel search engines. My hubby and I had plans to go to the race in Daytona, so made our reservations well in advance, knowing the city's hotels would be full. The weather was awful (this becomes important when it comes to our room); rainy, cold (39 degrees!) and winds topping 50 mph. We were assigned to room 232. Upon traveling down the windy hallways to our room, we found moldy mattresses, trash and old curtains in the hallway. Strange and gross, but we decided to press further to our room. There, the curtains and curtain rod were lying on the bed. We had an ocean view room (which was beautiful even in horrible weather), so curtains would have been nice. The molding on the wall was pulled away to reveal substantial water damage. The sliding glass door, which appeared to be brand new, given the stickers, would not close, so the wind just howled through the room. The TV was unplugged, cable not connected, no lamps were plugged in, no lightbulbs in lamps. Not one single ice machine on 5 floors worked. Awful. We immediately called down and requested a different room. Of course, they were full, as was every other hotel, so we couldn't be moved. We were stuck like Chuck. We decided to make the best of it and went out for the night. Upon our return, around 11:00, the lights would only turn on dimly. It seemed we had minimal power. We decided to take showers when we realized there was no shower curtain. Deciding we didn't care, tried to take them anyway until the cold water tap fell off and could not be made to go back on. A quick hot shower, for sure. About an hour after we went to sleep in the brightly lit, curtainless room, the heater shut off. My hubby got up to see what was wrong with it but alas, could not turn a light on because there was NO power. None...nada. The night slowly but surely passed. We got dressed in the freezing room and got the hell out of there. We later learned that the room was "not rentable" and that we shouldn't have been given the room. We were refunded our stay, but seriously, this was the worst hotel experience of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was sufficient for our needs”
Reviews.Author: RenoComet
Reviews.Content: I discovered TripAdvisor after we had booked the room and after reading other reviews was entirely afraid of what we might find but decided to give them a try but be prepared to go someplace else. What it amounts to is what are you looking for in a hotel? If you are looking for luxury, class, modern decor and you like everything "new" this probably isnt the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for clean, simple and you are not going to spend a great deal of time in the room the Hawaiian Inn is fine. When we arrived (knowing what I read) I initially requested a room that had recently been remodeled and away from the construction. The staff was friendly and gave us the opportunity to look at the room prior to accepting it, which we did. There were a few things wrong which we discovered later but it wasnt enough to raise any red flags. The room had been remodeled with new flooring, bathroom tile, new sliding glass doors out to the balcony, new railing on the balcony and was freshly painted. We later discovered that the phone wasnt working (we had our cells phones) one table lamp wasnt working and the shade fell off. The furnishings were a little worn but not disgusting. The room did smell like bleach (bleach means clean to me) but dissipated after one night but I bought a candle anyways. The toilet ran if you didnt push the handle back up. None of these things we asked to be corrected during our stay but are certain the staff would have accomidated us. The decor was "cutsy beach"and all of the appliances were in working order and clean, including the dishes. There was construction going on which started at the other side of the hotel but moved over to our side. However, the crew did not start until after 8:00 AM and ended around 5:00 and that really didnt bother us. You can tell they are working hard to bring the hotel to better condition so you cant really expect them to close down until finished. I think it will take them about a year from now to finish what they are doing so if you don't mind the things I have talked about, arent looking for something that would be rated a 5 or even a 4, this is a good place to stay. Again, its all about what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: gofishn48
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nites in room 505 and had a great time. There was construction ongoing on the south end of the hotel, however our room was in the north tower and was not affected. Travelers must have read all the recent bad reviews because there were only a few rooms occupied in the entire hotel. Better for us, fewer people in the hot tub and pool. Our room was a recenly renovated large 1 bedroom unit, oceanfront balcony and with a really nice large window in the bedroom that gave a great northern view of the beach also. The only small issue we had was a storage room just off the living room that had a very musty odor. We just placed a towel along the bottom of the door and it didn't bother us. I can attest that nearly every room that we have stayed in, at all hotels along the atlantic including the Hilton, have had some degree of a musty odor. Well, you're on the beach, the rooms get the salt spray all the time, bring a candle, get over it... The staff was great, when we needed something, we got it within the hour, and the maid service was adequate - fresh towels each day, floor vacuumed, sheets were clean, etc... The hotel cafe was closed being it was the off-season and since there were very few guests. No problem, we cooked in and went to a couple of close restaurants. Try Aunt Catfishes, great food, atmosphere, and portions. We are are now booking our next stay for early August 2010 and we'll be staying at the Hawaiian, but in a studio this time - have to downsize because of the economic conditions like everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst experience ever!!”
Reviews.Author: catv2
Reviews.Content: My experience was exactly the same as the family in the review just before this one. We even had to change rooms because the original room was so disgusting and the door to the balcony wouldn't open. Absolutly no service what so ever. The elevators were not working except for a small service elevator. What made it worse is that no one told you they weren't working and that the only one working was tucked away in a small hallway. The room we did end up with had no air conditioning so we ended up sleeping with the sliding door open every night. When I asked about the air conditioning the front lobby said that it was turned off and they only had heat at that time. Hello...it's Florida, not Alaska update your HVAC system. The air intake for the HVAC or what ever you want to call it, was disgusting and looked like it never had been cleaned. It had mold growing all over the exterior of the vent as well. There was no ice or vending machines that you typically see in any hotel on any of the floors and the advertised heated pool had no heat. Many of the light fixtures had no light bulbs. The room I rented for my children was not any better than ours with the sliding door absent of any locking mechanism to lock the door. My kids had to have their keys replaced three times because they were having trouble with their door according to the maintance man on site. I could keep going on and on, but I won't because I just don't want to remember this experience. The only positive about this hotel are the nice folks that operate the souvenir shop. They were great. Other than that stay as far away from this hotel as you can.

Reviews.Title: “What a disaster!”
Reviews.Author: SMCKEE25
Reviews.Content: This had to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. We arrived in the evening and went to take out luggage up to our room. We located the only elevator that worked in the place and it was tiny. The other 2 elevators were out of service the entire trip. Once we arrived on our floor and started to make our way to our room the stench was over powering. We opened the door to our room to find that the lights in the hallway and in the bathroom inside the door did not work. Once inside and locating a working light we discovered that the place was dirty and disgusting. It took them until the next day to replace the light in our bathroom. When we woke up in the morning we discovered there were bugs in the kitchen that had covered our food that we had brought with us. The sliding glass door in our room was almost impossible to open and close and it was filthy. Overall the entire hotel was dirty. The best part was the view...through the filthy sliding glass door.

Reviews.Title: “What The Hell???”
Reviews.Author: Theworldsgreatest
Reviews.Content: This Hotel Is by far the worst hotel on the beach Mold was growing In the rooms, The smell ohhhh man the smell. On going Construction at the buttcrack of dawn. That was'nt even half of our problems. I was asking for maintenance to come and fix my piece of crap sliding door I was told that the maintenance supervisor would be up In just a few short minutes, Well we waited for like an hour and then went back down to remind them of our problem so they called the guy on the radio and replyed he would be right up, TIC TOC TIC TOC, waiting once again so my friends and I took off to go out and It was not touched when we got back so They sent up a cute babyfaced guy from housekeeping he was sweet and apologized for the problems and fixed the door. But I would not recommend this hetel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hogryder
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before, and its much improved. They're doing renovations to the area I stayed before (south side beachfront) and the suite I had this year was great (301). Clean, nicely furnished & equipped, great view. Staff was friendly and helpful. Tiki Bar is wonderful and Dave the Bartender is great! I've stayed there during Biketoberfests and have had NO problems! It seems to me that some of the reviews here were written by people with attitudes, and that may have gone a LONG way to make the staff "rude and unfriendly". Its not the staff's fault how far you drove that day.

Reviews.Title: “You've got to be kidding me...”
Reviews.Author: Gee_GeePa
Reviews.Content: 8AM on my vacation, all I hear is construction. Would rather hear the waves crashing on the beach than a circular saw outside my door. Almost lost an eye from the forceful water pressure in the shower, left black/blue. Couch in room smelled like wet dog, I guess it masked the mold smell tho. Good luck opening the sliding door to balcony, its so old & rotted/rusty, got stuck on balcony cause couldn't get it to move. A/C in rm leaked all over floor, that's ok, it meshed with the water that came in the door from the construction guys. Hope u don't need to turn the vent on in the bathrm cause there isn't one. I loved waiting for the elevator, they put 2 garbage cans right next to them, love that warm garbage aroma. When u leave, you'll need a breathing treatment from the mold smell & a tetnus shot from the balcony door.

Reviews.Title: “What a BEAUTIFUL place”
Reviews.Author: 08Malibu
Reviews.Content: I had an oceanfront room close to the pool. There were hammocks to lay in (very relaxing). We watched the sun rise. The Hotel is close to everything. I can't believe anyone would give it a bad review. There is some renovation going on, but, I never heard anything. I will definitely go back, actually, thinking about buying one of the units there, that's how much I liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend Unless Desprate.”
Reviews.Author: soccermom98
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went there about a week ago for one last vacation before my kids had to go back to school. I was disgusted! The staff was rude. The hotel room had not been cleaned up from the last guest even though we checked in on time. There was mildew and old food in the fridge. Door knobs and doors were broken. Paint was peeling off the wall. All the rooms smelled like cigarette smoke even though we requested non-smoking. The a/c did not work half the time and the balcony was broken and un-safe. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Aloha Spirit with Relaxation and Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Budskins
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at the Hawaiian Inn in Daytona Beach Shores last week. Being fans of Hawaii, we were hoping for Aloha spirit, flowers, beautiful decor, etc. We found just that. From the Hawaiian music rafting through the attractive sunlit lobby, to the enormous crystal clear swimming pools and flower laden hammock garden, we were so relaxed and welcomed. The luau show onsite is even better than the one we saw in Maui and the Tahitian style bountiful food is superb. We enjoyed the mini golf course, shuffleboard courts and sipping complimentary coffed in the Tiki Hut overlooking the ocean as we watched the breathtaking sunrise each morning. (We could also see it from our balcony) There are rennovations going on this year which will make this treasured hidaway even better when we come back. This hotel is full of charm and personality as each unit is individually owned and decorated with TLC. What a great discovery!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly the most unpleasant resort I had the misfortune of visiting”
Reviews.Author: glongo
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for myself and my family, upon arriving after an 18 hour drive, we were forced to wait for our rooms in the main lobby while other travelers received prefferencail treatment (I suppose because we got a deal on priceline and others were paying a higher price). That should have made us suspious, but anyway... so we finally get our rooms and holy #%^$#., what a DUMP!!! for starters my childrens room litterally wricked of smoke (did I mention that these rooms were requested to be non smoking rooms), execessive mold all over the air conditioner vents and surrounding walls, the sliding glass door to the balcony was broken and off the track so it was very difficult to open or close, which might have been a good thing because once out on the balcony we noticed the gaurdrail was broken and held together by duct tape, the paint on the walls were chipping and peeling , the outlets were hanging off the walls, the faucet in the bathroom had a constant drip and would not shut off, not to mention the sink was hanging off the wall... these were just some of the problems with this room I can go on and on.... Thats the better of the two rooms, if you have a reservation at this hotel I would urge you to reconsider and look for another hotel. After complaining to priceline we did receive a refund but I think The Hawiaainn Inn ought to be ashamed of themselves to risk people's safety over the almighty buck... Just my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Great experience -”
Reviews.Author: VCSODolly
Reviews.Content: Like a phoenix rising from the ashes, the Hawaiian Inn is well on its way to its former splendor. If you're able to look upon the on-going renovations as another step in restoring its former beauty, you will love this place. The room we stayed in was good-sized with a ful kitchen and bath, and a balcony overlooking the huge pool and ocean. Though still a bit shabby, as the rooms have not yet been renovated, my 19 year old grandson and I found them pleasant and comfortable . The hotel staff is very accommodating and eager to please, as is housekeeping. There is a nice little cafe on the premises, as well as food available poolside. Their gift shop, though small, is packed with great items and prices...no junk! There are a multitude of chairs, lounges, and tables poolside. I really can't wait till all the renovations are complete, and The Hawaiian Inn is once more a jewel on the strip. The property owners are to be commended for continuing to provide the best, possible environment under what must be very trying conditions. I'm a 22 year resident of Ormond Beach, and yet I found my stay here as pleasant as any resort I have visited.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience ever, not a 3 star not even a 1 star”
Reviews.Author: WestVirginiaMomx2
Reviews.Content: Booked with expedia and they have no idea what this dump is like . Arrived 8/1/09 and left as soon as we saw the room, to say it was bad is a understatement. The room was dirty from the last renters there was mold on everything,stain on the carpet everywhere was given another room but it was no better. Staff stated that they understood why we didn't want the room dah! Staff could not give us a refund stated we had to cancel threw expedia which was a another nightmare. Called expedia and each time we were cut off when we stated we wanted a refund after going threw the whole cancellation process with four different people we were told to expect a refund in 8 to 10 days hope this is true as it has only been 7 days. Don't stay at this resort and don't book threw expedia!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Awful”
Reviews.Author: res911girl
Reviews.Content: They doing construction whuch started at 6am, my two year old would wake up screaming when banging started. Also property very run down and staff not helpful. We went two days with out towels because they were 'WASHING" them. We had to go buy some to shower. Our toliet broke first day and they chose not to fix it. The worst was my 70 year old mother was in room next door with my 5 year old nephew when a very drunk very load cussing group started bang on her door at 1am. No one would answer desk phone, when I got outside they had locked themselves out a desk clerk told them to wait in hallway waking everyone instead of lobby where no on was at. Then night got worse when desk called her room at 3am to let the drunks come through crawl across to balcony and see if left that door open. My mother said no then he insisted and opened door for them. She was terrified, thank god we left next day. Also they overcharged credit card and refused to refund extra money so I have to go through that. Do yourself a favor stay away!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad a I thought!”
Reviews.Author: beachmom00
Reviews.Content: The secret is - Don't get the hotel room - rent a condo instead for the same price! After reading the reviews I was worried about what we would get, we had already rented a condo at the Hawiian inn and paid for it on line. We got a great deal, better than the web site said. When we got there it was better than I expected. I can not speak for the hotel rooms sold by the hotel itself but the condo we rented from Mary Motes's web page at http://www.sandcastlebeachrentals.com was wonderful. The condo was well stocked, very clean and very nicely furnished, you can tell it belongs to someone other than the hotel and the owner takes care of it. While staying there we looked at some other condo's Sand Castle Rental offered at the Hawiian Inn and they were all very nice. It was nothing like the reviews I read on the hotel rooms. This hotel is under construction (only in the side buildings)but other than the fact that you can see them working we hardly noticed it. The pool, view and beach areas are all nice. They have a nice tiki bar and plenty of deck room by the pool. Even the food was good that we ordered at the tiki bar. The hotel is older but for the price of this condo well worth it. I would not stay in one of the hotel rooms that they offer but we will be back to rent one of these condos in the future for sure. Bottom line if you are looking to be pampered by staff, have room service and be given towels by the pool...this is not the location for you. If you are looking for a getaway trip to relax, cook in and let the kids play or sit with your honey and watch the sunrise and walk the beach I would go check out the condo rentals they offer, go to her web page, look at the pics you can tell the difference.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Excuse for a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashbashMCR
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I had reservations for one week and left after the first night. The room was disgusting, I even found cigarette butts all over the "clean room". The hallway was dark and way too narrow. The employees at this hotel are terrible.....do not stay at this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “ask about renovations, mini gof and shuttle board when reserving your room”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaCarol46
Reviews.Content: We planned a stay at the hotel for my grandson to spend some time at the beach. We purposely selected this hotel because the web site advertised mini-golf and shuttle board in addition to being directly on the ocean and having a kiddie pool in addition to the regular pool. The mini golf course was down to one hole due to renovation. There were no sticks for the shuttle board because, according to the front desk, someone had broken all of them. The jack hammer didn't start till 9 on Sunday so that was a break. There was no mention of the lack of facilities or the renovation on the web site. The room was by far not the cleanest we've ever stayed in but it was manageable. As we were checking for toys under the bed before checking out my husband found a couple of snore strips - used - empty soft drink plastic bottles - and a few other pieces of garbage. Fortunately he found nothing with more DNA than the snore strips. It was cheap - $79 a night - had a mini kitchen that we didn't use except for the fridge and toaster. There were no hangers in the closet. You definitely get what you pay for. If you're adventuresome and flexible you'll be OK. Carol

Reviews.Title: “very affordable for a big family...”
Reviews.Author: gizinha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hawaiian in, in july of 2008. I was looking for a reasonable affordable vacation on the beach, for a family of 6. ( two teens and two smaller kids). not many hotels in the area would had accomodation for us all, and belive me I called. The hawaiian inn had 2 double beds in the bedroom, and not one but 2 full futon in the living room, which was great for me. The hallways was a little creepy, and my husband said that he was a little gross ed out by the smell of the carpets, but i like the balconie with the view of the ocean, and I liked the pools. (except the kiddie pool, that somekid pooped in there and they blocked, it took forever for them to reopen. The staff was ok, they mixed up my reservatiion dates, but they fixed with no complains... Housekeeping was pretty busy, and we had to call a few times for them to vaccum the room, and there was a small kitchen where you could prepare meals, but there was no dishwasher. So if you can picture yourself washing dishes while on vacation, this is a place for you. I guess if you are short on cash, have a big family and want a vacation right on the ocean , it will be able to put up with those little flaws. I don't know if I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “nasty, moldy and ran down”
Reviews.Author: nibbles123
Reviews.Content: Went to the Hawaiian in and paid 190.00 for a 2 bed room suite oceanfront. The first room that we was showed they called oceanfront looking straignt into a building roof. Then we was taken to the another room that was on the fifth floor. Going down the hall ways was like walking through a prison. The hallways had no carpet where it was ripped up, water coming in from the ceilings and water around electrical supply. Got in the second room it was moldy, nasty and smelled like a wet basment. The furniture in the room was nasty and dirty and then the balcony had pigeon crap all over it. It was so nasty. Went to the manager and got our money back and went to another hotel. What ever you do, don't stay there. It does not look like the pictures on the internet. Very nasty and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “spring break madness”
Reviews.Author: ednalmj
Reviews.Content: We had booked Hawaiian hotel from Canada. We had 2 moms and two young teenagers.There was no inclination that the Inn would be taken over by 20somethings. Our room was a nice size, but we didnt have enough towels - we needed to call twice to get more towels. We never got any towels for the pool. The room was tidy but not clean. We did look at other rooms the next day but there was no difference. The hotel security was lax - there was stripping in the indoor pool and balcony hopping. This room is our personal space - and it was definitely invaded. We had to leave on the third day as the beer bottles covered the pool deck and the stripping got out of hand.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy, Wet, Creepy, Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: imagoddess
Reviews.Content: Booked online, arrived. Shown at least 5 rooms. None satisfactory. Moldy, wet floors and walls. Dark, gloomy submarine feeling in hallways. Don't stay here unless you really need a room. Cheap mattress's. Musty. Un-recovered from hurricanes. Needs painting, carpet & health inspector! LEFT WENT TO TROPICAL MANOR NEXT DOOR! Best kept secret on the strip! Amazingly clean, excellent staff. Quaint. Great view in back with quiet pool area. Perfect for relaxation STAY AWAY FROM THE HAWAIIN INN!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Been there done that going back!!”
Reviews.Author: summerluv52
Reviews.Content: me and a bunch of my friends drove down from new york for our spring break, we arrived there a couple hours early and they let us check in early, it didnt bother us that we each had to do the security deposit because we were getting it back before we left anyway. the room was awesome, the view was stunning and it was amazing to wake up every morning to a ocean view and we could see the dolphins in the ocean, everything was perfect. It did suck that since the balcony was open there would be occasional bugs in the room but thats nature i guess. Staying there was awesome i wish i could of stayed later the pool was beautiful along with the hammocks and the workers were nice too. this hotel was awesome for the price that we paid, it was a cheap place to stay with good servie and a awesome view!! I want to go back so bad. and the location is great. right on the road with many attractions to go to.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: maryjay07
Reviews.Content: stayed there 4 my 40th b day!!!!!!! with husband and 6 year old daughter and 15 year old son. roaches were crawling up the walls as i laid in bed . the balconey was taped together with duct tape (they even knew it was my birthday) gross is all i can say!!! maybe if they were nice, but ok at best!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Deposit was crazy but overall it was okay.”
Reviews.Author: Brittany18
Reviews.Content: First thing we drove 15 hours to get there. our check in time was 4pm and we got there around 3 and our room wasnt ready. there was eight people in the room all 18 years and younger and each of us had to pay a 75 dollar deposit which was rediculous. there was alot of things wrong with our room when er got there but the maintanence quickly came to fix our problems. Everyone in the hotel was very nice and we met a lot of new people. The Hotel was good enough to stay in the whole week and i would go back but just not with some of the same people. The pools were really nice and we had the ocean right there next to the pool. it was a pretty cool experience being that ive never been to florida.

Reviews.Title: “No Hangers, No Ironing Board, No Iron”
Reviews.Author: auntsheel
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 2 hours before check-in, and we were told that our room was ready, and were allowed to check in early. But, shortly after check in, I noticed that there were no hangers in the closet, and no iron or ironing board anywhere in the room. I called down to the front desk, and was told that there are not supposed to be irons or ironing boards in each room. I told the woman that it is clearly listed in the amenities on their website, and she said they are "available," but not in each room. I asked about hangers, and she said they didn't have any left. Huh?? She told me she'd get me an iron and ironing board. 24 hours later, had to call down again about the iron and ironing board (gave up on hangers at this point). When I told he woman that I called 24 hours ago, she said they must not have any irons or ironing boards left, she'd have to check. About an hour later, I finally got the iron and ironing board. I had to iron clothes and hang them on furniture since we had no hangers. We stayed in an oceanfront studio (room 323) and it did have a great view. The room itself needed work -, although the ceramic tile on the floor appeared new. The "kitchenette" was bare bones minimum. Good thing we don't eat cereal for breakfast, as there were no bowls. The room had a small, 19-inch TV. The luau was expensive and not worth the price. The hula girls were entertaining, but the band was so so. The food was okay...but not worth the price. The pool atmosphere was nice - a very large pool with a large area for chairs. There is also a DJ who plays loud music by the pool, and has games and prizes (hula hoop contest, belly flop contest, etc.) The poolside bar has reasonable prices, and pretty good food. There is a small gift/t-shirt shop in the hotel, which is somewhat overpriced. I was impressed that there was "security" personnel walking around, making themselves visible to the "spring breakers," which I think is necessary. Wireless internet is available at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Ocean view, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: kkfromNiagara
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to Daytona Beach, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hawaiian Inn. We got our room for a great price, and the view from our balcony was fabulous. The outdoor pool and poolside bar were our favourite part of our stay there. The hotel is right across and down the street from WinDixie, which was so convenient for liquor, supplies and snacks for the kitchenette in our room. The staff was friendly and helpful, and yes there was some renovations taking place at the far end of the resort, but nothing that hampered our stay there. I would go back to this hotel in a minute. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Renters Beware!! Jackhammers, dust, closed floors, yuck”
Reviews.Author: bconstance
Reviews.Content: Arrived Jan. 1 to find the Inn in a terrible state. Owners at the Inn said construction started mid-December and would continue to December 2009. No mention of this construction on the Hawaiian Inn web site or from any of the condo owners who are renting their rooms on their own. If you have booked a room for January or February I suggest you phone and check on the construction. You may be in for a shock. Daily jackhammers, dust, noise, and closed floors are to be expected on a daily basis. Water shut-offs are common. I left and found much nicer accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: uary
Reviews.Content: january 2009 we booked a vacation thru a private agent and from the day we arrived we had nothing but problems with her....we almost cut our stay short after 3 nights we were so upset....but the hotel staff at the hawaiian inn were so nice they were the reason we didnt come home early ..from the front desk to the maintence men..david and john and mike i believe his name was..they changed out the ac in our condo then again in another room.. (louis alumbuth)GM took care of use like we mattered..we will stay at the hawaiian inn again it is a great place right on the ocean ..but will never book from this agent again!!!we will go thru the hotel..abbie schafle sebring,fl

Reviews.Title: “should have been closed for construction”
Reviews.Author: sdougreid
Reviews.Content: When we booked our rooms we didn't know that the Hawaiian Inn was renting out private condos and not hotel rooms. We had maintenance problems with both rooms. They were using jackhammers and loud compressors right outside our door. They should have closed the wing instead we ended up in a construction zone.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hawaiian”
Reviews.Author: Iizzie
Reviews.Content: Although construction is underway while upgrading we found the Hawaiian Inn to be a great location. It is an equal drive to St. Augustine north, the NASA launch site south or, going west, to visit Orlando. The hotel is in a quiet area, so no street noise! Location on the beach is perfect with great views of the ocean. The pool area is fantastic for sunning and kids love the additional covered heated pool. There is a mini golf range on site and shuffle board to get you moving. Our room had a mini kitchen and on site there is a dinner theater and lunch grill we visited too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: KennethTennessee
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my Ocean Front room. The decor was very bright and the Ocean was so very peaceful. The Frotn desk staff was very very nice. I loved my stay and will stay again. The hotel is so very comfortable, but by the looks of the "old" sign out front and the old paint on the buildings, you would not know it. I was very pleasantly surprised. I hope the hotel will get a new sign and paint the building though. Like I said, the room could not have been more pleasant, you would not know it though by the outside. I think they could get a lot more business if they would remodel because you cannot beat the ocean view room and the friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Best Room ever”
Reviews.Author: MaconGirl
Reviews.Content: We are a returning renter for unit 305. We have been staying at the Hawaiian Inn for over 20 years, same week of the year. It is like a big family reunion when we go. There are as many as 20 to 30 families that we have met up with over the years and we all go the same time every year and some have been going for as long as 40 years. This last year we rented unit 305 and was really impressed with the upkeep of this unit and how it was so well maintained. We usually eat several evening meals in the room over our 8 to 10 day stay and at times we have up to 12 people to eating. It has a great view of the ocean and is very spacious and roomy. My husband and I will continue to rent this unit for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: brassyKansas
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hawaiian Inn. We stayed from Aug. 3 through the 6th. We had an oceanview room that overlooked the pool. It was so beautiful. The staff was so nice and friendly. We ate breakfast in the cafe. Very good food and very reasonably priced. We are planning on another trip next year and we will stay at the Hawaiian Inn again. Our room was a little dated, but the view was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luau”
Reviews.Author: ShadowCinnamon
Reviews.Content: This review is mostly for the luau. The hotel has had a luau in one form or another for some years. This summer a new group took over the luau with great results. The show is very engaging and family friendly with lots of audience participation. The food was good - although the initial portions were small. Fortunately, you can ask for refills of just about everything. The smoked pork and chicken were especially good but there are no vegetable sides - just rice. Having done the big luau at Disney World just a few weeks before we can honestly say that the dancers here at Daytona were just as good if fewer in number. In fact, we liked the band here at the Hawaiian Inn better than the one at Disney. Also, we laughed a lot more during this show due to the engaging host and band leader. The whole luau room and bar is decorated in vintage tiki style - it's like a throwback to a tiki lounge from the 50's or 60's complete with fake volcano in the far corner and black lighting. If you go with this theme and the kitschiness you'll have a great time - don't forget to wear your hawaiian shirt, mumu or other hawaiian-themed clothing. Our children had a fantastic time at the luau,too, and got to go up on stage twice for audience participation segments. If you don't have a hawaiian shirt the hotel has a gift shop that supplies them. If they don't have your size you can talk to the owners - they have 3 different gift shops in 3 different hotels and will be happy to run an item over from one of the other shops for you. In conclusion, we were very pleased with the luau and felt it compared very favorably with bigger productions we've been too. If you enjoy the whole tiki experience then this hotel and luau are meant for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: sduncan18
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time staying at the hawaiian inn daytona. The room (107) was a great updated poolside oceanview room. Entertainment was good on Saturday (DJ/Poolside Movie). The pool and tiki bar area is GREAT! This is a great place to stay for a family vacation. Did not go to the dinner show, but it seemed packed every night. The only drawback to our stay was that is seems they need more help at the front desk. There always seemed to be a wait there. Overall, we are very glad to have stayed at the hawaiian inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: lustforfun
Reviews.Content: My family and I had a great time here at the Hawiian inn. The dinner show was excellent and the food was just as good. The sfaff was friendly and attended to all of our needs without any problems. The guest was friendly too. We had a oceanfront studio with queen size beds with a roll away bed, the room was clean when we arrived. Next time we are planning to book a private owned rental here.

Reviews.Title: “PARTY CENTRAL”
Reviews.Author: beachbabewannabe
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (one being a 9month old and I am nearly 6 mo pregnant) booked a room through a private individual back in January. We stayed in room 208. The hotel is nice looking for the most part, the pool area is very nice. Beach access is a little scary and the condo is mostly nice, very clean but not what we would consider staying in again. The condo is very small and was overfull of decorations and junk (magazines, ashtrays, plastic packaging, cleaning products, ect) stuffed behind furniture and in closets, ect, just not a place for a baby to be. I also didnt feel safe in the condo becouse the door lock was duck taped back to the door ( the lock that originally would take a card key) and the sliding glass doors didnt lock so there was a long wooded stick you were to use to jam the door shut) The problem I had with the place was the music from the pool area blaring all night long untill midnight all weekend. The condo was NOT sound proof so we could hear everything all night. Even after the weekend (which was the fourth of july ) people set off fireworks right on the pool deck up untill midnight, kids were screaming and laughing and were extremely loud. My finance went to the front desk about the issues several times and there was nothing they could do since the pool closed at midnight. My family also recieved 2 phone calls from the owner during our stay stating that the neighbors of the condo were complaining about the noise coming from our room, the tons of people in and out of the condo, the towels and bathing suits that we hung on the deck, stating that our clothes were falling onto the pool deck. The owner asked us to take down our things and put them inside since it is against the rules to have towels and bathing suits hanging from the balcony.....WHAT??? never heard of that before and all most all other condo balconies were covered in towels! DUH how else are these things going to dry out?? Anyway, this made me a nervous wreck and stressed me out since I couldnt figure out what the owner was talking about since we were gone most of the days so we were NOT noisy, we all went to bed (or at least tried to at around 9-10 every night) so we were not partying all night long, we took out towels down after the owner asked us to and there were still more complaints about it, and my family that lives in FL came to visit a couple of times but so what? We cant have visitors??? I just felt like I was being watched and being told what to do and how to do it even though I paid good money to stay there. We couldnt take it any longer so we went some where else to finish up the remainder of the vacation since we were getting married on Thursday. ( IF anyone wants to get married on the beach email me I know the perfect person to contact!). We stayed 2 nights at the AKU TIKI INN and it was FABULOUS!! Quiet, Free happy hour, a nice quiet pool, CLEAN!!! NO CRAP EVERYWHERE! NO ONE CALLING TO COMPLAIN about stuff that was not even happening. I also didnt have to take out my own trash and wash and dry the towels that the place provided like the we had to do in the condo so we could have fresh DRY towels for the week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Missed going this year!”
Reviews.Author: minadolphin
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been going to the Hawaiin inn for 4 years.Previously before that we stayed at Tresure Island.We did not go there this year, Instead we went to Myrtle Beach. What a mistake! We are already counting the days until we go back to the Hawaiin. The rooms we have had in the past have always been clean. Dave the bartender at the tiki bar was great. He always let us know where to go and what to see around town. The kids enjoyed the DJ by the pool ,wish he was there other than just weekends. Anytime we had an issue we were always compensated. I am looking forward to going back next year with my family and friends. Tina Mina Indianapolis, Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Could've been better”
Reviews.Author: Kennybme
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in 2007 and 2008 and had quite different experiences. For the most part, the 2007 stay went OK, with the exception of the palmetto bug by the elevator doors. But it was an outside corridor, so I could live with that in Florida. I did not find any bugs in the room, but didn't look that closely. When we went back this year, we rented two rooms on the same credit card, and were put on different sides of the hotel. There was no mention made that the rooms would not be together and it was unfortunate as we have a rather large family and had to split everyone up more than we would have liked. One of the rooms was terribly small and not a lot of fun. The other room had no view of the ocean, which was also not what we wanted. Back in the 1980s, it used to be a great place to stay. Now, it's in need of a good refurbishment and much better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: ksblanken
Reviews.Content: Checked in 6/6/08 around 10:00 pm, stayed in room 521. When we opened the sofa bed to get ready for bed there were crumbs in the bed and a blood stained sheet. Called mgmt, sent a person up to change sheets. No pillows for bed..called for pillows. Odd odor in room. During the night noticed there was no hot water to wash hands. Morning came still no hot water. Went to pool, which was the only thing that was nice about this hotel. No cooler at pool rule, I am not used to this. We checked out and found out approx. 4 hours later that my husband had left my Brookstone "NAP" pillow behind at the hotel. I went back to get it and waited..and waited...and waited while housekeeper in charge went to check for the pillow. She finally came back and said that yes, the housekeeper had found the pillow and turned it in, however it had disappeared from the housekeeper quarters and couldn't be found. So dirty, nasty sheets, no pillows left for sofa bed, no hot water, odd smell and someone who works for hotel steels guests items that were only left behind for approx. 4 hours. No I will not stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to anyone. If you can't trust your employees, you have a real problem.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: karoleigh
Reviews.Content: We were on our way home from Universal Studios in Orlando when we decided to stay at the Hawaiian Inn. It is a large hotel with five floors that is located directly on the ocean. What we liked about it: the pools (one indoor and one outdoor), the yard in general (attractive and pleasant), proximity and ease for getting to the beach. What we didn't like: When we checked in, the desk clerk offered us a room that was located right in the lobby area (Room 114). This room is also next to the elevator shaft. I refused to take that room. The front desk clerk protested only a little, but in the end he offered us a room on the fifth floor overlooking the ocean. It also had a balcony. The room was very attractive, with apparently new carpeting, an overhead TV, a thick mattress, a bar table and high bar-style seats. We had one problem with the room, and that was the air-conditioner. It was very noisy. We actually turned it off so that we could go to sleep at night, but we ended up turning it back on later on because it became too hot. When we checked out, I commented on the noisy air-conditioner to the desk clerk. She more or less nonchalantly said, "It's an old hotel" as if that were the answer to the problem. I am not sure if I will return to this hotel if I can't get a quieter room. Everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Think about who you book with”
Reviews.Author: mimi16731
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given was nice except the doors did not work. We could not open them. My son almost got locked out. We were moved to her unit. Her unit was nice. We then had to deal with hotel maintaince coming in and out on our last day because of a leak below us. We then had no hot water to take showers or wash dishes with. When we got home I found that we were charged a $50 charge to our credit card. I contacted the booker and was told it was for excessive laundry and furniture that was out of place. IF STRIPPING THE BED LINENS is called excessive then she does not understand sanitary practices. It is very disturbing to me that her cleaner does not normally wash all of the bed linens. We also left the futon down, for the life of me I could not get it to go back up. I though instead of breaking the futon we would leave it down for the cleaner to put up. She told me it was too heavy for her cleaner to put up. That probably explains the dirt/food behind the futon that we found. What killed me was that she said she should have charged me a cleaning fee for relocating to a new room. I could not believe that comment. Just be careful of who you book with!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the others i have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Spoiledmama
Reviews.Content: I really had a nice room I was on the 5th floor. We had a oceanview room. The only thing that I would change would be the second bedroom. It had a divider instead of a door but was not hanging off or any thing just did not have a door. But the room was nice. The beds were comfortable felt like a foam material on them had no springs in your back. Which made it nice. My two children really enjoyed the stay with the large hot pool as they call it. Golf they did not get a chance to play that is why we are going back in July.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: jonchicago
