Reviews.Content: i stayed at the hawaiian inn for ten days, and at first i was a little nervous after reading some of these other reviews. but i already booked before i read reviews. decided to check this out first hand and if i was'nt happy i would simply check out and find a different hotel for my wife and i. i don't know where all this negetive feedback came from, but my wife and i loved this place! great ocean front room on the second floor. we did the hawaiian show and it was also a great show, they had a movie on the pool deck on saturday nite, this was unexpected but it was on a huge screen and everyone could sit on their belconys and enjoy the show. there was a tike bar poolside which made any type drink you could imagine. the indoor pool was very nice, we spent alot of evenings enjoying this pool not to mention the large outdoor pool that was huge and very well maintained. we also did the mini golf at the hawaiian on a daily bases at no extra charge. my wife and i loved the property so much, we booked for ten more days next year. jon, chicago

Reviews.Title: “What a Wreck beware”
Reviews.Author: mikito30
Reviews.Content: This was the worst place i have been in a long time. The ceiling in the lobby was half off. The musty moldy spell in the rooms was horrible. The carpets turned our feet black. The staff must be used to the complaints, nothing fazed them in the least. I will tell everyone not to go to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Definately room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: ukjackie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn for Speedweeks and it was our 1st time staying in Daytona Beach. We booked our condo (room number 238) direct through its owner. The condo had recently undergone a renovation so was clean, tidy and everything in working order. (Our friends stayed at the same time as us in a different condo and its was the exact opposite of ours!!!) The Hawaiian Inn itself was something of a disappointment, the restuarant, poolside bar, lula show were all closed for the entire duration of our stay (10 nights) the shop i saw open once!!, The indoor pool is tiny but very warm and can only have a maximum of 9 people in it at once, the outdoor pool looked dirty!!! Towards the end of our stay they began having free coffee in the lobby and the mini golf opened up. During our stay workmen had began to paint all exterior doors and walkways and looked to be renovating the lobby so i can see that once all these have been done it will be a much nicer place to stay. (also heard that a new management team had taken over) Location was brilliant near to a 7eleven, Winn Dixie and Publix both just up the road as is 2 new crazy golf places. Golf Buggies and Quad bikes for rent on the beach right in front of hotel steps. But as with anything you get what you pay for, we paid (compared to most hotels in Speedweeks) a bargain price, next year we will definately pay a bit moreand stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “hit and miss”
Reviews.Author: saleen281
Reviews.Content: I stayed in unit 203 and the view was very nice. I had friends that stayed in another room that you wouldn't have known they were in the same hotel. 203 was brand new, looked to be completely remodeled, and didn't overlook the pool, just a great view of the ocean and beach. For the rate, I thought it could not be beat, the overall condition of the hotel leaves something to be desired but check your room before you pay because I saw a few really nice rooms. It is my understanding that all rooms are individually owned so some owners have renovated. I would recommend anyone to stay in this room. I also just booked for bike week, apparently, a new hotel management group has taken over and getting everything back in order!

Reviews.Title: “If You Have A Reservation Be Sure To Read This”
Reviews.Author: madazhell
Reviews.Content: IF YOU HAD A RESERVATION IN THE NEAR FUTURE YOU DO NOT NOW we made a reservation for this hotel for bikeweek on the 1st of november for the week of bikeweek. I called to confirm my reservation because there website is no longer up and i was suspicious. After 4 calls i find out that the hotel has been sold and they are going to put us in another hotel when we arrive. The last time i stayed there igot the run around with the front desk reservations, imagine when they move you to another more expensive hotel which you pay for. Nothing but trouble for anyone who has reserved this hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniferF1975
Reviews.Content: We started the week out at a different hotel (the Castaway)....gross hotel so we called the Hawaiian Inn and they booked us a great room (426) for the rest of the week, we loved it from the time we walked into the lobby. I really love palm trees and there was one rite off our balcony. The outside is a little dated however the hotel overall is great. We loved the pools and pool side bar as well as the beach access. We are planning a trip back this April. I think anyone who needs to relaxe and let go should stay at the Hawaiian INN.

Reviews.Title: “An Hotel well past its prime”
Reviews.Author: Gutzey
Reviews.Content: We checked in @ 9:30 pm. There was one girl at the desk and a maintenance man at the entrance. The Lobby was outdated and worn. We checked into our room a one bedroom suite and the room was not that bad. Not as old and worn as many of these comments reflect. We opened the kitchen drawer where the silverware was housed and guess what? Dying waterbugs in the drawers. I went down to the front desk and was offered an alternate room. The alternate was a standard room with no view which I declined. I requested that the drawers get cleaned out and treated. Front Desk said she would have someone take care of it. Came back to the room 2 hours later, nothing was done. I noticed that many of the guest room front doors were old and warped lending access for insects to enter from the outside. Needless to say we used nothing in the kitchenette during our stay, not even the coffee pot. The following day I again complained to the front desk, magain noting was done. Went to the breakfast buffet the following morning. Absolutely horrible. Food was disgusting. Go to a local restaurant .The pool area was nice with plenty of chairs throughout. In addition, the hotel is right on the beach which was good. The entrance into the main restaurant really tells a story about the hotel. Ceiling tiles were broken, missing and stained. It's hard to believe that the manager would let this public area remain in such disrepair. I remeber this hotel from 30 years ago when it was one of the top hotels in Daytona. The hotel has since been left to deteriorate. I can't complain that much because I did pay a very low rate. Would not recommend and would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “A DUMP HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: aajsy
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money on this dump! It was filthy inside and out. I would never recommend it to anyone period.

Reviews.Title: “The worst. Ewwww”
Reviews.Author: JAXtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible! We did not even make it through the night; I had to pack my bags and leave. I arrived with a friend around six in the afternoon and was immediately turned off at the chipped paint, falling ceiling tiles, rust, and tacky decor. The staff was extremely rude and unhelpful when I was told my room was not yet ready - it still needed to be cleaned. So I waited, and after an hour I was allowed in the room only to find it STILL had not been cleaned!! Another hour later the room was "cleaned" - except for the things that could not be picked up like the mold in the bathroom, rust, stained sheets, and very dirty ugly carpet. I tried to get some rest but the entire hotel must have turned into a country concert at happy hour and I could not even hear myself think. I checked out. PLEASE - book this hotel at your own risk, you have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Inn...Filthy place”
Reviews.Author: DeeinPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: ERAU PARENTS: This hotel will give you a ERAU discount if you stay there but trust me; you don't want to stay there. This place is absolutely terrible. It was filthy dirty, the A/C didn't work, the couch was dirty and torn, and there was mold around the A/C vents and in the bathroom. I couldn't even stay there even one night so I called friends also visiting the area and we went looking for a place for me to stay. We found a place later that evening (a beautiful condo) and went to the Hawaiian Inn at 8AM the next morning and told them once again about the air and the filth. Tried to work it out where I iwouldn't have to pay for the first night since I couldn't even sleep there but the manager wasn't hearing it. When I told him I was disputing it; he didn't even care. He felt that the "owners" of each unit just can't keep updating the units and I told him that they should not rent them out in this condition. I also filed a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and do you believe that the Hawaiin Inn had the nerve to NOT EVEN RESPOND to the BBB!!!! This tells you how unprofessional they are. All I can say is that I hope that no other parents taking their children to college at ERAU stay here and have to go through what we went through. This should have been a once in a lifetime experience with first year at college and a nice vacation at Daytona Beach. Instead, I felt like I needed disinfected just from walking into the room. I'll never stay there again and will do all I can to discourage others from staying there. Dee in Pittsburgh PA

Reviews.Title: “Horrific Experience/ s_x toys found in the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: tjcdjc
Reviews.Content: First, I'd like to say that the desk staff at the Hawaiian Inn were all very nice and personable. Although, full of excuses, the manager's were pretty nice as well. Perhaps, the main problem here is housekeeping and a non-enforced no smoking policy. The first room they put us in was smokey, the door to the balcony was broken, there were dead or dying roaches in the room and a possibly used giant dildo (no, this is not a joke) under the bathroom sink. Instead of calling, I went to the front desk. Again, the ladies there were very nice, called a couple of managers and moved us to a different room. They upgraded us to a two bedroom suite. Although the room itself was nicely decorated it was also quite dirty. The floors turned your feet black if you walked on them without shoes. The master bedroom was so smelly (cigarette smoke) that we couldn't even use it. Our entire family slept in the extra bedroom. Fortunately, we had our own pillows. The hotel's pillow cases had makeup on them, the sheets were covered in hair (that wasn't ours). Upon checkout the next day, I asked to see a manager. I had to wait about 10-15 minutes, when he appeared (from behind the front desk!!! I had to wait and he was there the entire time!) I showed him the yucky pillow cases, a washcloth turned black from a swipe on the dirty floor and some of the hair off the sheets. He just shrugged and said he'd let housekeeping know about it. He claimed there was nothing to do about the smoking in a non-smoking facility. I can say that I would NEVER recommend the Hawaiian Inn to anyone. We used to stay there as kids every year 25+ years ago. It was a great place back then. I hope someone can come in and clean the place up...I imagine it could be really nice if they just tried.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: whit1305
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay for our anniversary. I have read some of the other reviews and I'm am not sure what they are looking for. We did not stay at a condo but just booked online and everything was great. Clean, staff was friendly. Nice spot on the beach and a great view. Have stayed at the Hilton and it's nice but for the money the Hawaiian Inn was great in our book. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “A Total Rip Off!! Gross And Disgusting ”
Reviews.Author: Amytony
Reviews.Content: I could have purchased a better bed & pillows at the Good Will or Dollar Store! The a/c hardly got cold at all !!!!the doors were all rotted and falling apart, the party down at the pool ended at about 4 am I could literrally hear it all nite long, DO NOT TAKE CHILDREN!!! I wouldve slept better at the dog pound. The place was disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not bring kids”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBob
Reviews.Content: If you are in a Fraternity and you plan to spend your spring break here, I think you might like this place. If you have kids, please, please, please do not stay here. First: the railings are not up to code and your toddler can fall through the railings. Second: the stairwells are not up to code and your little one can fall straight through to the first floor (from the fourth floor). Third: the keys were de-magnetized at every use. The problem is so bad that most of the people at the front desk were complaining about their keys. I asked to have my keys reset at least five times, yet the management never asked to see my ID once! I could have been a mass murderer. Finally, due to fear of theft, the chairs and table on the balcony were locked with a cable. Thus, you could not move them, and my kids tripped on the cable three times. This is a hotel that is designed for drunks and spring breakers. This is not a family hotel, and I feel so strongly that this place is dangerous for kids that this is the first time that I ever filled out a review on travel advisor. I am doing this for the benefit of your children.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: loonfifth
Reviews.Content: The room we had was dirty, had bugs, and the elevators didn't look like they were going to get us to our room. We were on the 4th floor and had to walk quite a distance from the ghetto-like elevators to our "suite". However, we were in for a surprise. Definitely wasn't worth the money that we paid to S. Jones who was no help and very curt with us when we complained!

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect”
Reviews.Author: mb982304
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hawaiian Inn Jun 10-16 2007. When we first arrived they were having trouble with their computer system and told us we would have to wait to check in however they told us we could go sit around the pool deck or go out to thier bar on the pool deck. Within 15 minutes the computer problem was fixed and they got us checked in within no time. Our room in general was very clean and well kept. The bathroom and kitchenette were also in very good shape. The only problem we had on our first night was there were small bugs on the ceiling by the balcony door, we went to the front desk and asked if there was anyhing they could do and they told us that these bugs were called love bugs and they get in through the vents and cracks and there isn't really anything to do about them and they die off within 24 hours. The next day when we woke up majority of the bugs had died off, we don't know where they went but they weren't in there and that was all that mattered. After that, we had no more problems with bugs. The staff was very friendly and the pool was always clean as was the pool deck. I will definetely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for what it was”
Reviews.Author: Booklady
Reviews.Content: We recently (June 29-July 2/07) stayed here (unit 511) booked through Stephanie Jones. No problem with Stephanie or the booking - everything was just as promised and WONDERFULLY clean. Never saw a bug, the unit was nicely equipped with mostly new equipment. Beds were very comfortable and there was lots of room to move around in. GREAT view from the balcony overlooking the pool to the beach. We didn't use the onsite restaurant but the pool bar was fine - fellow was very friendly and informative. We knew nothing about NASCAR but enjoyed our tour there and had a great meal one night at Lighthouse Landing Restaurant at Ponce Inlet (we also had an ok meal at Crabby Joe's on the pier - but not as good as the Lighthouse Landing) We rented one of the beach equipped golf carts and had a great tour up and down the beach. We were only there for a laid back long weekend but wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Hawaiian Inn (at least the unit we were in).

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: goldpress
Reviews.Content: During our stay we stayed for four nights in two separate rooms. We were walk in reservations originally for two days, and needed to change rooms to extend our stay. You can read into this that we were happy enough with our first two nights that we continued our time with this hotel. I will say first that there were some definite pros and cons for this Inn to consider for the future. I will say that overall my family will probably consider this hotel again in the future, but other hotels in the nearby area might be a little more to our liking. Pros: * Two Pools (also a Kiddie Pool) - all very well maintained during our four night stay. I did like that the indoor pool had a row of bubble jet seats built in that allowed the warm water to blow out and massage those sitting in the area. I'm also a big fan of having steps leading into pools such as these pools have. * Moderately Clean Rooms. * Comfortable beds. * Simple 9 hole putt-putt course - clean * Large lounge / front desk area - apparently with accessible WiFi (I spotted a wireless N router and noticed many on their laptops in this area, but did not have mine to personally confirm). I liked that this area was spacious and provided a couple of tables to sit at and plenty of chairs/couches in a well air conditioned area. * Staff friendly and courteous. * Relatively quiet rooms - this is a major bonus after being at another Daytona hotel in a previous year that placed my family directly above a Karaoke bar. The design of this hotel made it so that even though we were near a heavily trafficked area, noise from outside wasn't that bad. * I'll include the pool deck restaurant / tiki bar and the indoor Wiki Wiki Cafe as Pros, even though I have no experience with any of this. They also offer Luau shows on Wednesday and Thursday to really add to the theme of the hotel. Cons: * A Bug - I'll start out with this since I noticed another guest posting about a bug problem. On the last day I saw a single bug in our room. It didn't appear to be a roach, but a single bug of any sort I don't see as a problem. What the guest described would be a very bad thing to discover, but it was not at all like either of our rooms. * Potential Severe Health Risks (Towel Racks in bathrooms of our rooms were in a position and level to leave you with a bad hit to the head. Even though normally I have no trouble with hotel bathrooms, I managed to almost get knocked out in the first room. In the second room I still managed to almost take a bump to the back of the head. These racks are around 5' high mounts and I am 6' tall. In the relatively cramped bathrooms of the one room 2 double bed suites, this is dangerous. The mounts make sense when you consider the massive mirrors in the bathrooms, but I'd prefer a smaller mirror and slightly less in the line of a health risk). * Pools close at sunset (outdoor) and 9 PM (indoor/heated) - I will say that the hotel basically closing off all activities at 9PM made for a quieter hotel, it also made me feel like I was living in a retirement community. Most of Daytona Beach doesn't really shut down during the Summer months until 11PM. I would really like to see the indoor pool stay open until midnight or 1AM since with doors closed it is not really a noise issue and this will still allow guests to wind down before going to bed. * Indoor heated pool was not very warm - I found the indoor pool room to have moderately warm air, but the pool itself was not very warm. Coming into the pool from the open air (it wasn't really hot during our stay) didn't leave me feeling like I was walking into warm waters. On a cooler day I went from the indoor pool to the outdoor (unheated) and back to the indoor pool. During this move I could tell a moderate difference. On a warmer day I actually heard a lot of people say the outside pool was warmer! * Potential problems with pools - I noticed that the pools seemed to not be measured right for the markings given on the outside. I particularly noticed that the indoor pool seemed about 3-6" above the measurements. Also, 4' is the shortest marking either of the main pools gives. With the problem of pools being overfilled, this really narrows the amount of room younger children (or those unable to swim) to the steps leading into the 4' zones. * Gift shop on the moderate to expensive side - Prices in many of the shops we tried in Daytona were expensive. If you are in need of sunblock and don't want to go to a major store; sure, this is a good asset. Otherwise, I just avoided this store. I found most of the gifts I brought home at a store called the Big Shark.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely atrocious!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lionlover0869
Reviews.Content: The morning after we checked into our condo we contacted our reservation agent, Stephanie Jones, to tell her about all the bugs (including in our bed and on MY PILLOW!), the broken doors so we couldn't enjoy the balcony, the rotting walls in the bathroom, and the rotting walls in the bedroom. She told me I was crazy. However, I couldn't stay in a unit where I I got bugs in my hair. So, we checked out early. Stephanie called me a "bipolar b*!$% looking for a free vacation" (among other things)! Please email me if you would like to see the emails from this woman as I am saving them for my attorney. You truly wouldn't believe all the "nice things" she said to me. Please....if you have to stay at the Hawaiian Inn (the lobby was very nice as well as the patio area with pool) DO NOT BOOK THROUGH STEPHANIE JONES!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place to stay in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: Sugden
Reviews.Content: We have just had a super 2 night stay at this hotel. They found us an excellent room in 15 mins as our other hotel we could not stay another minute. It was perfect, clean,tidy,lots to do, huge rooms. Pools excellent, entertainment good. Very happy indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: beth4337
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect place for our family for spring break. Reasonably priced, great location and we will be back next year without the kids!

Reviews.Title: “White Trash Vacation”
Reviews.Author: avacc679
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the hawaiian Inn. Well all I can say is white trash. All the rooms are owned by different people kind of a condo with staff and management. We were is a room on the 2nd floor and it was OK not great not terrible just OK. The Bar was cool and the food was great. But the rooms are a crap shoot. We had 5 rooms and 2 were awesome #203 and #224. But to be honest I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort”
Reviews.Author: kaye59
Reviews.Content: We spent our spring break at the Hawiian Inn. We had a wonderful vacation. A great place to take the children, right on the beach, pool, everyting you could ask for. The room was great, very clean, everything we needed, the cleaning service was outstanding. \Mary Motes was great to work with. She contacted us whenever a message was left for her within a day or two. We went with several different families who used Mary as well, we all would go back again and again. Thanks to Mary for accomedating us all.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare! Do Not Stay Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: whitesandybeaches
Reviews.Content: Booked a month ahead with Mary Motes. We got there and our condo was out of order due to tile falling apart in the bathroom. No one contacted us about this problem so that we could find some other place to stay and they did know about the issue before hand. The place stunk as soon as we walked in. The manager was not willing to work with us at all, they were the rudest people that I have ever seen. Believe me the condo's looked nice on Mary's web site but don't fall for the pictures, we had some of the nicest rooms booked, there was 6 of us...3 condo's each, and they were just nasty I can't believe they expect people to stay in these rooms and pay that money! Any way I was offered another room which I took....well I woke up the next moring to a ROACH! That was it and that's when I decided to just leave. They only refunded my money for 2 nights, I felt I should have gotten a full refund with all the trouble with my condo..Not being the origanal one I booked and then the roach and also the carpet was stained, stuff spladdered on the wall, toliet leaked, sink stopper was broken. I would never recommend this place and please be warned! Everything from inside and out is nasty about this place...please don't be fooled by the pictures you see. Don't waste your money here and don't deal with Mary Motes of Sand castle beach rentals, she is only out to get you money she will say and do anything to get your business! Just please note that YOU have been WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “Well, we had to take the bad with the good”
Reviews.Author: daltregirl
Reviews.Content: Ok, I booked a vacation package through Expedia, and when all was said and done, got a pretty good deal price wise, but I would be sure to pay for a better hotel IF I ever went back. We arrived at the Hawiian Inn at 12:30 which was over 3 hours prior to check in. I ask if our condo unit was ready, and it was not. No problem, we were offered to use the pool facilities until the room was ready, which was expected by us, but you never know. First impression of front desk was neutral, the young lady was nice enough, but not what one would call really striving to make a good first impression. She explained the whole housekeeping issue. We had packed accordingly and bathing suits and towels were right at hand. The public restrooms were very run down and dirty looking, kind of like I would expect to see in a low class night club. I was prompted to yell into the mens room for my kids not to touch the floor with bare feet. The pool was fairly busy, but not so you could not get a chair or 4 in my case. The tiki bar was open and well stocked except for no bottle beer (understandably though). We ordered lunch from the little tiki shack which was still stocked with chairs stacked on one another (dont try to order a burger anything less than well done, state law????). We ate outside on picnic tables with umbrellas. The pool area was quite clean and appeared well maintained. About an hour later, the desk clerk informed us that our condo unit was ready. I do think that they need to invest in a bit of paint for the walkways, but otherwise, free of debris (until Friday night when their was broken glass on the ground infront of the elevator which WAS cleaned up immediatly) The unit was tired - very tired. The beds even looked hard. The bathroom was in sore need of a facelift. I needent have bothered bringing bubble bath. It drained slow also. Bathroom floors may have been clean, but looked dirty. Paint peeling around a/c vents, and they were pretty dusty. Old style windows and no security lock on the door did not leave us feeling totally secure. The pull out couch appeared new and in good shape, the kitchen was not well stocked (one frypan, no sauce pans, mismatched everything. The real corker was the tv, it was a 19" remote from the early 90's (best guess). The unit was designed for 6 people, but the 4 of us were a bit cramped. The table seated 2 at best and was horribly scarred with ??? loves??? and various initials carved in it. The balcony was nice, although not private in any way, shape or form. There were two locks on this door tho and no screen. We had a beautiful view though. Again, the floors looked bad enough that I did not let my family go barefoot the entire stay To say that the front desk was uninformed is an understatement. We made reservations for the luau show and were not made to feel real good about it. We ended up getting free tickets to go, so although the food was nothing to write home about, we did not leave hungry, it was worth the time. The show was pretty good and I have to say that Tuiella (spelling) can really move. The show people were really nice (one of the dancers was the day tiki bartender) and afte chatting with them one afternoon, made sure we had the best seats in the house. We asked the front desk quite a few times where things were, and what there was to do, they were totally out of it and offred up nothing. The ironing board and iron that I ordered up to the room the day we got there remained there all week. For the most part, the building was quite quiet. We were not at all offended by any loud partying or screaming kids. That part was great. Be sure not to expect anything but the trinket shop to be open with any regularity. The tiki bar opened and closed when it felt the need to, the breakfast place was not open then entire stay, expect for what appeared to be an hour or so on Wednesday. Housekeeping was erratic - never there at the same time any one day and they tended to open the door without knocking. For the most part, they entered, changed towels, made beds (dont beleive they were changed) and picked up trash. There was not a sign that the vac was run or floors swept the entire time Because of all the renovations and demolition work going on in Daytona, and the fact that there is nothing left around the area except trinket shops and restaurants, I dont have any interest in going back there, and I am 99.9 % sure that I would not go back to the Hawaiian Inn even if I decided to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our church group loved it!”
Reviews.Author: amexblue
Reviews.Content: We rented 7 rooms from Stephanie Jones of Condos in Daytona. There was not one bad room in the lot, and we were very impressed with the amenities, cleanliness, and customer service provided by this management company. The rates are more than fair for the quality of room you get, which were at least 30% under the front desk rate. Our pastor called other management companies like Sandcastle, and the rates were much higher with higher cleaning fees. We will be booking again next year through this same company.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Inn The worst”
Reviews.Author: pegster54
Reviews.Content: IT was the worst hotel we ever stayed in. They put us on the bottom floor where the laundry service was and couln't get by them. It was like a dudgon dirty rundown,paint peeling on walls. We asked for another one, got one on third floor, no better.Torn curtains, paint peeling in bathroom dust 1 inch think on air vent, very dirty.Noise was the worst ever, kids next door yelling and laughig all hours of night. They yelled from the baclony all the way threw to the hall way. Called deck and they did nothing. The food was the worst at the dinner show there too. We stayed one night and left the next day. Would never recommon this place. I wish I read the reviews first.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: tsylvain
Reviews.Content: My friends I just got back from a weekend stay at the Hawaiian Inn Beach Resort. We rented our unit from Mary Motes. It was awesome! The unit had everything we needed, boogie board, skim boards, beach chairs & umbrellas. We loved how it was furnished. This was our 2nd time renting from Mary and we are always happy. The quality of her rooms is always top notch. Book your unit from Mary Motes, you will love everything about your stay.

Reviews.Title: “What an improvement!!”
Reviews.Author: flaroamer
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hawaiian at least 3 times a year when we travel from GA to Key West, and we usually book 3-4 rooms for our business group. I could not believe the improvements that have been made in this place since my stay 5 months ago! The entire complex has had a long overdue new facelift, and it's very appealing! The lobby has all new furniture, the pool deck has new pool chairs, the tiki bar has finally been cleaned up, the pools were spotless, the grounds are much cleaner, and I'm wondering did management win the lottery! The only thing that has NOT improved was the food, but you can't have everything! I will say that there seems to be a lot of politics going on behind the scenes, and you must be careful from whom you book. Sand Castle Beach Rentals is now a disguised ruse for the front desk, so you will NOT always get the greatest of rooms, as one member of our party quickly found out. They booked a room from Mary Moates and paid nearly $80 more (front desk rates) for a sub-standard condo. We have always booked from Condos in Daytona, and have never had a bad room, even when the complex was at it's worst. I understand that the oceanfront buildings in Daytona are weathered and in need of constant maintenance. Granted, the Hawaiian isn't the Taj Mahol, but they certainly deserve credit for trying! The place is great for families, traveling business partners, just everyone..as far as I'm concerned. I'll continue to return every time I travel. .

Reviews.Title: “Always Great but sometimes a Challange”
Reviews.Author: PaigemLeach
Reviews.Content: The Hawiann Inn is home away from home to me. I know what I am getting when I get there and I know where everything is. The staff is always helpful and I always feel safe at the hotel. Now, there is always a challange because you are dealing with condo owners and people who run the hotel. Our room was a Mary Motes room and it was perfect. The problem is that you have to have the right the key to get in. The new person at the front desk didnt realize that. After we finally got in our room, we were very happy. The have a new elevator, painted the walls and even opened the bar late to accomodate the large group that was there. For the money, I think it is a good property.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and totally rundown”
Reviews.Author: fhoagland
Reviews.Content: Most disgusting place I have ever stayed. The room that we rented from an owner had rotten food left in the refrigerator. I had to clean the unit for over three hours to make it livable. I even covered the bed comforters with sheets as I didn't want to sit on them. The floors were filthy with food, dead bugs, sand and dirt and the bathroom was not fit to use. The mirrors and pictures had a greasy film and I surmised the rest of the surfaces were as well. The pool was cleaned once while we were there for 8 days and there was stagnant water in the small pools in the miniature golf area. The entire hotel should be condemned as the place is not safe for children. The elevator worked only part time and I noticed it hadn't been inspected in two years.

Reviews.Title: “Nice condo, run down property”
Reviews.Author: Tages
Reviews.Content: I think the secret to staying at this hotel is to book one of the privately owned condos through Sand Castle Beach Rentals. My boyfriend and I stayed for a long weekend in the Spring of 2006, and when we pulled up to the hotel I was dismayed at the falling apart condition of the entrance. I postponed judgment, though, thinking maybe the hotel had poorly weatherd one of the past year's hurricanes and hadn't completed all the repairs. When we went in to register I wandered around the lobby, restrooms, and peeked in on the restaurant, and realized it was not storm damage, but lack of maintenance that was contributing to the shabby appearance. I figured the hotel must be primarily geared to college students who were just looking for a place to party, swim and sleep. The elevator, hallways, and stairs were rusty and dirty. The whole place looked tacky, outdated, and grimy. But what a nice surprise when we got to our room! Bright and cheerful, clean, and comfortable! What a difference! I would definitely book Room 202 again. The only drawback we experienced was the TV in the sitting area was installed so high up in the corner of the room we had to rearrange the furniture to get close enough so we could both sit together and watch a movie at night. I loved the fact I could lounge in bed in the morning and have sunlight stream in through the window! The restaurant on site is Polynesian themed. We went elsewhere for every meal. Also, another property negative in my opinion was the DJ at the pool on the weekend--the music was blaringly loud on the deck. No opportunity for quiet sitting in the sun to read a book.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room in Daytona Beach!!”
Reviews.Author: JimmyNole
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic time in Daytona Beach! After years of visiting Daytona at least 3-4 times per year, I have found the perfect room. It's room 515 at the Hawaiin Inn. Where as most rooms in Daytona Beach are usually run down and mostly dirty, 515 was very clean, had a seperate bedroom, 2 nice televisions and a great view! I found the room on Sandcastlebeachrentals.com. Ms Mary Moats was very pleasant and extremely helpful. There was even a book in the room with all the good deals and action spots in Daytona Beach. I would highly recommend the Hawaiin Inn. From the Tiki Bar to the live DJ, it is a great place to stay in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Sad but True”
Reviews.Author: vicwv
Reviews.Content: The Hawaiian Inn has a nice pool and patio but nice stops there. The first room we were given had mattresses that must have been 20 years old and dipped in the middle. The comforters looked like they were just thrown on the beds, no bed skirts, old dingy carpet. I complained at the front desk about the condition of the room. We were then given another room which they assured me had new beds. This room did have new beds and tile floors made the room appear much cleaner. Another couple in our group first had a room where the only bed was a murphy bed. They also complained and got another room which although not as nice as what we had was better than the first room. I also forgot to mention that the last night we were there, the air conditioning was out. It gets pretty hot in a motel room in August. The Hawaiian Inn is old and in need of refurbishing. But, there is no excuse for tired old beds and carpet that is dingy and old.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! :)”
Reviews.Author: silas048
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently rented Room 206 from Mary Motes. Used to staying in hotels on vacations, I took a chance and booked a condo. We were in no way disappointed when we walked in. The decorating was fabulous and very cozy. There was a great view, and there was both an indoor and an outdoor pool as well as a tiki bar. We will definitely be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed myself...”
Reviews.Author: aadkins97
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my time at the Hawaiian inn. I went with 5 of my friends. The rooms were not too great, but that wasnt a very big deal to me. The kitchen was a nice thing to have. All the appliances were there for you to use, but you would probably want to re-wash them first like we did. The balcony was great. It was fun to just sit in the chairs and watch people at the pool and watch the ocean. The pull out couch bed was crap though. It was completely crooked. My favorite part was the pool area. It was very fun to be there. The DJ was pretty good and he played decent music. The pool bar was also great. They have just about every drink ever, but they are a bit pricey. The hotel lobby was very nice. It was decorated well and had a nice fountain. The gift shop was nice also. Don't eat at the little breakfast cafe. It is expensive and not very good at all. Overall I really liked this hotel. It was mostly fun. Not luxurious at all but if you are looking for fun and relaxation, it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “SandCastle Beach Rentals”
Reviews.Author: divineangel1588
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been renting units from Mary Motes for several years now. We absolutely love the hotel, beach and town. The staff is so friendly and we absolutely love the DJ by the pool. I couldn't have been more comfortable than if I had been in my own home. The unit we rented was just gorgeous! It had everything we need and more! I loved how it came equipped with skim boards, boogie boards, buckets and shovels, chairs and and umbrella and of course the gaming system! Every summer we look forward to our two wonderful weeks at the Hawaiian Inn. It has become a tradition for us, and we intend to keep it going! I highly reccomend renting your unit from Mary Motes at Sandcastle Beach Rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Wonderful family Weekend”
Reviews.Author: mommagrump
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and had a great time and returned this year with my entire family which is quite large. I rented our rooms from Mary Motes with Sand Castle Beach Rentals and she was more than helpful. She helped corrdinate all of our rooms and they were great. Everything was clean and the views were beautiful, we all ran from room to room to check out the view and they were all wonderful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I have already done so. The pool and beach were perfect. The family cant wait to go back. Thanks for the great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe and Unsanitary do not Waste Money Here”
Reviews.Author: masseyfive
Reviews.Content: I do not even know where to start. We stayed there in June of 2006. It was me, husband, two children and grandmother. We rented from Mary MOates from Sandcatle beach rentals. Never again.I have to say, the room itself was ok. BUt as soon as we arrived, the room was hot. It took two days for the air to be fixed. Ther maintenance that was called to fix it, was very rude. Said he had a kid to get off the bus that someone else would have to fix it. Wow, was that ever rude. It was his job isnt it? Let me say before we even got to the room, the elevators was a mess. There are three elevators, the first only went to the fourth floor. You had to get off that one and walk to the fifth floor. We were told about one that went to the fifith floor, which is funny because it didnt even have an up to date liscence in there, and it was only to be used for construction workers, and that is where the front staff sent us. At one point, my 7 year old almost had his body shut in the elevator door. The sensor does not work in it. And scary elevators is all I can say. As we approached our room, there were boxes all up and down the hall and a box in front of our door with a knife sitting on it from the workers. That made me feel safe with my young children. Water was out for one day, the bench out by the poool broke in half on my 155 pound husband. And that was never fixed while we were there. The tropical storm was coming through and we called front desk to find out what the weather was going to do and what we do if it turned into a hurricane, and the blonde at the front desk from russia or where ever told us they didnt sell them there at the hotel, go figure, I defintly felt safe now!!! The pool area was very nasty, cig butts, beer cans, trash. Nasty, wouldnt even let my kids swim in the indoor pool. Very unsanitary. Golf area was very dirty. Towels stolen by pool in daylight. Hawaiian dinner canceled because no air conditioning. And ran into a man out by pool that had food poisoning and was calling health department on them. This hotel was a disgrace to Daytona. ANd I will never again in my life rent from or recomend Mary MOates from Sandcastle Beach rentals again in my life. She should warn people if a building is like this. I have to say , I was very disappointed, please, please, do NOT waste your money here or with Mary MOates from Sandcastle Beach Rentals.!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is not the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: PAIGELEACH
Reviews.Content: This hotel has problems I will not lie. Our hotel room on the 1st night didn't have air condition so they moved us to a new room asap the next morning. The rooms are clean and the maid does an ok job. Hey guys we can all wash dishes If 80 percent of your time enjoys a wonderful view and a big pool then you have to be patient with the other 20 percent. The things I asked to be fixed last year was done. New chairs and the old ones removed. The area was cleaner and the hotel has new paint. Bad part. I hate a DJ being there everyday. It is too loud>>>Only weekends please. The guy at the restraint is rude and people walk on the hot beach to buy food at the vendors instead of him. The hotel needs to let the maintenance guy fix things instead of patching things up for the next victim. Come on condo/ hotel owners d let these guys do their job. When we moved out of 412 the 1st night they gave it right to another person knowing the air didn't work.. Good things.. People at the front desk get beat up everyday, be nice to them and they will help as much as possible. I found them all very nice. The view is wonderful, and their isn't a better pool area. Honestly this is a run down motel 6 suites on the beach... Its cheap and if you don't like it stay at the Hilton or Fairfield. You get what you pay for. Sugestions. The pool bar is fine but tear down the rest. Build a place where people aren't afraid to buy food. it is hot and nasty looking.

Reviews.Title: “hotel from H***”
Reviews.Author: VMcDowell
Reviews.Content: I dont even know where to begin.. My husband and our 11 month old daughter stayed in room 415 from July 9-16, and I have never seen a more disgusting hotel in all my life! When I travel I dont ask for much, just a clean hotel/room, running water and courteous hotel staff. At the Hawaiian Inn I didnt recieve any of that. For starters the people at the front desk were very rude, they acted as if they didnt want to be bothered by anyone, the hotel itself was so dirty. They advertise as having this wonderful miniature golf course on site, but it was so disgusting the entire thing including the water pits were filled with dirt and sand. I never once saw anyone cleaning the pool/pool deck. I also didnt see anyone checking ph levels or chlorine. The kiddie pool looked like one big sandbox the indoor pool was so hot that as soon as you stepped inside, it took your breathe away, and under the benches in there I saw caked on dirt and sludge that looked like it had been there for 6 months or more. One night there was a homeless man taking a bath in the indoor pool at around 3:30 a.m. and hotel security let him sleep on top of the tiki bar by the pool. My husband and I were in the main pool when he found a bar of soap, ( probably from all of the homeless people bathing there) and floating right next to our 11 month old was a used band-aid and ciggarette butts/tobacco. Ok and now about our room.... when we walked in, the entire room smelled musty. We had the suite and the hide a bed was broken, and the mini bar was unplugged. The air conditioning didnt work and i heard of a lot of people complaining of the same thing. In the bathroom the tub was so yellow and the paint on the door was chipping and falling off into the floor. Oh and my favorite... WE HAD NO BATTERIES IN OUR SMOKE DETECTORS!!! After 5 attempts to get the front desk to get maintainence up there I finally called the fire dept.!! Our smoke detectors were fixed within 5 mins. after the fire dept. arrived. There was no water pressure in the kitchen, I called the front desk and they sent someone up to fix it, ( this was at noon) he said he had to go and get his wrench, and I never saw him again! So at 8:00 p.m. I told them to fix it or I was on my way downstairs with all of our dirty dishes and they can wash them! It was fixed within the hour. One of our days was spent with no running water in the entire hotel because a pipe busted in the boiler room. There were 2children shocked by outlets in the hotel. and we lost power in half of our suite for about 3 hrs one day. I was so exited to go to daytona and stay in a hotel the made you feel like you were in Hawaii but this hotel was nothing but one big headache. I even read reviews of people that were unsatisfied with the hotel and thought maybe they were just snobs, but they were right we should have stayed somewhere else. My advise to anyone interested in staying at the Hawaiian Inn.... stay at your own risk and have the fire dept. # nereby.

Reviews.Title: “HATED THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: farafam5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a 2 bedroom suite. We looked at the room first before we rented it and at first galnce appeared very nice. Once we checked in and got setteled in and unpacked in the master bedroom I began to notice mold on everything. The celing was covered our room smelled so MUSTy and everything felt damp. We stayed on the second floor, but I forget the room number. The next morning we woke up to find that the A/C in our room had leaked all the previous day and night and soaked our luggage. This would explain the mold. We called the front desk and the said they would send up maintenece. They never came. My son lost money in the video games and they yelled at him and said they would not refund his $1.00, SO i HAD TO INTERVENE. HOusekeeping finally showed up at 4pm on our second day there. We had 6 people in our group and couldn't shower, beacuse we had no towels. I finally compalind to the fron t desk and the set us up in there sister hotel. The oceanside Inn . We were put in the penthouse there, and it was very nice. That is the Hawaiian Inn's saving grace. That they found new accomodations for us at the same rate we were paying there. Oh yeah, the air in the whole hotel was out for the 2 days we were there too. I would never recomend this plae.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not worth the money. The water never worked properly. A potato chip was under the bed when we got there. The potato chip layed under the bed the entire time we were there even though the maids came everyday. We had to call the front desk for maintenance as soon as we got there because our door would not lock. It took them about 3 hours to finally come up and fix it. The mattresses were horrible and the bed spreads were filthy. The elevators were very slow. I will never stay at this place again. NOT WORTH THE MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “GROSS”
Reviews.Author: speck91854
Reviews.Content: Oh my gosh what a terrible week. This hotel needs to be destroyed. Never stayed in such a bad hotel in my life. No air, no water pressure in shower for 3 days, broken coffee pot, maids never cleaned the floor unless requested, all activities they offer were closed due to air conditioning, remote to tv did not work. Headboard on bed come crashing down in the middle of the night and almost landed on my 9 year old grandaughter. I spent over 700 dollars for this piece of junk. I expect to have all amenities, as they advertise. DONT STAY THERE AND WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bulldozer”
Reviews.Author: BarefootTom
Reviews.Content: I tried to give the Hawaiian Inn the benefit of the doubt. I had read the reviews here and still had to go there because my wife was attending a seminar. When I arrived, there was a large sign on the front door: "Emergency Meeting, Topic: Lawsuit" First clue. I was told my room wasn't ready. Now, this was at 4 p.m., so there's another clue. It had been a long drive, so I decided to use the restroom off the lobby. Well, there were two stalls. One was missing its door and the other had a broken door. Third clue. Then I was visited by a roach as I used the facility. Fourth clue. Room still not ready. No explanation. Then a man and woman stepped off the elevator and began fighting in the lobby -- not just arguing, mind you, but punching each other. Fifth clue. I mentioned the incident to the front desk clerk and she said "you really need popcorn and a coke to watch that, huh?" Clue #6. Oh, the room is ready! Wow! I don't know what tied it up, but it wasn't the cleaning crew! Dirty, dirty, dirty. I use to volunteer in a homeless shelter and we wouldn't put people in areas that dirty. The roach in the refrigerator was the seventh and final clue. I gathered my bags and went to the front desk and checked out. When I mentioned the roach, the blond behind the desk said "Oh, it's Florida. Everyone has them." She hadn't read my registration closely enough, because I've lived in Florida for the past seven years and I've NEVER had a roach in my house. Cleanliness is the factor. A word to all those who visit Florida and see a roach in their hotel room -- it's not the "climate" or the "tropics" -- it's a dirty hotel. Clerks who tell you "everyone has them" must only be speaking for their personal homes - not the clean homes. Move out of the hotel asap. I moved us to the Hilton and had no complaints. There is a bulldozer three blocks away from the Hawaiian Inn, busy tearing down an old hotel. Hey, fellas, a few blocks to the South, please!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Condo”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth-Pepe
Reviews.Content: Condo is very nice & clean. It had everything you would need at the beach. The view from the room is great and the beach was beautiful. Dealing with Mary & not having to check in was the best. We will defintely rent this condo everytime we go back to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “worst spring break in my life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel stay experience I have ever had. We had no room key for most of the day for our first day. The toliet over ran and no one would come to fix it. Had to go and get a plunger myself to fix it. The desk in the room was a fold up table. The lighting was bad and our remote on the television did not work. Most of the items like the lamps were plugged into several extension cords. Our safe was locked and had to be opened, then when it took less than 5 seconds to open I did not feel safe to use. The hammocks were gone for spring break and the indoor pool was closed. The management at this hotel s----. The outside furniture needs repaired most of the loungers need new webbing. The slider door which we stayed on the first floor only had a little hook to secure the door. The putt-putt coarse is ruined down.

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I rented two units off Mrs. Mary Motes, to spend the long weekend with our kids who live in St. Petersburg. We traveled all the way from Portland ,Oregon. I have heard alot about the Daytona beach area over the years but had never had the opportunity to spend any time there, especially the beach. We arrived on a Friday morning around 11:00 am and were welcomed with a beautifully clean room, I could see that the Hotel was an older one, but it sure gave us the feeling of really being able to take our shoes off, go down to the beach, or pool, and be casual. The hamburgers, and drinks at the outside patio grill where really good, and the evening we sat on the balcony watching the waves crash on shore, we left the windows open all night the sound is what my wife adores. I have to say for my entire family that we enjoyed our visit, did all the research on line and had no complaints at all. Mrs. Motes, count on us for a future visit

Reviews.Title: “Great view... but that's all.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very old and hasn't been renovated in years. The elevators were in poor condition and seemed unsafe. Walkway leading to the room was filthy and poorly lit. The bed mattress had a permanent indentation on one side of it and the springs were popping out. We had to hold the toilet handle down in order for it flush properly. There was a small shelf in the bathroom that was covered with rust. Both clocks in the room were inoperable. Our room overlooked the hotels miniature golf "course"... it was filthy and in very bad condition, all of the grass was either dead or dying. My wife and I attempted to sleep in but that was impossible with all of the construction and yard work being done at 7:30am on a Saturday. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “More than Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 202 through Sand Castle Beach Rentals. I must say that it was one of the best vacations I have had in a long time. The room was extremely comfortable and the view from the room was amazing. Out of the back porch, you have a great view of the Atlantic, and to the side, you have a view of the pool and festivities. It's a great room, and a great complex. The room is new and very clean. It also has great ammenities, like boogie boards and beach chairs. The complex is clean and has a really relaxed atmosphere. Everyone is very helpful. It's great not to have to drive to get to the beach. The complex is virtually 10 steps from the sand. I can't think of a single thing that I would have wanted, aside from what was already included in the stay. Doing business with Sand Castle Beach Rentals was easy. One phone call and all my questions were answered and reservations were made.

Reviews.Title: “Room was Great, Rest of place ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day stay at the Hawaiian Inn. Lucky for us we rented from a private owner Stephanie Jones of Daytona Condos. The room #208 was everything described. Verry clean and well kept. A comfortable king bed in the first room, with two futons in the living room for the kids. A great view from the balcony allowing us to see the pool and ocean. Would highly recomend this room and dealing with Stephanie Jones if you stay here. Now for the rest of the place the TiKi bar was very nice with decent drinks and food. The place noisey, you could hear people (young) all night slamming doors and running around. One day we heard glass crashing to find out someone broke a window two floors above and over two. There was glass all over the ground near the pool. Staff did clean it up. Another morning I went for a walk with my 8 year old daughter about 7:30 am on the beach. On the way out we found raw Hamburger patties all over the pool deck and in the kiddie pool. Some kids decided to throw them like frisbees the night before. I reported this to the desk and they said they knew and would be cleaning them up. 4 hrs later the patties were cleaned up, but not all, later that night there was still one near the gate leading to the pool area. Elevator was broken most days but we used the stairs anyways, only 2nd floor. All in all the room was great, the weather was great and the kids loved it. RENT FROM A PRVATE OWNER.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the hawiiann in for spring break with three of my buddies. When i first got there it was horrible none of the elevators worked, so that made a very bad impression. The room was ok even though we found a roach, the view from our room was great. I think we had the best view in the whole hotel. The room servive was horriible, we stayed for six nights and only got our room cleaned once.

Reviews.Title: “Our Room was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hawiian Inn over Spring Break and felt that it offered a fun, relaxing atmosphere. Our room that Mary Motes rented us was beautiful, very clean, and GREATLY decorated. We had a large group that attended and unfortunately our friends did not all feel the same way. The rooms are all individually owned and some rooms were not as great. The one unfortunate thing that occurred was that our room was on the fifth floor and the elevator to the fifth floor was not operating when we arrived and continued to be down more that it was up and running. This of course was of no fault of Marys but the front desk did not seem to be concerned with this issue. So carring your luggage up many sets of stairs along with groceries was not wonderful. The entertainment on the pool deck was great. We had huge expectations of seeing Daytona and found ourselves sitting at the pool all day until it was time to shower and go out to dinner. Overall our trip was great and the weather was fabulous. Thanks Again Mary.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Candlelightkiss
Reviews.Content: Even during Spring Break 2006 the stay at the Hawaiian Inn was fantastic. For the first time I am happy my intended stay on the west coast of Florida was changed because of the booked rooms and spring breakers. If not, fate would have not brought us to stay at the Hawaiian Inn. My booking experience was so easy and smooth, and Mary Motes of Sandcastle Beach Rentals made the experience so delightful! I have always believed in going with the flow when original plans don't work, but Mary made me a true believer! Because of my planned surprize birthday trip with my girlfriend, she was indeed surprized and so eternally grateful with where we shared it. She and I had such a terrific time, and the room and amenties were everything Mary had described; superb! I can't wait to book it again! It is on the "must repeat over and over again" list.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Be Back Next Year!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mary Motes from Sandcastle Beach Rentals rented us a beautiful unit,510. It appeared to be newly remodeled as everything was in perfect condition. We had unbelieveable views of the Ocean and the pool from our balcony. We loved the pool side Tiki bar and the hammocks by the pool. We thought this was a great place to stay. My husband and I rode our bikes all the way from California for Bike week. We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn and had a great time. We will be back next year!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Look For Another Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: $implicity
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Daytona, we loved the beach and the city but hated the hotel! Parking was horrible and our room was not ready upon arrival. The elevators were hot and extremely slow. Our room was extremely noisy with people running up and down the halls and slamming doors in the middle of the night. The neighbors even climbed over onto our balcony and removed our swimsuits & towels that were hanging over the chairs and threw them on the floor and then took our chairs. I thought the Hawaiian Luau would be fun, but it was cheesy, over priced with mediocre food. Will definately not go back! Last year we stayed at the Ocean Jewel and loved it. The room was great and it had a separate bedroom and 2 baths!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian 208 is great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I rented from Condos in Daytona from Stephanie Jones, and the unit that we had was the best I've ever been in. The complex was clean and newly updated, the unit itself was gorgeously decorated, it had more amenities than any other complex where we've stayed. We come for Bike Week every year, and have stayed in some pretty decent places...some pretty terrible. I will always return to the Hawaiian Inn now. We've found our bike week home!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in an ocean front "view" 2 queen bed with ocean view - This was the most disgusting unclean hotel room I have ever stayed in. Sheets/comforter sticky like never been washed. Bed - you could feel the springs in your back. Towels felt like they had been rinsed but not washed. Carpet and floor very worn and filthy. Bathroom - tub water ran the entire night. Had to hold down the toilet handle to flush. Tile in bathroom appeared very worn and restuct back to wall - worse tile repair job I have ever seen - I could have done a better job. There was actually a board behind the two "unmatching" water knobs in shower. Fish painted on bathroom wall appeared to be pained by a two year old. A/C never worked the entire night. Light bulbs blown everywhere. Advertises and indoor pool that is heated. Inquired at fron desk was given directions only to find sign "out of service" on door to heated pool. Lobby chairs were sticky and nasty and the most wretched thing of all was a dead fish head floating in the swimming pool. For $139.00 a night we were charged a minimum of $100.00 too much. I would not recommend this hotel to a homeless person.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was excellent the hotel its self was pretty excellent there was some things that could of been approved about the hotel but there was nothing there that made it awful...The staff was just ok but our room was perfect. The view was perfect it was nice and clean it was just like home. Everything we needed was right there at our finger tips.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My visit to the Hawaiian Inn was GREAT, unlike some reviews I have read. I attribute this to Mary Motes. She told me her units were wonderful and mine was. I rented Unit 202, which is a corner unit, direct oceanfront. Unlike many units, this one had windows in the bedroom. I woke up in the morning and just opened the blinds to lay in bed and watch the ocean waves. It was like a little piece of heaven. This unit has obviously been updated recently. Everything was brand new and the unit was beautifully decorated. Check out these photos I took during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel-No Way”
Reviews.Author: Raven2000
Reviews.Content: I want to add to my viewview, I am not one to complain but, I am sorry, I do not want Roaches brought home with me in my luggage and when I told the front desk, I saw a roach, they said all of the places in florida have them, they come from the trees. Like it was no big deal, also a homeless person was hanging around the lobby and outside the door, manegement was smoking when we arrived. The so-called tiki bar was closed. We were given rooms on the 7th. floor, after checking out two and turned them down because of the roach, they said they would give us another better one to see, we said no thanks after lugging our suitcases up two flights of stairs twice after midnight. We checked out. I do not advise anyone staying on the 7th. floor, filthy dirty and roach infested. I have never experienced such filth.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Horrible! Room Horrible! View of the Ocean only good part! RM239”
Reviews.Author: gravitykills2097
Reviews.Content: Hawaiian Inn Hotel Review Room 239 Purchased an Ocean View room (this meant paying an extra $20CAD a night for the upgrade), arrived and was informed the room booked was not an Ocean View room, had concierge change rooms and further disappointment followed. the room: - disgustingly dirty sofa couch (originally a white with baby blue strips, looked like a sofa out of someones garage that was covered in stains,stains you dont want to know what caused them) - bugs everyday had to be killed - no closet doors - lots of rust on doors - non-functional balcony patio door (which itself was clouded glass) - torn carpet with black stains everywhere on it - mildew smell in the room (constant) - no complimentary shampoo, conditioner,or anything else except for the small little complexion and bath bars - non-functional shower curtain (constantly cleaned up water from floors and counters that sprayed from shower - toilet kept breaking (couldnt fixby taking lid off because ceramic counter was build over top of toilet with only 2 inches of space between) - cupboards were pressboard (cover was peeling off of the doors) - silverware provided was used, not cleaned - frying pan provided burned everything cooked on it - no fan for stove, caused the smoke detector to go off when cooking - bed matress had yellow staining on it - curtains were musky - in room mini bar, no access, locked and not plugged in - bed itself appeared to be an old family bed that was brought to the hotel for use, it was a wooden head board cheaply painted over with yellow paint, brush hairs stuck in the pain ,the bed post sawed off - toaster oven had no nob to set the cooking timer to cook anything - electrical plugs covered with duct tape - bath tub full of rust and leaking shower nobe - no local calling without the 50Cent charge; 40% of long distance call time charge - no complimentary coffee in room ($2.00 charge per packet) - no continental breakfast - fruit flies infested in the room - no in-room internet connection (wireless or dia-up)- satellite internet was just installed a week prior, only available in the hotel lobby (use with laptops) - clothes, bagged food,etc. was covered by a filmy, sticky type substance that clinged to everything the first day we were in the hotel room (the room itself was already covered with this filmy substance on the lamps, the curtains, glass, etc.) - yellow shower/bath water from tap, water doesn't drain from tub when showering, it fills halfway up your calves - NO Hawaiian greeting upon arrival (Should have it) - when family called the hotel with and asked for information by last name, the hotel personnel told them there was no one booked for a room under the name, and therefore no one checked in under that name (the hotel was booked a week before) Overall the staff was not professional the room was horrible. The only good part of this room was the Ocean View which we really enjoyed. -GK2097

Reviews.Title: “Unintelligent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms on my credit card for our large group for New Years. Part of the group arrived before me so I told them to go ahead and see if they would be able to check in both rooms without me there. They were able to do so, but someone had to give the front desk their credit card first. In one room, the lock on the entry door did not work, so they had to sleep with the room more or less wide open. They called maintenance about it but it was never fixed properly. The room itself was nice with tile flooring in the living area and a mirrored wall to make the room appear larger. Their air conditioner did not work at first, but was eventually repaired. The second room was a bit older looking with stains on the carpet. The fold out bed collapses under normal body weight so you'd be sleeping at an angle. We slept on the floor instead. The air conditioner never worked. At one point during our second day there, a maintenance man simply walked right into our room and into our bathroom without knocking, notifying us he was here and why, or saying a word to us period. When it came time to check out, myself and the individual who had checked in with their credit card went to the desk to check out. We both handed over our credit cards and signed our respective receipts. The next day I noticed I had two charges on my card. The other person had no charge. I called and spoke with someone in their accounting department who did little to explain to me what was going on. I was to wait up to five business days - there would be a refund. At this time, the other person's card had not yet been charged. Two days later I notice that there is not only a refund on my card, but now a third charge. They had charged me to hold the room, refunded my money, charged me for my room, and then charged me again! To make a long story short, the other person's card currently has a refund, but no charge. The person in the accounding department said that in order to get this corrected (one charge on each card), they asked for signed faxed pages and copies of both of our credit cards, front and back. Are you kidding me? They have already proven they cannot handle simple charges to credit cards.. why would I provide them with how my name appears on my card, my number, the expiration date, and the security code on the back? Ill just keep the two charges on my card and get the money from the other people. Its definately the safer route.

Reviews.Title: “What a great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Gigi5169
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Room 206 at Hawaiian Inn with two friends and it was awesome! Mary Motes of Sand Castle Beach Rentals was great to work with. The room was clean, clean, clean -- which is extremely important to me. It was beautifully decorated and had everything we needed (beach chairs, beach towels, umbrellas, lots of linens, even wine glasses). The view was great and I really like staying in a privately owned unit and having the amenities of a hotel. Tiki Bar and pool were great. I will definitely go back. Mary Motes happened to be there and showed us some of her units and they were all top-notch. I want to return with my husband and rent 515. It is gorgeous and has a new king-sized bed. Wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Really Awful place for any amount of money”
Reviews.Author: LuvinLife48
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extrememly disappointing. It appears to be nice enough from the lobby and i was even told by a couple of people that visit Daytona that it was decent enough for the price. Wrong, i don't know what has happenned to this place, but they need to call an exterminator and also invest in getting their elevators updated. I was only there 3 nights and during that time frame the elevator failed on at least 3 occassions for me and other guest were telling of being stuck on the lobby elevators as well. The room appear to be okay the first day or so, but then i noticed a really big cockroach crawling while i was watching television. I should also note to be fair, they have a wonderful selection of cable channels and the view of the ocean from the room was really nice. I hadn't looked under the sink the first day, but after seeing the big roach, i decided to put food i had purchased in the fridge and cabinets, that's when i found the mother-load of "roaches". Told the front desk clerk and he told me that they were aware of the roaches and that they could move me to another room , that "may not" have them.. When checking out, i told the manager and he imformed me that yes the clerk had made note of my complaint and he gave a "guest complaint" number to call, which is never being answered.. I would not reccommend this place for sanitary reasons and lack of caring on the part of the staff from desk clerk to management.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not nice enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I am not sure where to begin, we dont complain at all about our places of stay. But I guess we had to sooner or later! When we first got to the hotel we were amazed with how everything looked, beautiful lobby, beautiful markings outside, and the pool area was great. However when we got to the room (107) the room had a bad smell to it, being however Daytona having its fair share of storms we over looked it. Then the bed looked as if it had sunken in the middle, first red flag(again we overlooked it). Later that night we got ready to go out and guess what NO HOT WATER, had to draw the line. Went to front desk and let them know we werent having the greatest experience, their response...its an old hotel you have to let it run for about 15-20 minutes because there is only about 25 people staying so Hot Water will take a while. True enough 20 minutes later...HOT WATER. Temp. starts to drop a little out side, no heat, tried the air just for kicks no air....let front know about this...said they fixed it...woke up to a flooded floor...what next!!! So we report they say they will fix....Back to the only 25 people, we could not understand if there was only 25 people in the hotel why give us a bottom room floor with a crappy view....anyway we go out to the spa w/jacuzzi and guess what no more jets for jacuzzi now just a heated pool. Went to order a drink from the famous Tiki Hut...closed and they are not sure why......and for the grand prize, the whole reason we went there was for the dinner show......Cancelled [--]...Oh yea their Java Hut, closed...we loved the view, the surroundings were great...but man the room and service on this trip really [--]. For over 100 a night hotel I felted like a roadside 19.99 a night 5 dollar extra guest treatment and room.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time !!”
Reviews.Author: Ta2Gerrit
Reviews.Content: We stayed in rooms 536 & 539 during Biketoberfest and had a great time. Spacious rooms with kitchenette and nice seaside balcony. Friendly staff and nicely close to the beach. Swimming in the Ocean in October, what more do you want. The only thing that bugged us where tiny little bugs in the bathroom and the very slow elevator. For the rest, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip was Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Review or accolades? We think both are appropriate. We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn, in a unit that we rented through Sand Castle Beach Rentals and Mary Motes. We needed a place that we could simply relax and enjoy, that is exactly what we got. The unit was beautiful, up to date furnishings, everything we could want, at our disposal. Umbrellas, beach chairs, beach towels and they even thought about the little ones, and had beach toys, with which they built their own version of the Taj Majal!! I have been in the airline industry for 17years, and we have traveled the country (thank goodness for the free air fare), and have seen the best and worst that exist with regard to accommodations. This unit from Sand Castle was everything it was promised to be. Can't always count on that when looking at photos on the web. Can't always tell how many years ago the unit looked like that. So it is always a risk, as I am sure you all know. Our unit looked just as the photos on the Sand Castle site showed it to look, the photos could have been taken the day we arrived!! We enjoyed our stay completely. Rest assured the units are newly updated and modern. There was some on going painting of the complex itself, but it was not a problem to our stay at all. The beach was great, the pool side bar was so much for us all, adults and kids alike. Can't wait to karaoke again!! AND..You just have to try one of the burgers from the tiki bar grill!!Over the years we have noted places that we will return to and people we trust. We will certainly add this experience to both of our lists!

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Family Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of ten rented 3 rooms at Hawaiian Inn, 202, 206 and 120 for a fall family vacation from Mary Motes (Sand Castle Beach Rentals). Mary was most delightful and easy to work with. Two of the rooms we rented were hers, personally and they were completely renovated, beautifully and tastefully decorated. I was so surprised. as we had stayed there for years and years, through its decline, and to see it coming back to life was such a pleasure. The units there now are almost all individually owned condos and many have been and will be totally renovated, however, don't make a mistake by renting from someone other than Mary Motes. She rents her own units as well as other owners condos and only takes the "cream of the crop." There are still a few undesirable units, but Mary won't touch them. She is so dedicated to her clients! She even left us gifts in the room! We will definately go back to Hawaiian Inn and continue to make arrangements with Mary. As we are thinking about buying a condo there, she was so valuable with her shared knowledge of the future plans for the condos. We had a wonderful vacation and can't wait to return. I promise you will love the Hawaiian Inn if you make reservations through Sand Castle Beach Rentals with Mary. Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: scarlet17
