Reviews.Content: Traveled over to the states for a months stay, we wanted to visit Florida and we decided to stay At the Hawaiian Village, friends of ours had reccomened Sand Castle Beach Rentals , we contacted Mary Motes and were very pleased with our dealings with her . We stayed in unit 206 for one week and we were more than delighted. We live in Crockerton UK, and we have many close friends and family members that vacation in the US, and we will recommend Sand Castle Beach Rentals to all our friends. We again traveled in November 2004, to the US, this time with our daughter and son-in-law, and once more we found the accommodations provided by Ms. Motes, excellent in every way. Clean, clean, and very up to date, with an abundance of linens and towels provided for our use, can't say enough regarding our splendid vacation. We are arriving again in the States , this November, and will be once more staying at a place that we feel is like our home away from home. We will continue to return each year. Thank you , Mr & Mrs Graham Bulman

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I rented from Mary Moates, and the unit was ok, but extremely small. Yes, it was corner oceanfront unit...but you would think that a corner unit would actually be bigger. We were very claustrophic! The bedroom had no walk-around room at all, and the living room wasn't much bigger than my walk-in closet at home! The grounds at the Hawaiian have definitely gone through extensive rehab, and are looking great. They painted the building, which was an improvement from the last time we were there. I was just so very, very disappointed by the size of the unit. And yes, it was clean, but nothing extra special or out of the ordinary. It had the same amenities that the rental program units have. It was also much more expensive than our previous rental experiences, and I would have to say, not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “We had the time of our lives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Hawaiian Inn was nothing but exceptional. We rented Unit 120 from the owner which is located on the ground floor in the center of the complex. We, too, were skeptical about the Hawaiian Inn after reading some of the reviews but believe me...Unit 120 was the cleaniest Unit we have ever stayed in. You could eat off the floors. It was also well equipped. We couldn't have asked for anything more. It was decorated in mauve's and greens and was just so quaint. The King size bed was very comfortable. Actually it was more comfortable than our bed at home. The cable TV had excellent reception and as many channels as anyone could want. When we first arrived which was on Saturday, the air conditioning was out. Apparently the compressor had gone out for the whole building. By Monday afternoon, it was fixed and had great cooling. The DJ's on the weekend and through the week were just Wonderful!! We enjoyed listening to the music which was only played from 12 noon to 4 pm. We wished they could have played longer. The music is a mixture of tunes for everyone to enjoy. The pool was very large, clean and relaxing. There are renovations going on which was good to see as this place is really too nice to run down. Probably the worst downfall is that there are NOT enough lounge chairs around the pool deck that are worth sitting in. Most of them are broken. You have to put your towel on a chair by 7:30 am. or you have to try to use a broken one. Hopefully they will buy new chairs. Other than that, we would love to come back to the Hawaiian Inn for our next vacation. Renting from an owner, especially Mary Motes or Mrs. Gregory, is the way to go. The only way for us. Thank you both so very much for allowing us to "Have the time of our Lives."

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel ---”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were on a family vacation for what was supposed to be a 2 week stay at the Hawaiin Inn. We ended up leaving the hotel a week early because we has no air for two days and it was going to be even longer. Also our suite had a sofa bed and it was broken. And the bed was also broken. The suite was room 306. We stayed there last year and we loved it. I don't know what happen in one year, but something will have to change before we ever go back there. The one thing I can say is the Maids were very nice and helpful. This hotel used to be great, with the bar, pool, and music. my kids loved it . But it needs new management or something.

Reviews.Title: “Woudn't do it again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family & I just stayed at the Hawaiin Inn for 1 night this past week. We found it to be extremely dirty & not taken care of at all. I cannot believe that this hotel has passed any kind of inspections. Yuk!! We found their ad in our AAA guidebook & the pictures looked spectacular. We felt that the pictures shown were nothing like the real deal. The elevator was terrible, carpets were wet & smelly in the halls. The balconies all had huge chips of concrete missing. It just looked terrible! We weren't looking for a 5 star place, but lets be a little sensible. The outdoor pool is only so-so & there is no way I would use the indoor one based on the looks of it. They advertise a 9-hole miniature golf course which was covered with water & from the looks of it for quite some time. If they just put some elbow grease into the place it could be nice. It is so run down & dirty. As for us, no way would we stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “John made the trip a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed in unit 305 which I rented privately through one of the owners. when I first entered the resort I have to be honest, I thought it was a little run down. I noticed however that renovations were being done and knew the area did suffer the terrible hurricanes. once in the resort our party went up to our private condo 305. when we walked in it was a different world. The unit was absolutely gorgeous! It was clean and there was a wonderful gift basket with all kinds of toiletries and goodies. it was obvious this unit was well maintained. we had been told if we had any problems to contact the caretaker John Salmon. I must tell you, short of John standing there holding a towel for you when you got out of the shower there was nothing that man wouldn't do to make our vacation pleasurable. He was kind, funny and genuinely concerned for us to have the best experiance ever. we had a couple of smal issues and John was at our beckon call to resolve them. The beach view from our room was amazing and we had a ball at the pool and tiki bar. I highly recommend this unit and resort.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: comet1989
Reviews.Content: I had an ocenafront room without a balcony, you could barely see the ocean. The room was dirty, and the hallway was very nasty. My little girl was scared to walk in the hallway, it was really that nasty. Bugs in room 228, that is where we stayed. Was afaird to let my girls walk on the floor. Will not go bak ever again.

Reviews.Title: “if your woried about this hotel don't be!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was really woried about this hotel after reading some of these reviews, but we already booked it with cheap tickets and would lose money if cancelled, so we decided to try it. Well we are glad we did! Great attasophere. Music by the pool , very relaxing. Tiki bar by the pool , great food. few leaks in ceciling in lounge but what do you expect, after a hurricane comes thorugh, but they are remolding as fast as can. Rooms are great. Great views. Okay service.

Reviews.Title: “Private suite 208”
Reviews.Author: LMM
Reviews.Content: We booked with Stephanie Jones for her unit 208, week of June 12,2005. After reading a few negative reviews I was worried about staying there with four kids. Stephanie assured that if we didn't like the unit to call her and she would move us or refund our money. Well---when we got there, there was no need to deal with the front desk we went straight to our room and when the kids walked in first all I heard was "WOW this is nice." 208 is decorated so nice with a king size bed in the bedroom, which was more comfortable than our bed at home & 2 comfortable futons in the living room. The kitchen was equipped with everything needed. The view from our balcony was fantastic. The bathroom has enough room for one person at a time, but is like that at most hotels. Our cable was snowy from Sun until Fri. After contacting Stephanie we were informed it was from the hotel roof being redone. We also informed her about one of the TVs sizzling when we turned it on. By the the next day she was there with a brand new TV. The hotel is being remodeled, new roof, halls painted, balconies painted. The hallways do need new carpet, but I'm sure that is on their list after everything else.They do have a mildew smell, but you only walk through to get to the beach. Pool area is very large, nice and clean. The only bugs we encountered were the mosquitoes outside. I would recommend booking one of the private units if you don't mind making your beds, doing your dishes and perhaps having to wash towels once. Thank you Stephanie for providing a very nice, affordable unit for my family to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “The entire place should be condemned.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One night (June 6, 2005) of this place was as much as we could stomach, and we were in one of the better rooms (314). There were towels on the floor in the lobby to cover wet spots; old, soiled furniture in the lobby; the elevator was old, rickety, dirty, and smelly; and the hallways were a total nightmare with trash everywhere and soggy, soiled indoor/outdoor carpeting trying to cover crumbling cement underneath. The first room given us was just scary (I didn't want to put my luggage down - 307). After trying to settle in our 'better' room, we opened the curtains to our "private" balcony only to have our neighbor peering in at us from his "private" balcony next to us. We had to keep our curtains closed. The 19 inch TV had no premium cable stations. The bathroom and kitchen appliances were stained. To add to that, there were hair strands (not ours) collecting in the bathroom from the carpet each time we went into the bathroom. We could hear the conversations of our neighbors at night on their balcony. We awakened to endless hammering from the roof. Then there was the DJ who played music, not the best, as loud as it would go. The restaurants were so run down, we dare not eat anything there. It's unbelievable the Health Department hasn't closed this place down. I try to give everyone the benefit of the doubt, but the place is a dive.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the critters in unit 305”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, 3 year old and myself stayed in unit 305 at the Hawaiian Inn. This was a penthouse unit and at first glance it appeared to be well kept and in good shape. We had a unit on the very north end of the complex with a port hole window which allowed in the heat from the day and the lights all night long in since their were no drapes or blinds on the windows. The worst part of it all was the A/C didnt even work in this room. It was cold in the rest of the condo but no air would blow out of the vent in this room. We attmepted to watch TV in the living room area only to find that their was no cable. We called the Maintenance guy who took care of this unit for the private owner told him of the problem. He told us last week the tv in the bedroom didnt work and I was lucky it worked this week. He said he would have the tv fixed by the next day which was saturday. Well on monday when we checked out the tv still was not fixed. Later that night my wife and I sat on the couch in the living area only to be greeted by a silver fish crawling out of the couch. We then decided we would sit on the balcony instead. When we went out the door we were greeted by the noxious smell of tar from the taring maching located right under our balcony. The person who rented us this unit nor the owner told us about this nor even brought up that the complex was undergoing repairs. Their was tar all over the balcony and it stuck to our feet, clothes and anything else it touched. We could not even enjoy our balcony the whole memorial day weekend because the smell made us sick to our stomachs. When we came back inside from the balcony we were greeted by yet another critter. A roach this time crawling across the carpet. We killed it also and thought it might have come in when we had the door open to the balcony. After a shower my wife went to the kitchen and was greeted by a huge roach crawling across the kitchen floor. At this point she had a fit.....right before bed she got up to use the restroom and had to kill 5 more roaches in between the bedroom and bathroom hallway. We killed 7 roaches and one silver fish the first night. By this point we were disgusted with this unit. On saturday we got up and washed a pan to cook breakfast in. Washed it first then took some plates out of the cabinets to wash to eat off of. Well we found out why their were roaches in this place! The plates still had food on them where they had not been washed from the previous people who used them and the owner nor her maintenance man bothered to check. We immediately called the owners maintenance man AGAIN! Twice and it had not even been 24 hours yet. Told him of the roach infestation, dirty dishes and reminded him about the tv. He did manage to have someone come and spray....the only downfall to that was we had to clean up dead roaches in the units all weekend during our stay. Other then get the room sprayed the so called maintenance man did nothing to fix the problems with the other complaints that we had. I have tried to contact the owner of unit 505 and she refuses to respond to emails and nor does the lady who handles the booking of over 200 units for this area. My advice is to stay away from this complex. It is very old, run down and not taken care of at all. Paint is peeling, very dirty, pool is nasty with broken tile, dirty water, and needs a major over haul. I would also stay away from unit 505...while it appears clean at closer look it is nasty and not maintained at all.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at this hotel. I was excited with the idea that maybe a hotel from the 1960's might still be alive, a themed hotel. Upon arriving at the hotel I had to think twice. There is a banner hanging from the front of the hotel. I almost drove right by it. No lite street sign. The lobby canopy was a possible giveaway by the shape. The service like most places was mixed. Good and poor. The room was hodge podge. It was a hang out for the locals and they all (staff) bragged about the large pool deck...."Best on the Beach". The pool tile was broken (sharp) an accident waiting to happen. As much as I wanted to be at a place that was from days gone bye I was sad to see they have just let it go bye. I expect the staff all to be dressed to match the theme. I expected to hear music in the lobby and when I arrived out under the canopy to be hawiaan music.........no music. Maybe I am from the old school and appreciate the olded hotels. I don't beleive as long as it is new it is clean or the place to stay. Hawiaan Inn, jump in feet first and give it 100%. The show was not bad they tried. Surprisingly the place was full. I am not sure why? My search for the past goes on for a clean, themed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Private rentals are off the chain!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 505, which is a penthouse unit. We rented it through one of the private owners, based upon the good ratings from previous TripAdvisor reviews. After reading all the very diverse ratings, we didn't know what to expect and held our breaths as we opened the door to the unit. I was shocked! It was far nicer than the pictures that the agent had sent us, and so much roomier than I'd expected. There was a foyer in which you entered, a long hallway with the bathroom and huge bedroom with two queens at the far end. On the opposite side of the split planned unit, there was a very comfortable murphy bed in the living room, and the kitchen was gorgeously tiled with very fashionable furniture. The closet was as large as another room, and there were no less than 3 huge ones. We have stayed in timeshare many times previously, but those in Daytona left much to be desired. I am very pleased to say that this was as nice...if not nicer...than any of the timeshares we've been in Daytona. The agent, Stephanie Jones, from Hawaiian208, made sure that we had an adequate supply of everything...in fact, there was overkill. I would return to the Hawaiian Inn penthouse in a heartbeat!! Where else could you find a unit that can sleep 6 people so comfortably for under $700 a week? You people that give the Hawaiian such horrific reviews need to stay with the private owners. The units are a world apart from the front desk units. Our friends booked a unit from the front desk, and it left a lot to be desired. I've never been so utterly pleased, and boy, were our friends p-----!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay in room 317. The hotel is old and can use some updates. The ice machine did not work at all on the third floor, I had to go to the second floor for ice. The room was old but spacious and it was clean as well as the bathroom and kitchen. The appliances were in very good shape. House keeping was very good and when I returned to my room each day I found it had been cleaned, vaccumed, and restocked with fresh towels. The view of the pool area and ocean from my room was worth the stay. The pool area was cleaned and well maintained and staff was constantly cleaning the grounds and main lobby. It appeared as though some work was being done due to the storms from 2004. I would stay at this hotel again. The staff was very nice when checking and leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn for spring break with our daughters, ages 20, 18, and 14. The girls loved the DJ at the pool and liked the fact that there were lots of other kids their age there. It provided a safe party atmosphere for them. My husband & I found it relaxing and we liked the tiki bar and the convenience of being on the beach, which was beautiful. Our condo was clean, well stocked, and nicely decorated. We rented from a private owner, and the only suggestion for improvement that we would make would be that we would have liked to have access to a phone in the room and maybe a midweek towel exchange option. We would have been glad to have arranged to pay more in advance. I laundered our bath towels three times that week in the laundry room at the hotel. Also, it would have been wonderful to have a key to access the door that led to the pool/beach area. The owner was quite nice and checked in with us to make sure that everything was ok. We thought that the unit was extremely reasonably priced and a good value. The hotel grounds are nice and the pool is clean, although not heated (in April, it was quite cold). Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and our daughters would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, typical older Daytona Hotel, but poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: cslater
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay here after reading reviews, but I did not find any cockroaches, rusted refridgerators, smelly hallways, or green water in the Pool. Here are the good things -- The room (410) was clean and large. Seperate bedroom, small kitchen, and fold out couch. The view and the pool area was perfect. New tile around the pool, Tiki Bar, a DJ for the spring breakers from noon till 4pm. The indoor pool/sauna was a little too warm for me, but the kids liked it. Here's the downside. Check in was a nightmare. We arrived at 2pm. Do not try to check in early! The staff was border line rude, and kept telling us it would be another 30 mintues or so, up until 4pm. At 4, we asked again and told our room was still being cleaned, so we got the room number and went up to check it out. Turns out there was already someone in there! The manager insisted they move their belongings to room 408 and put us in room 410. Would have been easier just to switch the names in the computer, but I was too tired to care. The family in 408 told us the tried to check in the day before, but the hotel overbooked and had to put them up at another location down the street for the night. Another couple had driven from Michigan and found they had no room. They booked in November of last year, and again the hotel overbooked. Bottom line, hotel clean/good pool/good location - Staff rude/unorganized and needs new management. Private condo owners in this building should take note!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian 208 was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Hawaiian Inn and used Hawaiian 208 to book our unit. It was great for me, my two sons, and one of my son's friends. The unit was clean, well equipped (it even had a a metal detector to search for things on the beach). We also appreciated the combination entry lock which made it easy to come and go without worrying about a key on the beach. Some of the public areas could use a sprucing up, but it appeared as though that was in progress while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “The Hawaiian Inn Show”
Reviews.Author: icandoallthings777
Reviews.Content: We bought 4 tickets to the "World Famous Hawaiian Inn Show" for $30 each. The price includes buffet dinner and the show. The show was about average but not real intertaining, something I could have done without, probably worth about $5. The food was absolutely terrible. We had Costco salad straight from the bag served with canned fruit cocktail and instant pudding for desert. (NO LIE) The entre was baked chicken legs and thighs, pork shavings and gravy mixed together, and a some type of cheap fish. The rice was bad and the frozen cooked vegtables were cooked to a limp state. I have had better meals in the local high school cafeteria than this place. It is only there for one reason... to take your money. STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: PantalaNagaPampa
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly, the pool and pool bar are terrific, the location is good, but the hotel itself is in need of some TLC. Although our room needed updating, all the basics were there, and it was spacious. The full kitchenette and furnished balcony overlooking the ocean were great! We were on the 4th floor and you just couldn’t beat the view. We were there during Bike Week and the hotel was very accommodating to us bikers. There was a large secured area to park the bikes and a lot of space to park the truck and trailer. As we walked the grounds we could tell the hotel had seen better days. The elevators were a little scary and slow, but worked. One day there wasn’t hot water for the shower, but we made it through. I like to be able to control the temperature in my hotel room, and couldn’t do that here. There wasn’t anything in particularly terrible about this hotel and I think with a little work and some renovations, it would be a nice place to stay. We picked this hotel because it was on the beach, had the availability during bike week and had a fairly low rate ($109). The next time we come to Daytona we’ll probably shop around first, but would stay here again if we had to.

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS A DIVE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before we even got there, I called to confirm my reservations, and someone had cancelled them!!! ( It was not us!!) They ended up re-instating our reservations!! My husband and I (with our 2 year old) stayed here for 10 days for the Daytona 500 week. (My father and four of his friends were in another room there.) I walked in and saw the filthy carpets and I knew I hade made a mistake. The bathroom was pretty clean, except for the RUSTED OUT VENTS!!! My neice stayed on the pull out couch in the living room and she fell through it!!!. (She is not a big person, she is average size!!) The bed spreads were pretty old and WE FOUND COCKROACHES CRAWLING ON THE CEILING IN THE KITCHEN!!! ONE OF THEM WAS IN MY FATHERS JACKET WHEN HE WENT TO GET IN THE PLANE IN JACKSONVILLE!!!! I went to do laundry and there is only one laundry room with four machines, and 3 dryers. I paid 269 a night to stay in a MAJOR DIVE. THIS PLACE WAS HORRIBLE!!!! I HATED IT. DO NOT STAY HERE. Kortney Theriault Edinburg, Maine

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: mistylynne_2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn for the second time in December. Our previous stay was this past summer. We stayed on the 4th floor right across from the elevator. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortably equipped with a fridge, micro, coffee maker and stove-top. It was stocked with clean dishes and pots, pans and silverware. There is a small grocery store nearby. After the numerous hurricanes that hit the area this past fall, the Hawaiian Inn was not spared. Many of the hotels in the area were shut down completely. I understand that Hawaiian Inn isgoing through numerous renovations, such as the painting of the building, replacing the carpeting, etc. This is a very family-friendly hotel close enough to the main strip, yet far enough from it. The renovations will only improve upon a very nice place to vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Bad before I even get there”
Reviews.Author: prezmusic
Reviews.Content: Have not even stayed at the Hawaiian Inn but already had a bad experience. Called to make reservation for June and young lady give me price that is $30 over internet price (Expedia) than tells me there is no AAA discount when AAA site says there is one...Gave her another chance to match rates and was told use internet. Didn't seem like she wants me to stay there so I'll take my business else where

Reviews.Title: “be aware”
Reviews.Author: tj98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hawaiian inn with a private owner in September 2004. Her condo was beautiful except for the 2 dead roaches in the closet. Also no beach towels only small ones for bathing. Anyway, the hallway reeks and the carpet in the hallway is filthy, there are tiles falling off of the baby pool, the water looked dirty. The whole inside of the hotel was dirty along with the stairwell clogged with bugs. The gate at the entrance from the beach to the hotel was busted and it seemed like there was no security. The only upside was the nice room(except for the roaches) and guitar player on the weekend. My husband enjoyed the indoor pool and the outdoor pool was very big. If they would clean the stairwells and maybe remove the carpet in the halls it may make it a little better but I still think I will find a private condo next time.I never used the elevator because I was scared it would brake down.It also smelled very bad. Luckily I only had to scale 1 flight to the 2nd floor. Maybe I could take it a few days not for a whole week until they upgrade

Reviews.Title: “The staff was great, but the hotel needs work!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family spent two weeks at the Hawaiian Inn. We arrived on 12/20/04 and deperted on 1/03/05. First of all, when we arrived at the hotel, I was given a room that was disgusting. There was a chunck taken out of the toilet, there were holes in the bedspreads, food in the pull out couch and rust all over the vents. The carpets were stained and the room had a very bad odor. I went back to the desk and explained the situation. They let me look at other rooms. I saw 9 rooms before I found one that was acceptable. Next, We chose Hawaiian Inn because we wanted a resort with restaurants and a heated or indoor pool. The cafe was open from 7am-11am. The bar and grill was open a total of three days during our two week stay. The "indoor pool" is a large spa. It was not something our 2 year old could really enjoy. The gift shop did not have set hours. Some days it was open and some days it was not. When I asked the front desk about the bar and grill and the gift shop being open, I was told that there were not enough people in the hotel to open. I understand, but let people know the situation before they check in. During our two week stay, there were several days with a high of 75 degrees. Due to the fact that we went in December, the air conditioning was not on. Except for the 5th floor, which have their own units. The bedroom in the suite did not have a window so, it was very hot. We bought a fan because it was so bad. Many hotel guests complained.

Reviews.Title: “Stinking Horror Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: DISGUSTING! We also looked online for Hotels, this Hotels pictures must have been taken 20 years ago.Pictures are very deceiving! When we pulled up to the Hotel, I was scared. It was run down and the entire surrounding area was the same. We got to our room and were shocked. It smelled of urine and vomit. The beds sagged to the middle. We stayed one night , which consisted of me stuffing dryer sheets in the vents of the a/c to circulate some fresh air.We also called housekeeping to come "spray" our room from the stench. We also stuck some fabric sheets under the pillow cases as to not breathe the stench. The people(other guests) in the Hotel were loud and dirty. It had smelly hallways and was in general a DUMP! The pool was filthy.In need of MANY repairs.The toilet was plugged and overflowed.We left after one night which was one of the longest and smelliest nights we ever had. Drove to St.Augustine and stayed at the La Fiesta! I highly recommend the area and the Hotel. The beaches were beautiful and the Hotel rates a 10 in my book. Don't stay here, it's cheap for a reason. I have learned, you get what you pay for, and having said that. The hotel owes me for staying there. P.U. Please, go some where other then here. I hope I have saved at least one person from making the same mistake that I have.Our Ocean view room, consisted of looking at the miniature golfcourse right outside our patio door. The building needed paint and upkeeps! Run!! To another Hotel!!!! I wouldn't let my dogs sleep at this hotel! GROSS! GROSS! GROSS!

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: panamapam2910
Reviews.Content: I just read recent reviews concerning Hawaiian Inn. WE LOVE the HAWAIIAN INN!!! I literally raised my children on the beaches of Daytona with the help of the Hawaiian Inn! My boss buys me gift certificates for the Hawaiian Inn each year as a Christ-Mas gift because he knows we enjoy it so much. And all of you have given less than desireable reviews concerning your stay at the Hawaiian Inn -- please listen up: My daughter who graduates from college in May has requested a trip to Daytona to stay at the HAWAIIAN INN because she has such fond memories of it over the years and she wants to refresh those memories by a vacation to the INN!!!!! Everyone from the housekeeping staff to the pool boy and poolside bar attendant know our names, they are courteous, helpful and friendly. We don't own a condo, but we always feel at home and welcomed when we go. I say to you, pay a trip to the Hawaiian Inn and find out what a truely relaxing family vacation you can enjoy and look forward to returning to year after year. WE LOVE IT!!!!!!!!!!! Jim & Pam

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: But if you do, go thru the hotel itself and not private owners. If you rent from hawaiian 208 bring a hair dryer, iron, ironing board and extra towels. Definitly extra towels!!! If you have children, bring their beds! The "blow up" mattresses either don't hold air or don't have a plug. The toilet runs all night. We didn't have water for 2 nights and when it did come on it was hot so of course the commode did not fill and we had to fill it with water from the tub. This place is a nightmare and very UNtastefully decorated. Ugly.........

Reviews.Title: “Unit 206 Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn Unit 206 in June 04 for 1 week. We rented the unit privately from the owner (-----). It was the perfect unit, completely equipped with everything you could want or need. The unit had a separate bedroom and the living room had a futon and sofa. The furnishings, linens and kitchen appliances were all in great shape. The owner supplied everything, playstation, beach chairs, umbrella, beach toys, too much stuff to mentioned. I am a clean freak and the unit passed my inspection, A+. The balcony was furnished nicely and looked over the pool area and directly on to the beach. My children loved the both pools (very cleaned) and the arcade area. My husband and I enjoyed the daily beach music poolside and the Tiki bar. We didn't get a chance to check out the Luau show but plan to go next year. We agree the hallways and elevators could use some work but they were not that bad. The staff at the Hawaiian was very helpful with restaurant recomendations and directions. We would not hestitate from renting Unit 206 again. It was great. We plan to go again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad---like all places”
Reviews.Author: hermit
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hawaiian Inn in South Daytona.Right off the bat I will say it was adequate for the money.The rooms were spacious and our double had a small kitchen with pans silverware and a microwave.A safe is provided to keep valuables.Now for the downside--our carpet was a bit funky from a soaking from one of the recent hurricanes that blew through but after a day or so of airing out it got better.The comforters were old and a bit grungy looking--and were tossed aside the first day.Each room had a balcony that overlooked the ocean but with only a waist high divider seperating each one privacy could be an issue. 3 pools---outdoor,indoor and a kiddie pool are on the premises for those who rather not get into the ocean. All the pools were clean and clear.The minigolf course was a wreck and not worth using as was the shuttle board equipment.Plenty of chairs are provided for ocean and pool side lounging.A laundry room is also available for fools like me who dont pack enough clothes. At one time this hotel must have been spectacular with all the palm trees and bamboo furniture but 35 years or so of operation with little maintance has taken quite a bit of the grandeur of this place away. If you are like us and just use a hotel in Daytona for sleeping then this place is adequate.If however you are looking for bright and shiny and new this place wont appeal to you.However as of now ,Oct 2004,a lot of the bright shiny places are wrecked by the hurricanes and not open while this old stone and concrete hotel is up and running. Would I stay here again? Probably -if only to save money to have more to spend eating and seeing the sites of Daytona.Next time however Ill bring my own comforters.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and down-hill from there!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our vacation in June of 2004! It was BAD! The air conditioner would not cool our room, the furnishings were awful, windows filthy, and the drains in the bath were S-L-O-W!! When we arrived and there was a box fan on the check in desk,I was fore-warned! Don't even think of eating at the grill by the pool--- we walked in and right back out! Nasty! The carpet in the corridors was wore out and only one elevator worked!! This might have been a nice place when it was built in the 60's, but it is way,way past its prime!!! We will never stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel we've ever stayed in our life!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please take our advise and choose another hotel for your stay. This hotel is old and aweful!!! The pictures look great but do not be deceived like we were. When we first arrived our hotel room door would not open. We went down to the front desk three times to have the card corrected before we could get in our room. The maintenance guy had to work on our door for 2 hours. While were waiting the two hours we heard the guest next door screaming and fighting. Shortly after the cops arrived. The environment is not kid friendly. Lots of people drinking. The beds were swaying in the middle like boats. The only good thing about this hotel was the ocean front view. We decided to move to another hotel after staying two nights in this dump. We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn right next to the Boardwalk (walking distance to everything) at a cheaper rate. The Boardwalk Inn was great. I almost forgot....We bought post cards and stamps from the Hawaiin Inn gift shop and mailed them from the front desk. When we got home from our trip we asked our family and friends how they liked the post cards but they never received them. Please research well before choosing a hotel in Daytona. Most of the hotels are run down unless their near the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “What a shock!”
Reviews.Author: TLP
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hawaiian Inn for 2 nights in May-an Oceanfront with Balcony, through Expedia. My husband and I were looking for a nice, peaceful place to relax and enjoy the Florida sun. Let me just say-the photos and descriptions on the website are NOT even REMOTELY accurate. This is a depressing and dirty hotel. As soon as we entered the lobby, I knew we had made a mistake. An exhausted woman at the front desk was fielding phone calls and trying to assist a LONG line of wet, sandy, hot and irritated guests. There seemed to be no airconditioning-just an ancient ceiling fan that wasn't doing the trick! When we finally were helped-we asked to see the room first-before checking in- and Thank God! First we squished down a depressing mustard-yellow hallway, on a filthy carpet, soaked with at least an inch of water! The room was depressing and shabby, reeked of smoke and when we pulled back the grimy curtains to see our "balcony" we found a grubby patio right on the miniature golf course-with several players practically on top of us! We were very disappointed and there was no way we were going to stay there! The woman at the front desk was very nice when I explained it just wasn't what we were looking for, and did not charge us for cancelling at the last minute. But the saga did not end there; we had a hellava time finding a decent place to stay in Daytona Beach! We are not snobs, and a simple room is always fine, but CLEAN is mandatory. I've been reading some of the other comments here about Daytona Beach Hotels and I would have to say: "Beware!" The hotels are cheap, for a good reason. We looked at many other hotel rooms and found the same things described on this website-bugs, dirt, sandy and wet elevators, hallways smelling of urine, grimy curtains and bedspreads etc. We eventually stayed at the Hilton which was expensive, but spotless and comfortable, with a gorgeous balcony right on the beach. (I was very surprised to see some negative reviews here about this hotel!) We ended up loving Daytona Beach and people were extremely friendly to us, but hopefully Daytona's hotels will clean themselves up!

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Daytona Beach it was an interesting experience shopping for a decent place to stay while sticking to a budget and hoping for the best! We chose the Hawaiian Inn after reading the various reviews, and stayed there from August 1-6. We did go through a private owner so did not really have to deal with the staff at all. The room was keyless entry, so we did not even have to check in or out which was nice! We stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 2nd floor directly over the pool. It was decorated cute; it was stocked adequately with more than what we even needed or used, and everything was in good working order. There was no screen door to the balcony, but we did not find that to be a major problem. The view was really nice. The only thing I can think of that we might have been able to use would have been some sort of drying rack for the towels since we did not have the benefit of receiving fresh towels everyday. There is access to washers and dryers, however. It is true that the hallways could use a little sprucing up, but for the most part the place has a nice atmosphere with the Hawaiian theme, and the grounds seem to be very well kept. The lounge chairs that are set up directly over the beach area are especially nice for just listening to the surf even in the evening. Overall, we thought it was a great place to stay, right on the beach for a decent price, and we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Love Daytona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking the trip and then reading the reviews, I was very nervous on what to expect. But all and all the stay was acceptable. The people were very pleasant, the pool was nice, the beach beautiful. Some reviews complained of loud music. We had a room on the end, overlooking the beach and pool area. We stayed 1 week and only seen and heard any music once on Saturday afternoon and it was very pleasant. The singer had an excellent voice and excellent choice of music. Granted the room could of been cleaner and the stove upgraded but we had a kitchen and we had a balcony overlooking the beach so we cleaned the bathroom and kitchen and enjoyed ourselves. The elevator was warm, so we used the stairs when we could. The hallways were warm and some had an odor but it was bearable. If your room is acceptable and the people are nice, then thats all you need. Enjoy the balcony over the beach as we did, enjoy the pool, the beach and then get out and enjoy the rest of Daytona. The only difference in the pictures basically is the kitchen isn't as nice as shown. But you make the best of what you have and enjoy! I cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Private owners are great!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Go through hawaiian208 This party rents about 20 units, and they are all in excellent condition. She checks the units herself once a month, and anything that is wrong, she immediately notifies the owner. The rates are about $100 lower than the front desk, she's friendlier, and you get a sure bang for the buck! There are always extra amenities in her units, like Playstations, sterios, and metal detectors. If something is wrong, she's right on it. We've stayed at the Hawaiian since we've been married. We always come up for our anniversary, and we've NEVER had a bad unit yet! Granted, the hallways could stand a little freshening, but the hotel tries their best to stay on top of everything. For the money, I think this is the best place on the beach, with the most amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After booking a room I was shocked to find that the reviews here were awful. I thought "all no, what have I done, our trip will be lousy". I was just hoping that it wasn't all as bad as it said here. This is what I found. Upon arrival the staff was very cordial and smiling. Ask if we could check in early they said, "no problem". Ask if we could check out our room first, they said "sure, no problem. Our room was nice and cool. we had room 302. It was on the end and we has a fabulous view. We return to the lobby and checked in only to find they had overcharged us an extra room. They made the adjustment, gave us a refund and apologized for the accident. Our rooms were nice and the shower was good, the appliances worked. The in-room safe was locked when we got there but when we called the front desk, they sent someone up in just a matter of minutes. He was very pleasant and asked if there was anything else he could do while there. We thanked him and he said, "no problem". Housekeeping was very nice and always helpful. We had asked for extra towels and their response was, "no problem". RECOMMENDED IMPROVEMENT AREAS The elevaters were small and warm but not unbearable. The golf course was a little worn, and a bit of repair was needed. Overall, This place was nice, not four star, but nice. The people were very friendly. Remember, after you been on the road all day, you are the one who probably needs to be patient. I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for something that is moderately priced, who has kids, and is looking for something affordable. It was clean, the pools were nice and well maintained, the food at the hotel was okay and priced reasonably. I would definately go and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our recent stay at the Hawaiian Inn in Daytona Beach. We rented directly from an owner and had a very nice room with ocean front balcony. The pool was very nice and had a DJ there a few days during the week that made for a fun and relaxed atmosphere. The on site miniature golf is nice and gives the kids a little something to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Waited in line for at least 45 minutes to check-in. The lobby was not air-conditioned. It was cooler outside than inside the hotel. Lobby is deceiving and is not representative of the room. When we did check in and went to the room, the first thing you notice was the foot of the bed resting on the floor (no legs). The entire mattress was slanted. There were plastic (not even silk) flowers wrapped around the headboard. The carpet was grungy. There was no screen on the balcony door, so you could not open the sliding door to hear the ocean because creatures would enter the room. The hotel did allow us to cancel our reservation without charge, however, we still would not recommend this hotel. Dated June 16, 2004

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hawaiian Inn. Very Important to check room out. We found that our air conditioner did not work well. The front desk found us a better room. We were on the first floor. The pool was right outside our door. We had a private picnic table outside our door. We mostly come in the winter months and this resort has one of the best indoor pools that we have found. It was nice to be there in June, but more rain than I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a has been property do not be mislead by nice pictures. The staff is barely friendly the whole place looks like it could use a face lift. We where plannin to stay a few days and the best part of our stay was leaving the very next morning. The rooms where barely clean the beds very old and should have been changed many years ago, the linne was even worst. The pool area was littered with garbage and the pool water was so grey we got out of it and never returned. When I voiced my concern it was clear my comments did not want to be heard. If you set a low standard for yourself then this is the place for yo but my recommendation stay away you will thank me for it.

Reviews.Title: “Website very misleading”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to start this saying, Do not believe everything you see on their web-site. The lobby was okay and the pool area was wonderful, but it all stopped there. We had planned a trip of a life time. Started planning back in January 04. We took the family to Disney World and to Daytona Beach. The room we had was terrible. It smelled, the tub did not drain, we had had a kitchenette, the dishes were dirty, I had to wash them before we could use them. The bed was very questionable. The sheets did not fit, every time you moved they came off. The pillows did not have pillow cases on them. I called the front desk to tell them and it took for ever. The mattresses were wore out. When you and someone else got in you rolled to the center cause there was a hugh whole in it. The patio door lock was broken and someone rigged something that sort of worked, the patio door didn't shut completely either. The door to the room didn't shut unless you slammed it. We had towels for four people but one wash rag. I had to go to the front desk to get them. The elevator was so small you and the luggage carrier wouldn't fit, we were afraid to get on cause it was so old, it wasn't air conditioned and very hot. If it broke down someone would die from a heat stroke before they could get you out. I would absolutley with out a doubt not recommend this hotel to any one. !!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were part of a group. We rented private and it was wonderful! Not all parties had as nice of a room. After seeing 2 other rooms rented by other members of our party, I will only go back to the same room. No parties had the supplies we found in our room. We had very nice quality bedding-linens-dishes. There were supplies in the kitchen for us. We found coffee, filters, creamers, foil, cleaning supplies. REAL kitchen utensils-nice pots-nice kitchen towels. There was shampoo and soap and GOOD conditioner. This was obviously a 2nd home and was well taken care of. We were very happy with our room. Our kids loved the pool and games. Our room was above the mini golf course and the ocean view was spectacular. Enjoyed sitting on our balcony for hours watching the waves. We come to The Hawaiian Inn every year. I have already reserved my room for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rented a 4th floor unit from private owner in May 04. Great unit, beautifully kept, direct oceanview and it looked like it was just redecorated and it felt very home-E. We really enjoyed the the oceanview from the balcony, we had coffee while watching the sunrise. The resort was nice, we enjoyed the pool, there was entertainment, but I was glad that our room was not near the pool---it would have been too loud. The common area near the front desk was nice, but once you got to the outer common areas it was obvious that it was clean, but could use a refresh. The weekend breakfast buffet for $9.00/ person was a joke!! Go ANYWHERE but there---you could do better with a hotdog from 7-11. We would definetely come back, renting thru private owners was the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “The lowdown on Hawaiian Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hawaiian Inn is a nice older property south of the real rundown shacks on A1A. It is not a Hyatt or Sheraton resort, and is not priced like one. While we didn't book thru a private owner, (which, after talking to people and researching on the 'net is the only way to go for price) we has a nice room and a great time! Here's the secret...BEFORE YOU ACCEPT THE ROOM, ASK FOR THE KEY AND CHECK IT OUT!!! We got there before check-in time, and they said they couldn't tell us what room we'd be in. DON'T STAND FOR THAT!! Keep buggin' em, and they'll tell you. I was lucky enough to find the maid in the room next door, and she showed me the room. Then, TIP THE MAID IN ADVANCE!! She fixxed us up w/ 7 pillows, a new spread, an extra blanket, etc. The next morning we left her a small tip, and offered her pop and/or coffee from our fridge, and were treated like royalty. We were there in late March, and there was a DJ by the pool from noon to five...so if you don't like medium volume music, stay away..but the pool is great. Don't go for the breakfast in the resturant, but go 12 blocks north to the Denny's. Great food, very reasonable. Bottom line is: Rent from owner, but if you don't, check out the room B-4 you check in, and tip the maid in any case

Reviews.Title: “1st time decent/2nd time TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, we had a girls weekend out 2003, mothers day and all in all had a decent stay and the room was adequate. We just stayed there (4 moms) the Weekend of may 14th for 2 nights. Our room was plenty big but.............our sheets were dirty when we pulled back the spread with hair, crumbs, etc and looked very wrinkled as if the bed hadnt been changed from the previous customers!!! We called and a man who obviously never had changed a bed in his life came up and attempted to change two double beds with the help of my friend and I . (He wasnt quite sure what to do). Maid Service NEVER came to change towels, change sheets, vacuum, empty trash, give us more toilet paper, tissues - nothing! We finally had to call the front desk (which took many many times of calling before they answered) to ask for towels. One hour later I called again and the front desk person said that someone already said that they had delivered us towels. Believe me, we didnt have them. So, we finally got them. The tub didnt drain so we were wading in our dirty water. The food in the little restaurant in the hotel is awful and very cold and over priced - 9.00 for the cold buffet and a coffee!!!! The decor is old and the carpets are very very dirty!!!!!! We never did find the ice machine. Luckily, we didnt pay and go see the Luau show which is 27.95 for adults!!!! Our deadbolt lock was only partly there - dont know where the rest was. Now, that being said - the beach view was wonderful and the pool was very big with a kiddie pool right by it. I would say to stay on the 3rd to 5th floor so that you would get a view. Didnt have any trouble in the parking lot though parking was hard to find - the hotel(as were most of them) booked. We didnt enjoy making our own beds and changing sheets on a Moms Weekend Out!

Reviews.Title: “Rent from private owners”
Reviews.Author: flaorbust
Reviews.Content: I think that there are a lot of unfair statements made by people who have rented from the front desk, and it makes the private owners look really bad. The majority of the units there are really gorgeous, both studios and one-bedrooms alike. Granted, the building has been around for awhile, but the atmosphere is one of fun, relaxation, and pure enjoyment! My suggestion is to go online and look at many of the vacation websites where the private owners are listed. (I'm not allowed to put the sites in my text, but there are literally hundreds!) We rent from the same party consistently. She has 20+ units that she rents from other owners, and always has the cleanest, nicest rooms w/extra amenities. One of the units even has a metal detector, and we were fortunate enough to find several hundreds of dollars of "missing/lost" jewelry. The rates are always much lower than the front desk (by at least $100!), and the service you get is so much more personal! We go to Daytona at least 5 times a year, and I'd never stay anywhere else but the Hawaiian Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: raymo5558
Reviews.Content: We went for Labor Day weekend 2003. The "oceanfront room" barely had a view of the ocean. It had a funky smell and my husband slipped in the shower (fortunately he was ok). The worst part was when I went to get the camera out of our truck. Sometime during the night our vehicle had been vandalized. A tire was slashed and one side had been keyed. Over 15 cars had been hit, some worse than ours. When I went to the front desk, they gave me a form and said they knew about it. They never contacted any of the guests to let them know what had happened. I would never stay there again, management seemed very unconcerned about our experience.

Reviews.Title: “This could be a great place.. but take your time in picking a room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The inn was okay until we got to our room. we booked a suite with an ocean view and recieved a view of the pool bar and no ocean view. second our sleeper sofa was broken and had to get a roll away and sleep on the couch. 3rd we were next too the dryer and washer room with a horrible gas smell but it covered up the body odor smell in the room. the coffee make was broken but they did replace it promptly. they also let us check in 3 hours early. the mini golf was a blast, the restaurant pool side was okay, the pool side entertainment was great good young musician. the INN could be a great stop if it wasnt overbooked and you could really choose your room. last the lobby breakfast restaurant was a joke it was terrible. this IS NOT owned by the hotel though. wont go again but wouldnt say dont go either.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was absolutely terrible! It smelled like a bathroom, the carpets were stained, the beds were the most unsanitary, the hallways were the equivalence of a jail cell, and the maids might as well not have been there because they did nothing anyway.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My two girlfriends from school and myself went to Daytona Beach for spring break, we decided to stay at the Hawaiian Inn, based off of what we saw off the internet, when we got down there, the only negative aspect of our 5 day stay was that it took nearly three hours for us to get checked in, but the hotel made up for that, once we got to our room. The room was clean and we had a perfect view of the ocean and the outside pool, I suggest that if you decided to stay at this hotel pay the extra money for a oceanfront studio (our room number was 532), there was a clean kitchen fully equip and what every we asked for from the front desk we got in good time. The cleaning service, came everyday and clean our room, and NO we did not share our stay with any form of creepy crawlers. the highlight of the hotel was the outdoor pool and when it was cold it was still good because we just went to the indoor heated pool, outside was a bar that had the best margaritas! We are definitely planning another spring break down there but we are going to stay on north atlantic avenue closer to the clubs, the hawaiian in is on south atlantic and a better location for family.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went for Spring Break 2004 and got our reservations through Expedia, but when we got there they made a lame attempt to find our reservation, said we didn't have one then finally found it. Our room was ok, the shower was so hard that it overflowed the bathroom, and the toilet didn't flush unless you held it down for 10 seconds. The maids came twice the whole trip and we had to make the beds ourselves. When my friend asked the maid to empty our trashcan and handed it to her she said to her "See what we have to go through". We waited 30 minutes for an extra pillow then called again and they finally brought it after another 15 minutes. The closet door was off of the hinge when we came in and had to have some on come in and fix it. When we went to check out the worker made us pay for 5 nights when we only stayed 4. We had already paid 90 dollars through Expedia for one night and she said it was there charge. We were, needless to say, less than pleased. Just a warning...and we won't be going back!

Reviews.Title: “LovEd It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: IT was great... I definatly liked the indoor pool, heated, it was a great place for my kids. Very Clean rooms and good service.. We will definatly be back this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in #432. It was clean and very nicely furnished. The beds and spreads appeared to be new & in great shape. It was on the corner oceanside/poolside. If you are from FL you know you will see bugs once in awhile. Sugar ants, roaches are part of the life here especially with lots of rain, no matter how clean you are. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: OHgirllovesflorida
Reviews.Content: Always rent from the private owners here. I go through Hawaiian208 because she knows which are the cleanest and best units, and her rates are usually $100 less than the front desk rates. Her unit is the best in the house, as she has triple amenities compared to other units! There's a Playstation for kids, a metal detector to use on the beach (we found keys, money, and costume jewelery), vcr, cd player, kitchen island, and every appliance imaginable...even a Foreman grill!I would never book through the front desk again. We had one unit in which the couch smelled like vomit! I was so happy to have met this lady, I didn't know what to do. We have returned for 4 years now, and will continue to do so for many years to come! She's the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews on here to make my decision as to where to stay in Daytona. With so many hotels and horror stories it was hard to decide what was good and what wasn't. We stayed at the Hawaiian Inn Aug 1 -Aug 10,2003 and we thought it was very nice. We are in our early 30's with 3 children. When we first go to our room we noticed the door was broke and rusty and it wouldn't lock. We talked to the front desk with in a 1/2 hr maintenance man was there to fix it. My husband had already fixed it (it was off the track). He was very nice and willing to fix anything else if need be. The lobby smells a little musty. Out side that we had a great time. The pool was clean and the deck around it was clean and spacious. The carpet in the room looked and felt like new. Our maid was wonderful! She cleaned our room everyday, ran sweeper,changed a comforter when asked. No it is not a luxury hotel, but it was clean (which is the most important thing to me), friendly, in need of some minor repairs, but what hotel doesn't. Pool side band was great too. I loved the old songs. Not too loud just nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best part of our trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We traveled all the way from KY and this was by far the best place we stayed. The room was all we expected it to be. The view was fabulous. If you want to stay on beachfront, this is the place. It is convenient and affordable. I just wish we had bought timeshare here instead of Grand Seas Resort, which has turned out to be the biggest mistake of our lives.

Reviews.Title: “Stay some place else!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I chose this place because it had the most favorable ones..... BAD CHOICE! Stayed for one night only! Staff was unfriendly, elevator did not work properly, some type of bugs were in the bathroom, paint was falling off the wall, stains were on the bedspread...do I need to say any more????? Spend the extra $$ and go to Ormond Beach. Nicer hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I also stayed in room 419 but from the August 9th-12th. Everything seemed good. The only problems were that the front desk seemed to run out of towels easily. The view is amazing, facing the ocean in the center of the building giving a full view of everything. Just take your own shampoo/conditioner/soap/towels, for the towels they have (When they do) are small and useless for laying down on.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hawaiian Inn. We had a great time. I do have a few tips. There isn't enough chairs by the pool so you have to get up at 7am to save a chair. Bring extra towels. Most of the chairs are dirty on the back or broken. The hotel doesn't provide coffee,tea bags,shampoo nor conditioner. And if you arrive early dont plan on checking in until 3pm. This summer is a busy time for them. In certain rooms the kitchen is in your bedroom. I guess you can have breakfast in bed without getting up. The view is excellent, staff is nice, and the rooms are clean. The corners rooms oceanfront are the best. You have a ocean and pool view.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. When my family and I walked into the room (419), we were so delilghted. The room was beautifully decorated, clean, spacious, and actually smelled clean. The pool area was beautiful. The Tiki bar was nice, the children could get slushies, and the burgers and hot dogs were delicious. They have a wonderful gift shop with reasonable prices. The vacation was just perfect because of such PERFECT accomadations. We couldnt have asked for a nicer place. Give it a try!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hawaiian Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2301 South Atlantic Ave., Daytona Beach, FL 32118
